loans.name: Monowara

texts.en:
Monowara, a very young woman of 21 years, lives with her husband Jainul, 39, and 2 young sons in the small village of Baroghoria in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri in their own house.  She attended school up to grade five, whereas her husband studied up to grade three.  One of her sons goes to school and the other is below school-going age.

Monowara's husband is engaged in an agribusiness on their own inherited land. The income is not sufficient to manage all the household expenses. Manoara has been running a business selling milk for the last few years. She has one cow, which she uses for selling milk to the people in her locality.  She has become famous for providing good quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She needs to improve her business to improve her family's financial condition.  So she wants to purchase one more cow.

She has come to know about BJS (Kiva's partner) and has taken a loan from them. This will allow her to buy a cow. She is hopeful this loan will bring positive changes in her business and she will earn additional income to give a decent lifestyle to her family and a proper education to her children.

In the future, she wants to construct a brick-built concrete made house with the profit.

Monowara is grateful for her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a cow.

loans.name: Elmei

texts.en:
This 30-year-old businesswoman is from Gotocan Diot, Ozamiz City. She is Elmei and earns a living through her little sari-sari store. This is how she supports her family. Fortunately, Elmei's store is located in a populated place where there is a good sales turnout.  In need of capital, she reached out to PMPC for a loan to purchase additional products to sell.

Elmei hopes that she will be able to expand her business and save more for her future.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en: Primitiva is 61 years of age and lives at Cabungaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Primitiva has been a member of the PMPC-Ozamiz Branch for three years. She requested a loan to buy goods for her sari-sari store like noodles, bread, candies, beverages, etc. Primitiva hopes to sustain her store to continually support her family and to save in case of an emergency.

loans.use: to buy goods like noodles, bread, candies, and beverages

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en: Marietta is 53 years old and lives at Gotocan, Ozamiz City. She is married with two adult children. To earn a living, Marietta has a sari-sari store, which sells rice, noodles, shampoo, cigarettes, candies, etc. She requested a loan to buy basic commodities to sell. Marietta hopes to save more for her future life with her family.

loans.use: to buy basic commodities to sell

location.town: Ozamis-P3 Gotokan Daku, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occid

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is 59 years old and lives in Catadman, Ozamis City. She is married and has three adult children. Lydia opened a sari-sari store which sells items like sacks of rice, noodles, shampoo, cigarettes, candies, etc. She requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy materials for her house renovation. Lydia hopes to save more for her future life with her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her house renovation.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en: Erma is a hardworking mother from Sindangan. She is 44 years old and has a sari-sari store in their barangay. Her children help her tend the business. She signed up for membership with PMPC a few years ago and has enjoyed the benefits of being a member in good standing. In need of financial assistance, Erma reached out for a loan to pay for tuition fees for early enrollment. Come June, her eldest child is entering college. Erma smiles at the thought of sending all of her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria, age 39, is married and comes from Sindangan, Philippines. Victoria likes to cook and bake a variety of snacks. PMPC supported her by providing the capital to start her snack vending business. She sells her baked goodies around their barangay and she is able to help the family survive. She gives her best efforts to making delicious snacks to make a good income. 

She is now trying to expand her business and has decided to venture into a little restaurant. Now that her daughter is entering college, she applied for a loan for the tuition and other school fees.  With her extra income, she wishes to send all her children to school so they have stable careers.

loans.use: to pay for tuition and other school fees

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is married with three children. She is 43 years old and lives in Libertad, Bajo, Sinacaban in the Philippines.

Elvie sells assorted products to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns 2,000 PHP doing this type of work. She requested a loan of 50,000 to restock her store with basic commodities.

Elvie has been a member of PMPC for one year and in the future, Elvie hopes to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Jurinda

texts.en:
Jurinda is married with three children. She is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines.                       

Jurinda is a farmer and grows corn crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. She requested a loan to pay for five sacks of fertilizer.                                                              

Jurinda has been a member of PMPC for two months and in the future, Jurinda hopes to harvest more corn crops.

loans.use: to pay for five sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is a businesswoman from Poblacion, Sapang Dalaga. She is 52 years old and married with one child. 

Teofila engages in selling a variety of seafood and has a monthly income of 5,000 PHP. In need of capital, she joined Paglaum. She applied for a loan to pay for kilos of seafood to sell. She hopes and prays that her business progresses well so that she can provide an education for her only child and help support her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to pay for kilos of seafood to sell.

loans.name: Copin

texts.en:
Copin earns a living offering reflexology services.  She is 67 years old, married and lives in Sindangan. She is well known for the nice quality of services she offers. Her service is self-sustainable and has become profitable, with a net profit of about PHP 5,000 per month.
  
Copin is seeking a loan to purchase raw ingredients for snack vending. She wants to venture into another source of income. This is a regular loan and will be repaid in a few months.  In her two previous loans, she has never had a delinquency. She is very diligent and loves accuracy, which only adds to effective management of her venture.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for snack vending

loans.name: Juvitha

texts.en:
Juvitha is 41 years old, married, and lives at Caputol, Aloran. In order to earn a living, she decided to raise pigs on her own. She has contacted Paglaum for her capital needs. She applied for a loan to buy bags of feed.
 
She hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to her husband's income. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to purchase feed.

loans.name: Claudita

texts.en:
Claudita is 52 years old, married and a resident of Sindangan, Philippines. Starting with an amount of 3,000 PHP, she opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from receiving financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and she enjoys the benefits given by the co-op. She became a member in April 2011 and has taken out previous loans. 

Now Claudita is applying for a new loan to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities. In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart, and she will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Maria Tessie

texts.en:
Maria Tessie is 53 years old, married and a resident of Sindangan, Philippines.  She is a businesswoman selling a variety of basic commodities. Her start-up capital came from Paglaum and she has maintained the status of being a member in good standing.

Because she wanted to buy additional inventory for her store, Maria Tessie requested a loan from Paglaum MPC in the amount of 5,000 PHP. She wants to purchase cases of soft drinks, and kilos of rice to sell. Aside from the financial assistance she receives, Maria Tessie also enjoys other benefits like insurance and savings. She hopes that with Paglaum's help, her patience and her own hard work, she will be able to sustain her chosen business.

loans.use: to purchase cases of soft drinks and kilos of rice to sell.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 47 years of age and is a resident of Tuyabang Alto, Misamis Occidental. She is married and busies herself tending her little retail business from which she and her husband earn a living. With their business, they meet many challenges, but they realized that it is good to face the challenges rather than get discouraged. 

Annabelle and her husband work hard in selling. With their savings, they welcome the idea of expanding their business. They have requested a 7,000 PHP loan from Paglaum MPC to purchase additional basic commodities. Annabelle will buy canned goods, laundry soap, oil and sugar. She and her husband feel assured of Paglaum’s support, should there be a need for working capital in the future. She smiles at the thought of seeing their children get their own diplomas one day.

loans.use: to purchase additional basic commodities.

location.town: Oroquieta-Tuyabang Alto Oroquieta City Misamis Occ

loans.name: Adella

texts.en:
Adella is 52 years old and is very responsible with her household obligations; she has always been known to provide the best for her family. She currently has a retail business selling bags of sand and gravel. This is how she supports her family.

Adella wants to increase sales. Consequently, she has requested a loan that will enable her to pay for stock of sand and gravel to sell, so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: to pay for stock of sand and gravel to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia earns a living through buying and selling whole nuts. She is 55 years old, married, and lives in Aloran. She is known for the retail business she has in their barangay. She has already purchased enough stock to sell. She wants to have more to earn more. 

Virginia is seeking a loan of 3000 PHP. She would like to use the loan to buy whole nuts for retail sale. This is a regular loan that would be repaid in few  months. In her previous loans, she has never had a delinquency. Virginia is very diligent and loves accuracy, which only adds to the effective management of her venture.

loans.use: to buy whole nuts for retail sale.

loans.name: Adeliada

texts.en:
Adeliada earns a living by offering manicure and pedicure services. She is 55 years old, married and lives in Dolipos Alto, Oroquieta. She is well known for the nice quality of service she offers. Her business is self-sustainable and has become profitable. She has already purchased some new manicure sets and has been able to make savings from her business.  

Adeliada is seeking a 10,000 PHP loan. She would like to use the loan to purchase special items for foot spa services. This is a regular loan, and would be repaid in few months. In her two previous loans, Adeliada has never had a delinquency.  She is very diligent and loves accuracy which only adds to effective management of her venture.

loans.use: to purchase special items for foot spa services.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette, age 51, is happy tending her little store. She is married and lives in Oroquieta City. The store is her means of earning a living to support her family. Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood so she makes promising daily sales. She keeps running the store well even though there is increased competition from other stores. She believes that with PMPC's support, as one family, they will sustain and beat the competition.  

Bernadette has reached her 4th year being a member of Paglaum MPC. She applied for a loan to purchase additional stock of bags of rice, cases of soft drinks, noodles, canned goods and sugar. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. She has confidence that she can maintain the status of being a PMPC member in good standing. She is a hardworking mother and wishes to sustain the store and afford a good education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of rice, soft drinks, noodles, canned goods and sugar.

loans.name: Beatríz Alejandra

texts.es:
Beatriz de 23 años de edad,  es una joven que estudio bachillerato,  actualmente está acompañada el esposo se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería  en esta relación a procreado 1 hijo. 

Beatriz   por el momento se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar,  el esposo está por salir de viaje ya que le salieron los papeles para viajar a otro país pero Beatriz quiere seguir el mismo oficio que el esposo realizaba que es la ganadería, esto lo hará con la ayuda del suegro. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar tres terneras.  Esto le ayudara mucho ya que el esposo saldrá del país,  ella trabajara junto con el suegro cuidando las vacas ya que actualmente tiene tres, les da mucho ingreso quiere comprar más y tener esa fuente de ingreso esto lo lograra con esfuerzo de andar en el campo con este ganado

Los sueños es poder tener unas vacas lecheras y cuando venga su esposo poder comprar más ganado.
texts.en:
Beatriz, is a young 23-year-old woman who studied until the end of high school.  Her husband works in agriculture and livestock.  Together they have one son.

At the moment, Beatriz dedicates her time to doing the housework.  However, her husband is about to leave the country because he has received his papers meaning he has to go away.  Beatriz wants to continue working with his livestock while he is abroad, with the help of her father-in-law.

She is asking for a loan to buy three cows.  This will help her a lot as, with husband out of the country, she will be working with her father-in-law looking after the three cows that they already have.  They get a lot of income from having these cows, so she would like to buy more, and walk round the fields, looking after this cattle.

Her dream is to have some dairy cows and when her husband comes back; to buy some more livestock.

loans.use: to buy three cows.

loans.name: Álvaro Manuel

texts.es: El señor Álvaro es un campesino que se ha desempañado toda la vida como agricultor más específicamente como cultivador de plátano, actividad que le ha  ayudado al sostenimiento de su numerosa familia puesto que tiene una esposa con 7 hijos y la crianza de estos no es nada fácil, tiene que emplear un cuota de sufrimiento, sacrificio y tiempo muy alta pero anda de esto le importa con tal de que su familia no le llegue a faltar nada y siempre que llegue este una esposa y unos hijos recibiéndolo con una gran sonrisa, ya superada la etapa de cría de sus hijos decidió comenzar a emplear todo su empeño en su negocio dado que lo quiere hacer crecer por ellos solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como pesticidas, fungicidas, semillas etc., para el mantenimiento y expansión de sus cultivos
texts.en:
Alvaro is a farmer who has worked all his life in agriculture growing bananas.  This profession has allowed him to look after his large family; he is married and has seven children.  Raising all these children is hard and he has to put in a lot of hard work, sacrifice and time, but he doesn’t mind as it is important for him that his family are never in need of anything.  He loves coming home to a happy wife and children.

As his children have grown up a little, he has been able to dedicate some more time to his business which he wants to expand.  For this reason, he is asking for a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as pesticides, fungicides, seeds, etc.  With these he will be able to maintain and expand his crops.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as pesticides, fungicides, seeds, etc., for maintaining and expanding his plantations.

loans.name: Pedro César

texts.es:
Pedro de 31 años de edad, es un joven que estudio bachillerato general, salió hace cuatro años no ha podido encontrar trabajo, él se ha dedicado a trabajar en la agricultura para sobrevivir, por el momento solo depende de él su mamá quien se esforzó para que estudiara nadie más depende de él.

Pedro se dedica a la agricultura desde  hace cuatro años, antes trabajaba pero en menor proporción por sus estudios, ahora trabaja de lleno así como también trabaja como jornalero cuando hay espacio, el lugar donde trabaja está a medio kilómetro de su casa, por el momento nadie más se involucra en su trabajo por lo que él trabaja de 7 a 1 de la tarde todos los días.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a credicampo, es para comprar seis sacos de fertilizantes y una novilla pequeña para que crezca con la idea que si el cultivo no le va bien con la ternera la vende y paga y si le va bien buscara que le quede y de ahí hacer su crianza es asi que Pedro invertirá el dinero lo cual será una gran satisfacción.  

En el futuro Pedro su sueño más grande es tener animales, vacas porque de ahí hay una forma de hacer dinero vendiendo la leche todos los días, otro sueño es que tendrá su familia y quiere estar preparado para tener de donde hechar manos con otros ingresos, para que su familia no sufra tanto quiere ser un padre de familia responsable.
texts.en:
Pedro, 31, is a young man who studied until the end of high school.  He finished four years ago and was able to study thanks to his mother, who is now the only person who depends on him.

Pedro has been working in agriculture for these four years.  He used to work part-time when he was studying, but now he works full-time, offering himself as a land laborer whenever there is a need.  He works half a kilometer from his home and for the moment he works alone, starting at 7 am and finishing at 1 pm every day.

He is asking for a loan from Credicampo to buy six bags of fertilizer and a small cow.  His idea is that if the crops don’t provide him with enough income, then he can raise the cow and sell it to pay the money off.  If he does make a success of his crops, then he will look for a way to keep the cow and raise it.  This investment will be of great satisfaction to him.

In the future his dream is to have more animals, such as cows, because they provide a way of making money by selling milk every day.  Another of his dreams is to have a family and he wants to be prepared by having a few jobs which he can turn to when he needs some income.  This will mean that his family don’t have to suffer and he will become a responsible father.

loans.use: to buy six bags of fertilizer and a small cow.

loans.name: Eudiel

texts.es: Eudiel tiene 35 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y se dedica al cuido de peceras desde hace mucho tiempo. Su esposa se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos y juntos mantienen la economía del hogar. Eudiel desea reparar las condiciones del techo de la vivienda dado que con el paso  del tiempo se ha deteriorado y se encuentra en mal estado. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y polines y así proceder a las mejoras lo antes posible.
texts.en: Eudiel is 35 years old and lives with his wife in his own home. He has taken care of fish tanks for a long time and his wife runs a cleaning service. Together they are able to maintain the household costs. Eudiel would like to repair the roof of his home since over time it has deteriorated and it is now in bad shape. For this reason he is applying for a loan from FUSAI which he will invest in the purchase of galvanised sheets of iron and lumber so that he can go ahead with his home improvements as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanised sheets of iron and lumber to repair the roof of his house

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a 44-year-old member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative from Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She industriously engages in her farming activities.  She is married and she personally takes charge of the family farm, and her children work with her as support. The farm is doing well although sometimes she experiences ups and downs as with any business. Vivian sees these highs and lows as a normal situation for her. Sometimes they have business losses, sometimes a good return. 

Now Virginia sees a good opportunity to expand her business. She is requesting a loan from Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for capital to pay for land preparation. She deeply wishes for a good education for her children and for them to have businesses on their own one day.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a 41 year-old member of Paglaum MPC from Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She earns a living through buying and selling coconuts. She is a widow who supports her and her children through this business. 

She reached out to Paglaum for financial help to buy whole coconuts to sell. She wants to have more inventory to earn more income. Francisca hopes to sustain her business so that she will be able to continuously support her children.

loans.use: to buy whole coconuts to sell

loans.name: Turad

texts.en:
Turad is 27 years old. He lives with his mother and brother in a sector in Jordan called Zarqa. Turad is currently studying for a Bachelors in Engineering and is in 3rd year. He also works as a personal driver for students. His brother is a student as well. 

Turad is depending on himself financially after his fathers' death and is trying to support his family. But his income is not enough to cover the fees for his studies. For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay his semester fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar system.

loans.name: Adam

texts.en: Adam is 21 years old and lives with his parents and 3 siblings in a sector in Jordan called Madaba. He is a university student majoring in Space Engineering, and he is in his second year. Adam wants to support his family after graduation by finding a job in his field of study, and he doesn't have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. Because of that, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 19 years old. He lives in a rented house in a sector in Jordan called Irbid with his parents and 3 siblings. Mohammad is a university student majoring in Accounting. He is planning to work in his field of study after graduation to support his family financially. He is now seeking a loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Santos Humberto

texts.es:
El señor  Santos Humberto   de 37  años  de edad vive con su conyugue, tiene 3 hijos que dependen de él,  tiene casa propia y se dedica desde hace 4 años al negocio de la venta de abarrotería en su negocio el vende lo que es detergentes, frescos, jugos, granos básicos, jabón, pastas, etc., sus clientes son los vecinos y los amigos que viene todos los días a comprar a su negocio. Don Santos es un hombre trabajador con deseos de salir adelante, El está solicitando el préstamo para compra de frescos, granos básicos, churros, verduras, pollo, jabón, aceite, manteca, condimentos y otros productos de consumo básico para su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito el mejorara su negocio y con las ganancias mejorar su calidad de vida.
Don Santos su sueño es mejorar su casa ya que desea repellarla y pulirla para vivir mejor.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2014.
texts.en:
Santos Humberto, 37, lives with his wife and three children, who all depend on him.  He has his own house and has been working four years selling groceries.  He sells detergents, drinks, juice, basic grains, soap, pasta, etc.  His customers are his neigbors and friends, who come every day to his store to do their shopping.  
He is a hard-working man who wants to get on in business.  He is asking for a loan to buy drinks, basic grains, crisps, vegetables, chicken, soap, oil, lard, condiments and other things that are basic food products.  With the help of the loan he will be able to improve his business and also his quality of life.
He dreams of improving his house, plastering it and finishing the walls.
San Lorenzo, Honduras – March 2014.

loans.use: to buy drinks, basic grains, crisps, vegetables, chicken, soap, oil, lard, condiments, and other basic products for his business.

loans.name: Rahma

texts.en:
Rahma is a 23-year-old lady living with her parents and 5 siblings in a sector in Jordan called Salt. 

She is a university student majoring in Administration Programs and she is in her 4th year. Rahma is only one step closer to reaching her goal of looking for a job in her study field in order to start supporting her family financially. However, as she doesn't have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es: Luis es un hijo de una familia de campesinos que no conforme con la actividad agricultoras se propuso a explorar otras alternativas de trabajo y con la ayuda de un hermano monto un negocio de venta y relación de celulares, actividad que fue aprendiendo y perfeccionando con la ayuda del hermano, su negocio lleva 10 años de operación y es el premio al esfuerzo, al buen trabajo y la humildad y empeño que ponen a la hora de arreglar un celular o vender uno, su negocio ya pro su amplio recorrido es un establecimiento posicionado entre los ciudadanos pero básicamente como punto de arreglo de celulares pues que no tiene mucho celulares para ofrecer, solicita un crédito para la compra de celulares de segunda mano los cuales organizara y los pondrá a un precio favorable de acuerdo a la economía del sector para que todas las personas gocen de este artilugio que es tan indispensable en la vida cotidiana, su mayor aspiración es abrir más sucursales y llegar a pueblos y veredas donde no cuentan con un local de este tipo
texts.en:
Luis is the son of a family of farmers who did not resign himself to farming life but set out to explore the alternatives on offer. With the help of his brother, Luis set up a store selling and connecting mobile phones, learning and perfecting this business with his brother's assistance. Thanks to his effort, good work and the humility and determination he puts into repairing and selling mobile phones, the store has now been open for 10 years. 

Luis's store sees many customers as it has a good reputation, but it is basically more of a point of repair for mobiles as he doesn't have many mobiles on offer to sell. This is the reason why Luis is applying for a loan to purchase second hand mobiles. He will collect them and price them reasonably according to the financial situation of his clientele so everyone can enjoy the gadgets that are so indispensable in our daily lives. Luis's biggest goal is to open more branches so he can reach towns and settlements that don't have these types of stores.

loans.use: to buy second hand mobile phones which he can repair and resell at an affordable price to match the financial situation of his clientele

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
El espíritu emprendedor de Ana Cecilia alumbra por toda su tienda en cuando se entra. Esta madre soltera de 44 años, trabaja diariamente para poder proveerles la mejor educación a sus hijos de 9 y 21 años, ya que desde que su esposo se fue a trabajar a Costa Rica, maneja sola el negocio de 4 años de venta de cosméticos, zapatos y ropa de segunda mano. El cual ha logado mantener gracias a otros préstamos con MiCrédito-KIVA.
Ahora Ana Cecilia necesita seguir incrementando sus ingresos, para ello, solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería como: ropa, zapatos de segunda mano al por mayor y utiles escolares, pues considera que al final de este préstamo se sentirá autosuficiente, pero sabe que en un futuro necesitará de otro crédito que siempre han servido de ayuda. Entre sus metas principales está seguir invirtiendo den el negocio y crecer como comerciante.
texts.en:
The enterprising spirit of Ana Cecilia lights up the whole of her store when she enters it. This single mother aged 44 works hard every day to provide the best education possible to her children aged 9 and 21. Her husband has left to work in Costa Rica. Alone, she has run her business selling cosmetics, footwear, and secondhand clothing for four years. She has managed to keep up the business thanks to loans from MiCrédito and Kiva.

Now Ana Cecilia wants to increase her income so she is seeking a loan to buy merchandise such as secondhand clothing and shoes in bulk, and school supplies. She believes by the time the loan period is over, she will be self-sufficient. However, she knows that in the future she may need another loan as they have always been a great help to her. Amongst her main goals is the wish to continue investing in her business and growing as a businesswoman.

loans.use: Buy merchandise such as secondhand clothing and footwear in bulk, and school supplies

loans.name: Eslam

texts.en: Eslam was born in 1966. She is a married lady living with her husband and daughter in a rented house. Her daughter is a diploma student majoring in graphic design, and she is in her first year. Her husband is a retired man, and his pension wasn't enough to pay for their daughter's upcoming semester fees. For that, Eslam has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase the quantity of clothes she has and to add houseware and accessories

loans.name: Edwin Ernesto

texts.es:
Don Edwin sus sueños son primero tener donde trabajar segundo tener una familia unida que en el futuro su esposa y sus hijos juntos tengan la capacidad de resolver las dificultades, y sobre todo enfrentar los retos para tener una sociedad más justa y sobre todo tener salud.

Edwin de 27 años de edad, es una persona que estudio bachillerato general con mucho esfuerzo por que sus padres son de pocos recursos, su compañera de vida se dedica a los oficios domésticos no tiene una fuente de ingreso,  ella cuida a sus dos hijos que todavía no van a la escuela por sus pequeña edad,  así es que su familia se conforma de cuatro personas que son para las cuales trabaja Edwin.

Edwin se dedica a la agricultura desde hace unos cinco años,  antes cuando estudiaba trabajaba como ayudante en un taller de mecánica de soldadura eléctrica,  pero el trabajo no era de agrado para la vista le hacía daño por lo que tuvo que dejarlo, vale mencionar que hoy por hoy no tiene otra fuentes de ingresos solo de la agricultura, el lugar donde trabaja está cerca de su casa por lo que viaja a pie a veces su esposa se involucra ayudarle en algunas cosas que no son muy pesadas, su horario normal son cinco horas diarias por la mañana y casi siempre otros quehaceres por la tarde en el mismo trabajo 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar cuatro sacos de fertilizantes de 200 libras que le ajustaran para fertilizar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz,  con ello estará asegurando los granos básicos para su familia, y en su calidad de vida por lo que como agricultor es su satisfacción tener como trabajar.

Sus sueños son primero tener donde trabajar,  segundo tener una familia unida que en el futuro su esposa y sus hijos juntos tengan la capacidad de resolver las dificultades, y sobre todo enfrentar los retos para tener una sociedad más justa y sobre todo tener salud.
texts.en:
Edwin is 27 years old and completed a degree with a lot of effort since his parents have scarce financial resources. His life partner attends to the household duties and does not have a source of income since she takes care of their two children who don't go to school as they are still too young. This is why Edwin is the one who works to take care of the family of four.   

Edwin has worked as a farmer for five years. Before that, while he was studying he worked as an assistant in a electric welding garage, but he didn't like this work because it injured him so he had to let it go. It is important to note that for the time being Edwin does not have any other source of income except what he makes farming. The place where he works is close to his house so he can walk there. Sometimes his wife helps him with some tasks that aren't too tiring. His normal work schedule is five hours a day in the morning, though he almost always has other duties to attend to in the afternoon. 

Edwin is applying for a loan to buy four 200 pound bags of fertiliser which will be enough for him to fertilise 7000 square metres of corn. With this he will be assured of having legumes for his family and a good quality of life since as a farmer this work will bring him great satisfaction. 

Don Edwin's dreams are firstly to have a place to work, then to have a united family in the future so that his wife and children will be able to solve their problems and mostly to overcome challenges to have a more just society as well as having good health.

loans.use: to buy four 200 pound bags of fertiliser which will be enough for him to fertilise 7000 square metres of corn.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en: Mila  is from the village of Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She has been planting and harvesting bananas and other crops to sell. Mila joined GDMPC and she gains access to financial services and it helps improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She wants the best for her children, so she always finds ways to provide for their needs. Recently, she took a new loan to buy organic fertilizer. She wants to have a better living in the near future with her family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa  has been operating a general store in their town of Sinacaban in Misamis Occidental. She is married with five children. Her husband serves as a barangay councilor in their community. She has been running her store to earn a living for more than six years. She earns well from this and she successfully repaid her previous loan used in her business. Recently, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. In the future, she wants to expand her business and be able to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy supplies for her coffee plants

loans.name: Araceli

texts.es:
La tradición familiar corre por las venas de Araceli, de 35 años, puesto que siempre se ha visto, como su madre,  de comerciante en su propio negocio. Por esta razón, siempre lucha contra mar y tormentas para poder terminar sus estudios profesionales y así establecerse como su propia jefa.  
Araceli no solo tiene la inspiración de su madre, quien ha trabajado toda su vida en su pulpería, pero que ahora es dependiente económicamente de su hija, también la motivan sus dos hijos de 9 y 1 año, pues considera que mediante su arduo trabajo, junto al de su esposo, quien labora como panadero, podrán ofrecerle la mejor educación a estos. De manera que necesita de un préstamo para invertir en granos básicos como arroz, maíz, azúcar u otros productos de mayor demanda. Cabe destacar, que esto le ayudará a vender más, aumentar sus ingresos y poder cumplir con sus dos metas principales, primero,  seguir creciendo con su negocio y segundo ahorrar para poder ofrecerle un mejor servicio a sus clientes mediante la remodelación de su espacio laboral.
texts.en:
Family tradition runs through the veins of Araceli, 35, which is why she has always seen herself as the shopkeeper of her own business, just like her mother. For this reason she has fought against all odds to be able to complete her professional studies and set herself up as her own boss. 

Araceli is not only inspired by her mother who has worked all her life in her own grocery store yet who is now financially dependent on her daughter, but is also motivated by her daughters who are 9 and 1 year old. Araceli believes that through her hard work, together with her husband who works as a baker, she will be able to offer them the best education possible. This is why she needs a loan to invest in staple foods such as rice, corn, sugar and other products in high demand. It is worth mentioning that this will help her to sell more, increase her earnings and achieve her two main goals: firstly, to continue expanding her business, and secondly to save money so that she can offer a better service to her customers by renovating her work area.

loans.use: to invest in staple foods such as rice, corn, sugar and other products in high demand

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta raises and grows pigs which she sells in town. She has had this business for more than seven years, and she earns a good income for the family. With her generated income, she was able to provide for her family and support her husband financially. 

Marieta took a new loan recently to buy feed in order to strengthen her pigs. Marieta is planning to expand her farm, hoping it will flourish and enable her to improve her children's lives.

loans.use: to buy pig feed.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is from the village of Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She plants and harvests vegetables for sale. She also raises pigs for sale and she earns additional income from this. She harvests her vegetables and delivers them weekly to the market in town. 

Marites joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services and it helps her to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Recently, she took a new loan to buy fertilizer and to finance farm cultivation costs. She wants to have a better standard of living in the near future with her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to finance farm cultivation costs.

loans.name: Adhi Jambu Mahila Swasahay Sangh Group

texts.en:
“Adhi Jambu Mahila Swasahay Sangh” is a group of local NGO MASS which is allowing people to create the means of enduring sustainable models for their families. The Self-Help Group (SHG) consists of 17 members from the village of Yallaparatti. It was started with an aim of empowering the members, both men and women, and helping them start their own micro-enterprises.  
 
Girija (28) is a young, energetic, enterprising woman. She is the leader of the group. She is married and the mother of two sons; her elder son is studying in 1st grade while the younger one is still a baby. She maintains the group records which includes loan amounts, repayment date and savings details.

Girija’s husband works as a laborer in the farms; he was the only earning member of their family until Girija started rearing goats, buffalo and poultry 15 years back. She wanted to share her husband’s responsibilities and started the farm with their savings. She is thankful to MASS as they trained her in animal husbandry. 

Girija now wants to expand her business for which she is seeking a loan of INR 15,000 to buy a buffalo. She is a dynamic lady who also speaks out and fights for the rights of woman in her village. She hopes the loan will empower her further and will help her attain more financial stability. 

The other members are requesting a loan for animal husbandry and a cycle repair shop.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna makes a living by managing their own farm and raising pigs to sell with the help of her family. She has been in this business for many years and earns a good income from this. She also manages their own farm growing and harvesting coconuts. 

Now she needs a loan to buy piglets and feeds in order to improve her business which is farming, their main source of income. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the quality of life she want to provide for the entire family.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feeds.

loans.name: Laylai

texts.en:
Laylai is 23 years old. She lives in Baqaa, Jordan with her family, which consists of nine members. Laylai is the oldest of her six siblings. 

She is currently studying for a Diploma of Nursery, and is in her 2nd year. Laylai is planning to further her studies by bridging to a university to get a Bachelor's degree so that she will be able work in her study field after graduation. As she doesn't have enough money to pay for her study fees, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for her daughter's upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Asmahan

texts.en:
Asmahan was born in 1967. She is a married lady living in an area of Jordan called Baqaa with her husband and 5 sons and daughters. 

She has been selling blankets for 3 years to support her husband to cover their children's needs. He works in a governmental entity. Now she is seeking a loan to increase the quantity of blankets and clothes she has to sell so that she will raise her profit.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and blankets for her business.

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan was born in 1970. He is married and a has 5 sons and daughters. He lives in an area of Jordan called Rsaifeh. Adnan has been trying his best to cover his children's needs by running his mini market for a year. 

He is now planning to buy a larger quantity of food products and to add new products that his customers have been requesting in order to raise his profit. But he doesn't have enough money to do so. Because of that, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more food products for his mini market.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud was born in 1987. He is the only son in his family and lives with them in a rented house in an area of Jordan called Madaba. Mahmoud is working in a barbershop, and after that he sells clothes at home with the help of his mother. 

Now he is seeking a youth loan to buy a new collection of summer clothes for his business.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of summer clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more antiques, clothes and blankets for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Liberato

texts.en:
Liberato owns and operates a piggery, raising pigs for sale. He has been doing this for seven years. He earns good income from this business and it enabled him to buy motorcycle to engage in a transportation business. 

He has successfully repaid his previous loan which he used in his piggery with his generated income. Recently, he took a new loan to buy tires for his motorcycle.

In the future, he wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy tires.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita owns and operates a transportation service to earn a living. She has been in her business for six years with the help of her husband. Their income provides enough for the family.

Esterlita gained access to micro finance services after joining GDMPC. The cooperative helps her to improve her ability to engage in business. Recently, she took a new loan to cover registration renewal and licenses.

She hopes to have a better future with her family in the future.

loans.use: to cover registration renewal and licenses.

loans.name: Romar

texts.en: Romar is married. He operates a fishing business to earn a living. After three years in this business, Romar is happy to say that it is helping his family make ends meet while the children are finishing their studies. He took a loan from GDMPC micro finance to buy fishing nets. In the future, he wants to improve the business to achieve his dream of having a better life with his family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en: Elvie owns and manages a farm planting and harvesting rice for sale and family consumption. In order to buy seedlings and manure fertilizer, she took a loan from GDMPC micro credit, where she has been a member since 2013. She hopes to have an abundant harvest in order to generate additional income for the purpose of renovating her house.

loans.use: to buy seedling and manure fertilizer

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin did not have the financial resources to finish school. Edwin raises pigs for sale while operating his own farm where he grows rice, work that he has done since he was very young. His father taught him this work since it was the only way they had to move the family forward. He also has a farm and he gets up early to go to the fields where he has his crops. When he finishes his work, he comes home to help his wife with the daily chores.

Edwin is requesting this loan from GDMPC to buy new seedlings and pay for fertilization costs. In the future, he wants to have a better house than he has now and to be able to give his family a better future. He is sure that he can achieve his goals with the help of these loans.

loans.use: to buy new seedlings and pay fertilization costs.

loans.name: Mylinda

texts.en:
Mylinda lives in Misamis Occidental with her family. She sell fish in their local community to earn a living and had this business for five years. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy more fish to sell. 

In the future, she wants to have a better house than she has now and to be able to give her children the education she did not have. She plans to expand her business by having her own stall in the market in order to gain more income for the future needs of the family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anie Clear

texts.en: Anie Clear is married and helps her husband to operate a transportation business. Her husband works for a living on their farm. After many years of running the transportation business, Anie Clear is happy to say that this helps her family a lot as they wait for their crops to be ready for harvest. She took a loan from GDMPC micro finance to buy new tires to replace the old ones. In the future, she wants to have a better life with her family.

loans.use: to buy new set of tires

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en: Saturnina has been engaged in various activities in order to make a living. She helps her husband work in their own farm, manages a retail store and raises pigs. She never gets tired of doing all this in order to provide for the family. Recently, she took a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional piglets to raise. She sells the pigs in town. In the future, she wants to improve the family's living situation.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets

loans.name: Elvis Oswaldo

texts.es: Elvis tiene 25 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hija de 10 meses de edad. Elvis se gana la vida trabajando como fontanero desde hace mucho tiempo. Junto a su compañera de vida quien lava y plancha ajeno mantienen la economía del hogar. Elvis ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de arena y cemento para repellar las paredes de la vivienda las cuales se encuentran deterioradas. Espera poder tener accesos a este financiamiento y poder así mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en:
Elvis, 25, lives in his own house with his common-law wife and 10-month-old daughter.  He has worked as a plumber for a long time and his wife takes in laundry and ironing, so together they cover the household expenses.

Elvis has decided to request a loan through FUSAI to buy sand and cement to plaster the walls of his house which are in need of repair.  He hopes to have access to this financing so he can improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy sand and cement to plaster the walls of his house.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a young entrepreneur who runs a barber shop in his village to make a living. For more than five years, he has earned well to sustain his living.  

He needs to buy cosmetics products used in his shop in order to improve his services. With the micro finance loan of GDMPC, his plan was realized. In the future, he wants to expand his shop to cater for his customers more comfortably. He wants to improve the business as well as the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics products used for his shop.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida  has been selling fish in her community to supplement her husband's income from driving. For many years, she has been earning a good enough income to cover their basic needs. Adelaida and her husband always find a way to augment their living situation. With their generated income, her previous loan, which she used to buy fish to sell, was successfully repaid. 

Recently she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy more variety of fish to resell. She wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy more variety of fish to resell.

loans.name: Sube

texts.en:
Sube helps her husband working in their farm growing crops and planting vegetables to sell in town to make a living. She also grows bananas on their farm. For more than six years, she has earned a good income, enough to sustain their daily needs. With her generated income, her previous loan which was used for farming was successfully repaid. 

She took a new loan recently to purchase organic fertilizer. She hopes to have an abundant harvest and use the profit to improve the general living condition of her family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Lyndie

texts.en:
Lyndie has been selling electronic load in her village for many years, earning well to sustain their living. She is accommodating all networks like Smart, Globe and Sun cellular. Her customers keep on coming for she treats them very well and befriends them, and not because of the business alone. By nature she is really good. With her income, she was able to repay her previous loan successfully. 

Recently, she took  a new loan to  purchase a big amount of cellphone loads for retail. In the future, Lyndie hopes to stabilize the business for a long period of time and plans to begin another small business to improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase a big amount of cellphone loads for retail.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine lives in Misamis Occidental with her family. She runs a general store selling goods in their local community to earn a living and started it more than three years ago. 

She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional stocks like canned goods, noodles and spices. She planned to expand her store in order to gain more income for the family needs.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like canned goods, noodles and spices.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is married and she helps her husband to manage their own farm to make a living. She has been harvesting and selling bananas and coconuts and earning well to support their needs. Aside from this, she decided to raise large cattle to sell in the future. The couple are doing this activity to increase their savings for they will sell the cattle when needed.  

In order to buy additional large cattle to raise, she has borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit. She hopes that someday their living situation will be improve and will be comfortable.

loans.use: to buy additional large cattle to raise.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline supports her husband by raising pigs to sell while he operates a transportation service in their community of Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. The couple wants to have a better living and they work hand in hand in order to make a living. With her generated income, she was able to successfully repay her previous loan used for her piggery. 

Jacqueline took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional piglets to raise. In the future, she plans to expand her business to gain more income and provide better living conditions for her entire family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to raise.

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.es: Saturnino de 50 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus hijos en casa propia, desde hace varios años de dedica a la agricultura su principal siembra es el maíz y los ejotes, comercializa en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, saturnino está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. para poder continuar con sus siembras y asi poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Saturnino, 50, lives with his wife and children in his own house.  For several years he has been involved in agriculture, mainly growing corn and beans which he sells at different markets near his home.

Saturnino is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, herbicides, etc. to continue with his crop activity so he can give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Mabel Cinthia

texts.es: La Señorita Mabel tiene 20 años y es soltera,  estudia la carrera  de licenciatura en contaduría pública  en uno de las universidades más reconocidas  de la ciudad de La Paz, la Señorita Mabel trabaja  para pagar sus estudios trabaja de empleada publica, este es su primer crédito que ha tomado con la institución,  la Señorita Mabel va a usar este préstamo para  distintos gastos  que implica el estudiar cómo comprar una computadora y pagar unos libros para sus  estudios  Superiores,  la Señorita Mabel enfrenta retos en su estudios que son falta de apoyo económico  por parte de sus padres y el tener que trabajar y estudiar es muy duro pero ella tiene ganas de seguir adelante superarse terminar su carrera y poder ejercer su profesión,  viven en la zona de Caranavi, su deseo es poder titularse lo antes posible para poder trabajar y así de esta manera poder tener más ingresos económicos para ayudar a su familia y a sus hermanos a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Mabel, 20, is single and studying toward a public accounting degree at one of the most renown universities in the city of La Paz.  She works as a public employee to pay for her education.  This is the first loan she is receiving from the institution.  She will use it to pay for for different educational expenses such as buying a computer and books.  

Mabel runs into challenges regarding her education such as a lack of financial support from her parents and having to work and study very hard.  But she is determined to get ahead and finish her degree and go into her profession.  She lives in the area of Caranavi.  Her goal is to graduate as soon as possible so she can work and earn an income to help her family and siblings to get ahead.

loans.use: To buy a computer and books.

loans.name: Simeona

texts.es:
La señora Simeona de 55  años de edad es madre soltera,  no tiene  hijos  que dependen de ella, radica en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, Valle al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 10  años  a la actividad de venta de tortillas de lunes a domingo, sus ventas son diarias y sus clientes son sus vecinos, amigos y personas que se dedican al negocio de restaurantes y hoteles.
Doña Simeona es una mujer trabajadora, honesta que con su esfuerzo de muchos años ha logrado hacer su propia casa  con este negocio  creció y le dio el estudio a sus hijos.
Doña Simeona está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de 10 cargas de maíz, 30 bolsas de cal, 05 carretadas de leña y 2 cargas de frijoles. Con el apoyo de este crédito ella mejorara su negocio y tendrá más materia prima almacenada para la temporada de lluvia.
Doña Simeona sueño es mejorar su casa.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2014.
texts.en:
Simeona, 55, is a single mother whose children are independent.  She lives in her own house in the community of San Lorenzo, in a valley in southern Honduras.  For ten years she has been selling tortillas Monday through Sunday to her friends and neighbors and to people in the restaurant and hotel businesses.

Simeona is a hard-working, honest woman who, through her efforts over the years, has been able to establish her own home and raise and educate her children with this business.

She is requesting a loan to buy ten sacks of corn, 30 bags of lime, five carts of firewood and two sacks of beans.  With the help of this loan she will improve her business and have raw materials stored for the rainy season.

Simeona's dream is to renovate her house.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - March, 2014

loans.use: To buy ten sacks of corn, 30 bags of lime, five carts of firewood and two sacks of beans for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction materials such as stone, cement, sand, zinc and wood for the door.

loans.name: Remberto

texts.es: Remberto vive en la comunidad de rancho grande él fue el tercer miembro de la familia  siempre su familia ha sido bien unida   el vivió con sus padres hasta cumplir su mayoría de edad  después él se dedicó en lleno a trabajar en los labores de agricultura  propiedades de su padre, años más tarde se casó y  procreo 9 hijos  todos ellos son mayores de edad   ya se saben valer por ellos mismos. él siempre se dedica a cultivar las manzanas de tierras que tiene y su esposa a los labores domésticos  en la comunidad no hay energía eléctrica  y se iluminan con candelas o candiles es por eso que él quiere hacer tramite de crédito  para comprar un pequeño sistema solar e instalarlo en su humilde vivienda
texts.en:
Remberto lives in a large ranch community. He is the third member of his family, which has always been very close. He lived with his parents until he became an adult, after which he dedicated himself in full to agriculture work on his father's lands. Years later he married and had 9 children, all of whom are now adults and know how to work for themselves. He has always worked growing apples on the lands he has, while his wife takes care of the domestic chores. 

In the community there is no electricity and they use candles and oil lamps for light. For this reason he wants to apply for a loan to buy a small solar energy system and install it in his humble home.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy system.

loans.name: Wendy Xiomara

texts.es:
La señora Wendy Xiomara de 31  años de edad es madre soltera,  tiene 2 hijos  que dependen de ella, radica en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, Valle al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 6  años  al empleo como cocinera y asistente de enfermería, en un hospital de la zona, ella es una mujer sola que lucha por darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
Wendy está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de cemento, arena, piedra, arenilla, hierro, ladrillos y para pago de mano de obra en su vivienda, ella solicita a Prisma-Kiva el préstamo numero tres y es una buena cliente que paga muy bien los préstamo, está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con estas instituciones.
Wendy su sueño es mejorar más su casa para darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. 
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2014.
texts.en:
Señora Wendy Xiomara is 31 years old and a single mother, with 2 children who depend on her. She lives in the San Lorenzo community, in Valle in the south of Honduras, where she has her own home. She has worked for 6 years as a cook and nursing assistant in a local hospital. She is a woman who fights alone to give her children a better quality of life.

Wendy is applying for the loan to buy cement, sand, stone, grit, iron and bricks, and to pay the labour costs for her home. She is applying for her third loan from Prisma-Kiva. She is a good client who repays her loans very well and is very happy to continue working with these institutions.

Wendy's dream is to improve her house to be able to give her children a better quality of life. 
San Lorenzo, Honduras - March 2014.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, stone, grit, iron and bricks, and to pay the labour costs for her home.

loans.name: Jose Rosember

texts.es: Jose de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo y su esposa el se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años siembra maíz y hortalizas, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Jose esta solicitando un crédito a INTEGRAL para la compra de insumos agrícolas como: fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, semillas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno donde desea realizar la siembra que es el que muestra la fotografía, para poder obtener mejores ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Jose is 34 years old and lives in his own home with his son and his wife. He has worked in agriculture for several years, growing corn and vegetables. With what he obtains from his sales he manages to pay some of his household expenses.

Jose is applying for a loan from INTEGRAL to buy agricultural supplies such as: fertilizer, manure, pesticides, seeds, herbicides etc. and to improve the land where he hopes to carry out the sowing, shown in the photograph, in order to be able to obtain better earnings and give his family a better quality of life without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, pesticides, seeds, herbicides etc. and improve the land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more pigs, vitamins and feed.

loans.name: Manuel Francisco

texts.es: Manuel vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, desde hace varios años trabaja en su propia parcela cultivando frijoles, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista  la comercializa en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, Manuel está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. así como lo muestra en la fotografía, con esto desea mejorar sus cosechas para obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Manuel lives in a house that he owns with his partner and two children. For a number of years Manuel has worked on his own land growing beans. When the harvest is ready he sells it in the surrounding areas. Manuel is applying for a loan in order to buy seeds, fertilisers, manure, anti-disease treatments, weedkillers (shown in the photo) and more. Manuel hopes that, with these items, he can increase his profits and offer his family more financial stability.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilisers, manure, anti-disease treatments, weedkillers and more.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en: Jimmy, who is married, provides transportation services in his village to make a living. For more than three years, he has earned enough money to provide for his family. Jimmy needs to buy new tires for his motorcycle to improve the services he provides to his customers. His wife operates a general store in order to earn additional income because they want to give their children a good education. With this micro-finance loan from GDMPC, his plan was realized. In the future, Jimmy wants to acquire a new motorcycle in order to expand his services.

loans.use: to buy new tires.

loans.name: Jenefer

texts.en: Jenefer earns an income from her gardening production business. She is from San Juan, Panaon, and has been gardening for more than four years, earning enough money to sustain her living expenses. Jenefer has successfully repaid her previous loan, which was used for farm fertilization. She always finds ways to augment her earnings. Recently, Jenefer took a new loan to finance banana replanting costs. Jenefer plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to finance banana replanting costs.

loans.name: Roario

texts.en: Roario owns and operates a retail business to earn a living. Roario has been in this business for more than nine years. She earns enough money to provide for her family's needs. Her husband's income from farming helps a lot with paying expenses. Her previous loan was successfully repaid. Recently, Roario took a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell in her store. In the future, Roario wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Amilcar De Dolores

texts.es:
Amílcar de 56 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer año de educación básica, por la distancia que había de su casa a la escuela no pudo seguir estudiando. Hoy se encuentra acompañado su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, de los cuatro hijos solo una vive con él,  que es la que depende en totalidad de ellos por lo que la familia la conforman  tres personas los otros viven aparte porque están acompañados.
 

Amílcar su negocio es la agricultura, desde hace unos 30 años un poco antes de acompañarse se fue a vivir con un tío quien le enseño como se cultivaba, hasta este momento no existe otros negocios solo el cultivo y dos Vacas que le dan un poco de leche que le ayudan a la alimentación, antes de dedicarse a la agricultura se  dedicaba a  pescar artesanalmente. El lugar donde trabaja está a diez minutos de su casa le acompaña solo un hijo a trabajar unas cuatro horas diarias, los otros viven retirados.


El crédito solicitado a Credicampo lo invertirá en la compra de cinco sacos de fertilizante de 200 libras para fertilizar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz.

su gran sueño es cultivar para tener los granos más básicos para la alimentación de su familia es así que estará ayudando al desarrollo de su gente,  tal vez en el futuro construir una mejor casa ya que es bien pequeña y necesita más privacidad y vivir dignamente.
texts.en:
Amilcar is 56 years old and completed up to third grade at school. Given how far he lived from the school, he was unable to continue with his education. Amilcar is married; his wife looks after the household chores. The couple has four children, of whom only one still lives at home. This last child still depends completely on Amilcar and his wife; the other three are in relationships and have their own homes.

Amilcar is a farmer. Thirty years ago - not long before he married - Amilcar went to live with an uncle who taught him how to grow crops. Since then he has not worked in anything but growing crops and looking after cows. The cows give a little milk which helps to feed the family. Before going into farming Amilcar was a fisherman. Amilcar works ten minutes away from his house. One son helps with the work for four hours per day, while the rest of Amilcar's children live further away.

Amilcar is applying for this loan from "Credicampo" in order to buy five bags of 200 lb of fertiliser in order to lay on 7000 square metres of corn.

Amilcar's big dream is to grow basic grains in order to feed his family and to help them to develop. In the future he would perhaps also like to build a better house as his current house is quite small. The family needs more privacy and to have a decent home.

loans.use: to buy five bags of 200 lb of fertiliser in order to lay on 7000 square metres of corn.

loans.name: Brenda Azucena

texts.es:
Branda, requiere más capital el cual le servirá para comprar blusas, faldas, pantalones y ropa interior femenina, de esta manera podrá mejorar las ventas y mayores ganancias con la que cancelara su nueva deuda y ofrecerá un mejor estilo de vida a su familia.
Con el crédito anterior ha mantenido su negocio funcionando y generando los ingresos que necesita para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Branda needs more capital in order to buy blouses skirts, trousers and women's underwear. With these items she can improve sales and earn higher profits in order to pay off this debt and offer her family better living conditions.

Branda's previous loan kept the business going and generated the necessary income for Branda to move forward with her business.

loans.use: to buy blouses skirts, trousers and women's underwear.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vitamins and feed.

loans.name: Sayda

texts.es: Es originaria de Waspam, tiene 31 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo de 8 años de edad que cursa su segundo grado de primaria. Cuenta con una experiencia de 4 años de ser docente. Desde hace aproximadamente 9 años vive en hacinamiento, en casa de un familiar, habita en una vivienda de madera y tambo, la cual es compartida por 7 personas. Con el propósito de tener su propia vivienda y que su familia viva de manera segura y digna solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar materiales para construir una pequeña vivienda de madera y tambo poco a poco: 20 láminas de zinc y clavos. Su sueño es tener una casa segura y con las condiciones básicas para la comodidad de su hijo. Quiere acondicionar también su casa con un inodoro, construir una  fosa séptica.
texts.en: Sayda is originally from Waspan. She is 31 years old and a single mother to her eight-year-old son, who is in second grade. Sayda has four years experience working as a teacher. For nine years Sayda has been living in an overcrowded house that is owned by a relative. Sayda lives in a wooden house with six other people. In order to have her own home and for her family to live in a safe and decent place, Sayda is applying for a loan in order to buy building materials to build a small wooden home. Little by little, Sayda will buy 20 zinc laminate sheets and nails. Sayda's dream is to have a safe and basic home for her son to be comfortable. She also wants to have a toilet in her house and install a septic tank.

loans.use: to buy building materials to build a small wooden home.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en: Trinidad has been selling baked snack foods in her local community to earn a living. Aside from this, she also helps her husband work on their own farm located in the village of  Tudela, Misamis Occidental.  She has successfully repaid her previous loan which she used to buy raw ingredients to prepare snacks for sale. She took a new loan recently to purchase organic fertilizer in order to improve her farm and wait for an abundant harvest. She hopes to improve her farm as well as to improve the general living of the entire family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Zenita

texts.en: Zenita is from Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She has been selling cosmetic products in the local community for four years and she earns well to sustain her family's living and was able to repay her previous loan successfully. Aside from this business, she also helps her husband operate their own farm. She needs farm improvements to produce more. Without hesitation, she took a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer to enhance her coconut farm. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand their living situation in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer to enhance her coconut farm

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en: Genelyn owns and operate a sari sari (convenience) store, selling grocery products in the local community. Doing this business for years helps her to engage in  more businesses like buying and retailing farm produce. She sells it in town in volume to gain higher prices. With her efforts and determination, she has successfully repaid her previous loan used for her retail store. To purchase more farm products to resell, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit.   In the near future, she dreams to have better living conditions and a complete family.

loans.use: to purchase more farm products to resell

loans.name: Villaluna

texts.en: Villaluna is a single entrepreneur from Pana-on, Misamis Occidental and runs a general store for a living. For more than four years in this business, she has been able to support her parents and save a portion of her profit. With her income, her previous loan used for buying goods was successfully repaid. Recently, she took a new loan again to buy grocery goods to sell.  She plans to expand her business and hopefully sustain it for a better future.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 44 years old and has two children. She owns a farm planting and harvesting rice for sale and family consumption. 

Catherine requested a loan from GDMPC, which she will use to buy seedling and manure fertilizer for the next cropping season. She hopes to have an abundant harvest in order to generate additional income for the purpose of renovating her house.

loans.use: to purchase seedling and manure fertilizer

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is married and lives in Misamis Occidental with her family. Her husband is a farmer and she helps him grow rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years to earn a living.  She also manages their own piggery business and she earns a good income from this. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy additional piglets. She plans to expand her pig's shelter in order to generate more income for the future of the family.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en: Isabel is a widow with five children who sells fish in their village to make a living.  She has been doing this for many years in order to earn well to support their needs. To buy more fish to sell, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit.  She has to be determined in her works to give adequate allowance for her students. She hopes that someday, her children will be successful in their career.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her workshop.

loans.name: Luzveminda

texts.en:
Luzveminda is 44 years old, married, and has two adult children. She lives in Misamis Occidental, Philippines. For eight years, Luzveminda has operated a rice and corn farm that meets the market primary demands.

Luzveminda requested a loan from GDMPC for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase fertilizer. She joined GDMPC to have easy access to financial services. In the future, she wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Melvin

texts.en:
Melvin is single and sells firewood in his village to make a living.  He started his business because he wants to help his parents improve their house.  

Melvin requested a loan from GDMPC, which he will use to buy more firewood to sell. He hopes to improve the general living situation of his family.

loans.use: to purchase firewood to sell

loans.name: Rosalle

texts.en: Rosalle is a 45-year-old mom with two children.  For a living, she owns and manages a piggery while her husband works abroad.  In order to buy feed, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit, of which she is a current member. She hopes to have a better income this year in order to generate additional income for the purpose of improving her business.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Domero

texts.en: Domero, a father of three, provides transportation services in their village to make a living. For more than six years, he earns well to provide for the family. His previous loan, that was used for buying spare parts and accessories, was successfully repaid.  He needs to cover licenses renewal costs to ensure services to his customers.  With the micro finance loan of GDMPC, his plan was realized. In the future, he wants to acquire a new motorcycle unit and use it to expand his services.

loans.use: to cover licenses renewal costs

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es: Marta vive en casa propia con su familia, desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de zapatos su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y también vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias y mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, Marta esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de zapatos por mayor y así continuar con sus ventas ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo e ingresos y así darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marta lives in her own home with her family. She has sold shoes for the last eight years, a business which she runs out of her own home as well as making sales as a street vendor in different towns and markets near her home. 

Marta is applying for a loan to buy shoes in bulk so she can continue making sales. This is Marta's only source of income and employment so she needs this loan to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy shoes in bulk

loans.name: Gerita

texts.en:
Gerita has owned a business operating transportation services for more than five years. She earns a good income from this business and also from farming. 

She bought tires with her previous loan, which was successfully repaid.  Gerita requests a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer to improve her farm. 

She wants a better living for her family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester owns and operates a farm to plant and harvest rice.  She sells rice to earn a living. 

For many years, she was able to sustain her living and had successfully repaid her previous loan used for farm supplies. To improve the farm, she took another loan to purchase organic fertilizer. She hopes to have greater return from investments and improvements. 

In the future,  Ester wants to improve her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn has operated her general store for more than seven years and earns enough to sustain her living. 

She had successfully repaid her previous loan used to buy goods to sell. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase grocery items to sell. 

She hopes to improve her business to ensure a better source of income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to sell/

loans.name: Andy Kim

texts.en:
Andy Kim has operated a transportation services in his community to make a living. He earns a better income from this business than other employment income.  He had successfully repaid his previous loan used to renew his licenses. 

He took a new loan recently to buy motor cycle  accessories.  He plans to acquire another motorcycle to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy motor cycle accessories.

loans.name: Sara Guadalupe

texts.es:
Sara, requiere de un nuevo crédito para comprar pollo, carnes, verduras, bebidas, condimentos, gas propano, pastas, entre otros materiales que son necesarios para elaborar la variedad de menús que ofrece a sus clientes.
Para Sara el crédito anterior fue de mucha ayuda para adquirir la materia prima con lo que su negocio ha crecido, ella ha mejorado un poco su condición económica, su familia se encuentra muy saludable y brindándole el apoyo para salir adelante.
texts.en:
