Sara requires a new loan to buy chicken, meat, vegetables, drinks, condiments, propane gas, pasta, and other ingredients which she needs to create a variety of menus to offer her customers.

Sara's previous loan was a great help to her in acquiring the supplies which she has used to expand her business. Sara's financial situation has improved a little, her family are very healthy and they provide her with encouragement to keep going.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat, vegetables, drinks, condiments, propane gas, pasta, and other items

loans.name: Candelaria  Del Carmen

texts.es:
Candelaria ofrece sus servicios de transporte de carga de una manera muy especial. No utiliza auto, ni mucho menos un camión, sino un coche jalado por un caballo, el cual obtuvo gracias a un financiamiento otorgado por KIVA Mi Crédito.  Este servicio le ha generado buenas ganancias y  dio pauta para que estableciera un pequeño negocio de venta de comidas  y refrescos.
Su esposo se encarga del servicio de acarreo y su hija le ayuda en la preparación de los distintos platillos que ofrece al público.  Candelaria desea que ambos negocios prosperen, por lo que solicito otro préstamo en KIVA Mi Crédito para la compra de aceite, leña  y masa, también continuará brindándole mantenimiento a su caballo. Todas las ganancias serán para mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Candelaria provides a freight transportation service in a very unique way. She does not have a car, or even a truck, but a horse-drawn carriage which she obtained thanks to a loan that was granted by Mi Credito and Kiva. This service has yielded a great income and has led her to set up a small store selling food and refreshments.  

Candelaria's husband is in charge of the carriage and her daughter helps her to prepare the different meals on offer to the public. She hopes that both businesses prosper, which is why she is applying for another loan with Mi Credito and Kiva to buy oil, firewood and dough so that she can continue to maintain her horse. All of her earnings will be put towards structural home improvements.

loans.use: to buy oil, firewood and dough

loans.name: Roushan

texts.en:
Roushan lives in the village Baroghoria in the district Jalpaiguri with her husband and three children (one son and two daughters). She is only 31 years old and illiterate, that is, she can only sign her name.  Her husband Jabedul, who has a primary education, is a farmer.  Two of their children are in school and are in grades 3 and 2 and the third one is too young.

Roushan is a homemaker, but also works in agriculture with her husband. When she comes back from the fields, she does the household jobs and takes care of her family.  They grow different vegetables in different seasons. It is the only source of income for them, but the small income is not quite sufficient to fulfill the basic necessities for the family.  Roushan is very energetic and hardworking.  She has decided to cultivate jute, which is a profitable crop.

So she has taken a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS to purchase seeds and necessary agricultural inputs to start cultivation. She hopes things will go well in this growing season so she can receive lots of revenue at harvest time. She wants to continue cultivating the land and be able to provide schooling for her children who are studying now.   

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for cultivating jute.

loans.name: Muktibala

texts.en:
Muktibala  is a young lady of 34 years.  She is married, a housewife and uneducated (can sign her name only).  She lives with her husband Sunil, aged 36 years, and two school-going children (one daughter and one son).  They are in grades 7 and 5.  They live in their own house at Baroghoria in Jalpaiguri district.

Muktibala's husband is associated with the business of cultivation of vegetables in their farmland.   He learnt to grow vegetables from a very young age by watching his parents. He gives his best effort to growing good vegetables to satisfy his customers and meet the family expenses. When harvest time comes, Muktibala helps him. But he can't fulfill all the basic needs of the family, so they want to cultivate jute in their farmland.  They have chosen this crop as it is a very essential crop, having a good demand in the market.

Muktibala is requesting a loan from BJS to purchase seeds, fertilizers and insecticides to start this business. She hopes it will be a lucrative business.

Her dreams are to continue helping her husband by improving the business, to support her children in improving academically, and start a grocery shop in the local market with the profit from her business.

She thanks BJS and Kiva for giving their support.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural inputs for cultivating jute.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy compost, seeds, fertiliser, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is married and works hard to support her family by selling rice.  Analie has been in this business for 3 years.

She requested 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

In the future, Analie would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Daramy

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Daramy. He is married and has one 12-year-old child. He has one additional dependent living with him.  

In 2007, Daramy established his tailoring business. He began his business because he wanted to improve himself and his family. He works six days a week and ten hours a day to earn a monthly income of  1,500,000 SLL. 


He would like a loan of 5,000,000 SLL to buy an industrial tailoring machine, which produces different tailoring designs. This will increase his number of customers, which will eventually increase his profit.  

In the future, Daramy plans to establish a tailoring school to train youth to become tailors. Daramy was not yet able to establish a school to train youth in tailoring, but from his profit, he was able to buy more tailoring materials and open another shop. 

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for a tailoring machine.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace's previous loan improved her living standards. It enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income .

In addition to her cereal selling business, Grace sells dry fish. She requested another loan from Yehu, which she will use to buy more stock of dry fish for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dry fish for her business

loans.name: Jehad

texts.en:
Jehad is a 28-year-old married man and a father of two daughters. 

He has a small store to sell cooking gas containers in order to support his family.  He is the only provider for them. He is known around the neighborhood since everyone gets their gas from him.  

Jehad seeks a youth loan to increase the number of containers in order to serve more areas than what he is currently covering.

loans.use: to increase the number of cooking gas containers he has to service.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima was born in 1966 and is married.  She has 5 children. Her husband is retired. 

She has a strong sense of responsibility and supports her husband to meet her children's needs. She has sold clothes from home for 2 years. She is seeking a loan to purchase a new collection of clothes in order to raise her sales volume.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of clothes for her business.

loans.name: Nariman

texts.en:
Nariman was born in 1968. She is a married woman living with her husband (a plumber) and her 6 daughters.  They live in a sector of Jordan called Salt. 

She has helped her husband to improve their living standards by selling clothes from home for 2 years. She seeks a loan to expand the number of clothes she sells, in order to raise her profit.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru: Светлана замужем. У нее взрослая дочь. Светлана ведет свой собственный бизнес. Светлана занимается продажей женской одежды на рынке родного города. Ее опыт работы в этом направлении 15 лет. Наиболее популярные товары: блузы, платья, пиджаки. Светлана ответственная и трудолюбивая. Светлана просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 30,000 гривен на закупку сезонной верхней одежды. Кредит поможет ей увеличить прибыль, а тем самым улучшить быт семьи.
texts.en: Svetlana is married and has a grown daughter. She runs her own business selling women's clothing at the market in her hometown. She has 15 years of experience and her most popular products are blouses, dresses, and jackets. Svetlana is responsible and hard-working. She has asked for a loan for 30,000 hryvnia to purchase seasonal outerwear. This loan will help her to increase her profits and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase women's seasonal clothing, including jackets and blazers

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Zainab.  She is married and has 3 children who are 17, 14, and 7 years old. 

In 2007, Zainab, established a provisions shop to sell drinks, sardines, mayonnaises, milk, and sugar. She began her business  to earn money to help educate her children. 

She works 7 days a week and 11 hours a day to earn a monthly income of 805,000 SLL. She would like 5,000,000 SLL to buy more drinks, mayonnaise , milk, luncheon meat and sardines.  Competition and the rainy season are her big challenges. This business has help her to raise her children.  

In the future, Zainab plans build her own house, a bigger shop, and provide a quality education to her children. She looks forward to using the funds to help her develop her business and save enough money for her retirement.

 She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drinks, mayonnaise, milk, luncheon meat and sardines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy powdered milk, mayonnaise, sardines, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Kotognogontala Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe KOTOGNOGONTALA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, et ont en moyenne 6 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KABOILA un village tout près de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur trente-cinquième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Madame AFOU debout à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes KOTOGNOGONTALA, fait la vente des  vêtements pour les enfants. 
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  2 balles de vêtements pour enfants au grand marché où elle est beaucoup sollicitée par sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits.  La revendre se fait en détail sur place et à KABOILA à une clientèle composée d’ homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne
texts.en:
The four members of the Kotognogontala group are married women with an average age of 45 years, and an average of 6 children each. The women mostly live in traditional families in Kaboila, a village near the city of Sikasso in the 3rd administrative region of Mali. They are on their 35th group loan with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso in order to better meet the needs of their customers. 

Afou is pictured standing furthest on the left in the photo. In the Kotognogontala group, she is in the business of selling children's clothing. She plans to use her loan to purchase nearly two bundles of children's clothing from the big market where she is much sought after by her customers due to the high quality of her products. She resells them at retail from her home and in Kaboila to a customer base made up of both men and women for both cash and credit. 

Afou hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 35,000 francs CFA, a portion of which she will use to pay back the loan and interest, and the remainder of which she will put into savings.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothes

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman with one adult child.  She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

For the past fifteen years, she has operated a retail shop to sell to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned the changing seasons and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking  oil. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking  oil.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a married woman with four children, three are in school and the other is too young. 

She owns a house without electricity or running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family. 

For the past three years, she has operated a kiosk to sell to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned fluctuating prices as her major challenge.  She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, sweets.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards, expanded her business, and helped her to earn a higher income.

She requests a loan to purchase rice and beans to resell. 

She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice and beans.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She would like to apply for a loan to purchase bales of clothes for her business. She thanks Yehu for their financial support

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for her business.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman with seven children, five of whom go to school; one is an adult and one is underage. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a kerosene selling business for the past two years. She cites transportation costs as her major challenge.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase gallons of kerosene for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of kerosene for resale.

loans.name: Fayzeh

texts.en: Fayzeh is a conservative lady, so she asked her son Omar to take her place in the picture. Fayzeh was born in 1956. She is married and has three sons and one daughter. Her husband is a security officer, and his income wasn't enough to cover his family's needs. For that, she came up with the idea of selling animals and birds at her house and marketing her business through the Internet. Now she is seeking a loan to buy new types of birds to sell in order to raise her profit.

loans.use: To buy new types of birds for her business

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is a married woman with four school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family. 

For the past three years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans and sweets for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans and sweets for resale.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es: Es originaria de Waspam, tiene 57 años de edad, casada con 7 hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es jubilado. Ella cuenta con una experiencia de más de tres décadas de ser enfermera. Con el propósito de mejorar su vivienda y que su familia viva de manera segura y digna solicita su segundo financiamiento para comprar materiales, para construir muro perimetral y mejorar el piso de su vivienda de concreto que ha construido poco a poco cemento, hierro, bloque y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es tener una casa segura y con las condiciones básicas para la comodidad de su familia en general. Quiere acondicionar también su casa en Puerto Cabezas.
texts.en:
Dina comes from Waspam. She is 57 years old and married with seven adult children who are all financially independent. Her husband is retired. She has over three decades of experience working as a nurse. 

Dina is applying for a second loan with the intention of improving her home so that her family can live in a safer and more dignified manner. She plans to buy materials to create a perimetre wall and improve the concrete floor of her home which she has built bit by bit. She needs cement, iron, and concrete blocks as well as money to cover labour costs. 

Dina's dream is to have a safe house in adequate condition for the comfort of her family. She would also like to renovate her home in Puerto Cabezas.

loans.use: to create a perimetre wall and improve the concrete floor of her home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more  food items.

loans.name: Malak

texts.en:
Malak was born in 1968. She is married and a mother of 7. Her husband is a driver. After Malak noticed that her husbands' income wasn't enough to cover her children's needs, she started selling blankets from home 8 years ago.  She found this business to be profitable. 

She seeks a loan to purchase more blankets so that she will raise her sales.

loans.use: to buy more blankets for her business.

loans.name: Marwa

texts.en:
Marwa was born in 1994. She is a married woman living with her husband (a salesman) and her  son. She has helped her husband to improve their living standards by selling clothes from home for 4 months. 

She seeks a youth loan to expand the number of clothes she is selling to raise her profit.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for her business .

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
Sabaly est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Darsalam 2 de la ville de Koutiala qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 43 ans et ont au moins 5 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels que, de Produits cosmétiques et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur dix septième prêt de groupe. 
Tata 2 eme assise de la droite vers la gauche  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des pommades, des crèmes, savons, lotions et fond de teint, au fur et à mesure auprès des grossistes  qu’elle vend,  en détail  à une clientèle diverse. Elle se procure au grand marché. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Sabaly comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 105 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Tata  compte réaliser  125 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Sabaly is a group of women who live in the Darsalam 2 district of Koutiala town. They live in extended traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives. They have an average age of 43 and at least 5 children. This group of women sell various items including beauty products. The members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program in order to expand their businesses. This is their 17th group loan.

Tata, the woman sitting second from the right, plans to use her loan to buy beauty ointments, creams, soaps, lotions and foundation in batches from the wholesalers at the grand market. She sells the products to a varied retail clientèle. Tata expects to make an average profit of 125 000 francs during this loan cycle, whereas the other group members expect to make around 105 000 francs. As well as using the profits to repay her loan, she will use part of it on her personal expenses and part of it to increase her business. She would like to strengthen her partnership with Soro Yiriwaso in order to avoid stock shortages.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio Cesar es un hombre muy trabajador, habita en el barrio La Tonga del municipio de Juigalpa, toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura y la ganadería en su pequeña finca que se ubica en la zona rural. Junto a su esposa han procreado 4 hijos de 8 a 16 años edad, quienes con el esfuerzo de Don Julio y su esposa Silvia que trabaja como docente lo han logrado. Julio solicita el crédito para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda a través de un cambio de zinc y el aseguramiento con puertas de madera.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar is a very hardworking man who lives in the town of La Tonga in the municipality of Juigalpa. He has spent all his life working in farming with cattle on his small farm in a rural area. He and his wife have had four children between the ages of 8 and 16. Thanks to the efforts of Julio and his wife Silvia, who works as a teacher, they have managed to get by. 

Julio is applying for a loan to improve the living conditions in his home by replacing the tin roof and installing wooden doors.

loans.use: to improve the living conditions in his home by replacing the tin roof and installing wooden doors.

loans.name: David Guillermo

texts.es: David es un hombre muy responsable en su hogar y muy trabajador siembre está buscando la manera de sacar adelante su familia, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol y  adicional a eso trabaja como jornal en  una finca cerca de su lugar de residencia, David esta solicitando a INTEGRAL un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas como: fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. para darle a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
David is very responsible at home and a very hard-working man. He is always looking for a way to provide for his family. He lives in his own house with his wife and his three children.

He is a farmer. He grows corn and beans and, in addition to this activity, he is a daily worker in a farm near his home.

David is applying for a loan at INTEGRAL to buy agricultural inputs, such as fertilizer, pesticides, etc. to provide his family with everything they need without limitation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She asks for a loan to purchase petrol for her business. She is grateful for the financial support she has received.

loans.use: to purchase petrol for her business.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad was born in 1980. He is a married man and  a father of 2.  He is the provider for his family and has sold and repaired heaters for 8 years. 

His business is profitable and he plans to expand it and purchase new materials for his shop. However, he doesn't have enough money to do that. Therefore, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman with four children. Three of her children go to school and one is underage. For the past year, Umazi has sold kerosene. Her major business challenge are transportation costs. Umazi lives in her own house without electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Umazi is requesting a loan to purchase gallons of kerosene to resell and to pay for transportation costs.

loans.use: to purchase kerosene to resell and to pay for transportation costs

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman with ten children, three of whom attend school. For the past two years, she has operated a kiosk, selling items to her neighbors and passersby. Umazi’s major business challenges are theft and seasonality. She lives in her own house without electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. Umazi decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Umazi is requesting a loan to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, bread, rice, beans, and cooking oil for her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, bread, rice, beans, and cooking oil

loans.name: Nadzuwa

texts.en:
Nadzuwa is married woman with eight children. Four of her children attend school and the others are adults. For the past three years, Nadzuwa has operated a grocery store, selling items to her neighbors and passersby. Her major business challenges are theft and seasonality. Nadzuwa lives in her own house without electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Nadzuwa is requesting a loan to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil. In the future, she dreams of establishing a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil

loans.name: Sigyongyaakadi Group

texts.fr:
Mme SAFIETOU est la représentante du groupe SIGYONGYAAKADI. Elle se porte bien. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Le plus âgé a 17ans et le moins âgé a 11mois. Les 03 vont à l’école. 
Elle vend des pagnes  et aussi des produits de beauté depuis 07ans. Mme s’approvisionne au marché du secteur 10.
 Elle veut s’acheter 03 pièces de pagnes.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut épargner. Elle ambitionne  acheter une parcelle et mieux entretenir sa famille.
texts.en: Safietou is the Sigyongyaakadi group representative. She is doing well. She is married and the mother of 4 children, the eldest of whom is 17 years old and the youngest, 11 months. Three of her children go to school. Safietou has been selling pagnes fabric (highly colourful and decorative West African cloth) and beauty products for 7 years. She gets her supplies at the Sector 10 market. She would like to buy 3 pieces of pagnes fabric. She wishes to save her profits. Her aim is to buy a plot of land and better provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy 3 pieces of pagnes.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 19-year-old single man from Gaza city. He lives with his family in a small house. For more than 10 years, Abdallah's father has run a dry-cleaning store in the city and Abdallah works with him when he comes back from college. Abdallah is studying economics and he would like to finish his study and earn a BA degree. 

Abdallah is requesting a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to buy a new laptop for his studies. He will use his loan to enable him to do his homework and reports easily. Abdallah appears in this photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 21-year-old single man from Khanyounis city. He lives with his family in a small house. Mohammad works in graphic design. Using his laptop, he works from his house and takes orders from local companies and firms. It is a good business and Mohammad earns a good income.

Mohammad is requesting a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to buy a new laptop for his work. He will use his loan to do his job better through using better computer programs. Mohammad’s loan will improve the quality of his work and increase his demand. He appears in this photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy furniture; a bed, a wardrobe and a dresser for his bedroom.

loans.name: Clara Del Carmen

texts.es:
Audaz, esa es la palabra exacta que define a Clara. Ya cuenta con su pequeña tienda de abarrotes, gracias su  esfuerzo  y  arduo trabajo constante. KIVA Mi Crédito desempeña un rol fundamental en su vida.  Esta institución la ha apoyado  desde que inició en este proyecto. Su esposo otro  pilar esencial, ya que se encarga de atender a todos los clientes que visitan su pulpería diariamente. 
Clara desea continuar ese mismo ritmo de ventas. Para lograrlo, optó por otro préstamo en KIVA Mi Crédito, que le facilitara el capital y podrá  comprar los productos que tienen más demanda en su pulpería, como granos básicos y licores. Además planea invertir en un tercer negocio que es la venta de comida. Las ganancias serán  a beneficio de sus hijos. Ella desea brindarles un futuro mejor y lleno de oportunidades.
texts.en:
Audacious. That is the exact word that describes Clara. She already has her small grocery store, thanks to her efforts and constant hard work. Mi Crédito has had a fundamental role is her life. This institution has supported her since she started her project. Her husband is the other essential pillar, since he is in charge of dealing with all the customers who come into her store every day.

Clara wants to keep up her sales. To achieve this goal, she applied for another loan at Mi Crédito, which will provide her with the capital so that she will be able to buy the most demanded products at her store, such as basic grains and spirits. She also plans on investing in a third business, selling prepared meals. Her profits will be destined to her children. She wants to provide them with a better future, filled with opportunity.

loans.use: to stock her grocery store with the most demanded products, such as basic grains and spirits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock her mini-market with new food products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a packing machine for her husbands' business

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada was born in 1977. She is married and has four sons and one daughter. Her husband is working at a governmental entity. 

Ghada has been supporting her husband financially by practicing her talent at home making a special Arabic type of bread called "Shrak" at her house and selling it in her area. Her neighborhood liked her bread and she started receiving larger requests from them. 

Because of that, she is now seeking to buy another oven where she can raise her productivity of bread in order to raise her profit.

loans.use: To purchase a new oven to make more bread

loans.name: Mervat

texts.en:
Mervat is a 25-year-old, married woman and mother to two girls and one boy. Her husband is a member of the military. 

To help support her family, Mervat started selling food, home products, and appliances, one year ago. Now, she is planning to add selling clothes to her business in order to expand her business and raise her profit. But, she doesn't have enough money to do so. 

Because of that, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to add clothes to her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a new refrigerator to keep the foods and drinks in a cold condition in the house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials, such as cement, wood, and bricks, in order to build the second floor of his a small house.

loans.name: Marlene Del Carmen

texts.es: Marlene vive en casa propia con sus padres, su esposo y sus hijos, ella se dedica a la siembra, cultiva maíz, frijol y arroz, comercializa sus productos en las agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos, con las ganancias que obtiene y con al ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gastos del hogar, Marlene está solicitando un crédito para la compra de herbicidas, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, herramientas, etc. para continuar con su trabajo y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marlene lives in her own house with her parents, her husband and her children. She is a farmer. She grows corn, beans and rice, and sells her products to local agencies that buy and sell basic grains.

With the money she makes and with the help of her husband, they manage to cover some of their household expenses. Marlene is applying for a loan to buy weed-killers, fertilizers, pesticides, tools, etc. to continue with her work and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy weed-killers, fertilizers, pesticides, tools, etc.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 27-year-old single man from Qalqilia city. He lives with his family in a small house.  

For the past three years, Mahmoud has had a shop for laundering clothing. Mahmoud appears in the photo while he was working. It is a very good business and earns a good income. His brother works as a construction worker with a low income. They cooperate to gather to provide the family with all that they need.

Mahmoud took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laundry machine for his store. By taking this loan, Mahmoud will be able to increase his productivity and also his income.

loans.use: to buy a new laundry machine for his store.

loans.name: Guadalupe Elizabeth

texts.es: Guadalupe de 33 años de edad vive en casa de un familiar con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace 2 años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela que la prefieren por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, Guadalupe está solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal para continuar con sus ventas y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Guadalupe, 33, lives in a relative’s house with her husband and her two children. She has been making and selling tortillas for a living for 2 years.

She runs her business in her home. She has a lot of customers who prefer her because of her good prices and the kindness she shows when selling her tortillas.

Guadalupe is applying for a loan to buy corn and lime powder in bulk, so that she can keep her sales up and provide her family with a better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy corn and lime powder in bulk.

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.ru: Добрый человек, который всегда старается улучшить условию проживания, и надеется на светлое будущее, нуждается финансовой поддержки. Ее зовут Мехринисо. Ей 51 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Так как она живет в сельской местности, так и имеет хорошую возможность для развития своего бизнеса, скотоводством. Она более 15  лет занимается скотоводством и имеет большой опыт по данной отрасли бизнеса. Благодаря хорошему состоянию скота, она имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Она хочет развевать бизнес и получать больше дохода. С полученного дохода он планирует улучшить условию проживания. Мехринисо запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для покупки скота для увеличения оборотного капитала. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: This good person, who always strives to improve her living conditions and relies on a better tomorrow, needs financial support. Her name is Mehriniso. She is 51 years old. She is married and is raising 3 children. As she lives in the countryside, she has a great opportunity to develop her business of cattle breeding. She has been practicing cattle breeding for more than 15 years and has a lot of experience in all aspects of this business. Thanks to the good condition of her cattle, she has her own loyal customers. She wants to expand her business and receive a bigger income. With the received income she plans to improve her living conditions. Mehriniso is requesting a loan in the amount of 7500 somoni to buy cattle to increase her working capital. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle to increase her working capital.

loans.name: Muntaha

texts.en:
Muntaha was born in 1979. She is married and is a mother of three girls and a boy. Her husband works at a governmental entity and, at the same time, works as a driver. But, his income wasn't enough to cover his children needs. 

Because of that, Muntaha decided to help him by starting to sell clothes at her house, one year ago. Her business became profitable and she decided to expand it by purchasing a larger quantity of clothes. 

Now, Muntaha needs to buy a new summer collection of clothes. But, she doesn't have enough money to do so. So, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of summer clothes to sell.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Because Khadija is a conservative woman, she asked her husband Nayef to take her place in the picture. 

Khadija was born in 1968. She is a mother of 1 boy and 2 girls. Her husband has been running his own mini-market, which is the only source of income for his family for 2 years. His mini-market is currently running out of products. He is receiving requests from customers in his area, but he doesn't have enough money to merchandise his mini-market with new products. For that, Khadija is seeking a loan to support her husband in merchandising his mini-market with new food products to sell.

loans.use: To help her husband merchandise his mini-market with new products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for her sewing business

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Madame Aminata, est âgée de 49 ans, elle s’active dans le commerce depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle est originaire du sud du pays et part chercher la marchandise elle-même dans cette zone qui est bien connu pour la qualité de leur produit. Aminata vend de l’huile de palme, des balaies  et divers autres produits alimentaires. Elle vend sur place chez elle, car elle est bien connue dans ce domaine grâce à la qualité de son produit et il lui arrive de revendre à des commerçants dans le marché. Elle participe aux dépenses de la maison, met un peu d’argent de coté afin de pouvoir réaliser un projet qui lui tient à cœur : celui de construire sa propre maison pour la mettre en location et avoir un revenu supplémentaire.
texts.en: Mrs. Aminata, 49 years old, has been working as a vendor for over 10 years. Originally she is from the south of the country. She travels to stock up on merchandise in that region, well known for the quality of its products. Aminata sells palm oil, brooms and various food products. She sells out of her home as she is well known thanks to the quality of her wares. Sometimes she resells to market vendors. She contributes to the household expenses and puts a bit of money on the side in order to realize her dream: to build her own house and rent it out so as to have additional income.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, brooms and miscellaneous items for resale.

loans.name: Manasio

texts.es: Es originario de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 31 años de edad, casado, tiene un pequeño hijo de 3 meses. Su esposa es ama de casa. Desde hace 15 años se trasladó a Waspam por motivos laborales. Cuenta con una experiencia de 7 años de dedicarse a la labor de enfermero. Actualmente, habita en casa de un familiar, en una casa de madera y tambo. Con el propósito de tener su propia vivienda, solicita financiamiento para comprar materiales, para construir su vivienda de minifalda de concreto y vivienda de 14*18 pies: 6 quintales de varilla de hierro, 20 bolsas de cemento, 15 libras de clavos, 200 baldes de arena y 186 pies de madera. Su sueño es tener una casa segura y con las condiciones básicas para la comodidad de su familia en general.
texts.en:
A native of Puerto Cabezas, Manasio is 31 years old, married and has a 3 month old son. His wife is a housewife. Fifteen years ago he moved to Waspam for work reasons. He has 7 years of experience working as a nurse. At present he lives in the house of a family member constructed from wood built on stilts.

With the goal of having his own house Manasio is requesting a loan to buy materials to build his house on a foundation of concrete and a 14 by 18 foot building. He needs 6 quintals of re-bar, 20 bags of cement, 15 pounds of nails, 200 pails of sand and 186 feet of wood. His dream is to have a solid house with the basic conditions for the comfort of his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for his house.

loans.name: Israel

texts.es:
El Joven Israel habita en el municipio de Achuapa departamento de león, una ciudad donde los habitantes se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. 

El Joven de 49 años de edad casado, cuenta con un hijito bajo su cargo, su esposa es estilista, cuenta con su propio salón de belleza en su casa de habitación, su hijo estudia en la primaria sus sueño es llegar a construirle su propio dormitorio, con lo poco que el gana mantiene los gastos de colegiatura y su esposa le ayuda con el sustento diario de su hogar.  

Desde hace cinco años ejerce el trabajo de técnico de campo en una de las instituciones del estado, pero son de sus sueños tener mejores condiciones en su familia ya que cada día mas va creciendo. 
 
Es de su gran necesidad que Ceprodel y Kiva le financie un crédito, para la compra de: Zin, Arena, Cemento y Ladrillo, esto le ayudaría mucho para construir un anexo a su vivienda. 

Se siente a gusto con este tipo de empleo porque le ha ayudado mucho en el desarrollo de una mejor vida con su familia.

Agradece con el apoyo que Ceprodel y Kiva le ha brindado y espera en Dios seguir recibiendo este privilegio.
texts.en:
Israel is a youthful man who lives in the municipality of Achuapa, in the department of León, a city where the inhabitants carry out a variety of commercial activities. 

This youthful 49-year-old is married with a small child. His wife is a stylist, and she has her own beauty salon in their home. His son is studying in primary school, and he hopes to build his own bedroom for him. With the small amount that he earns he pays for tuition and school costs, and his wife helps him with the daily household expenses.

He has been working as a field technician for a state institution for 5 years, but one of his dreams is to have better living conditions for his family, as it is growing more every day.  It is because of his substantial need that Ceprodel and Kiva would finance him with a loan for the purchase of zinc sheeting, sand, cement, and brick. This would help him very much in building an extra room for his home. 

He likes this kind of work because it has helped him to build a better life with his family, and he is grateful for the support that Ceprodel and Kiva have given him. He hopes that God will allow him to continue receiving this benefit.

loans.use: to purchase zinc sheeting, sand, cement, and brick.

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es: Pedro de 51 años de edad es agricultor siembra  maíz y frijol en su propio terreno desde hace varios años, vive en casa propia con su esposa y cuatro hijos, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, Pedro está solicitando un crédito para la compra de  semillas, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, etc. y mejora el terreno que es el que muestra la fotografía y así obtener mejores ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Pedro, 51, is a farmer who has planted maize and beans on his own land for many years. He lives in his own house with his wife and four children. With the income he earns from his sales, he his able to cover some of the home expenses. Pedro is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, pest control, etc. and to improve the land that is shown in the photograph and thus obtain better income and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, pest control etc. and to improve the land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, generator and electric scissors.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en: Hanan is a conservative lady, so she asked her husband to take her place in the picture. Hanan is 21 years old, and a mother of two boys and two girls. Her husband started selling fruits and vegetables using his car in his neighborhood two months ago, and this business became their only source of income. Now Hanan wants to support her husband in expanding his new business by purchasing more fruits and vegetables, in addition to boxes to store them. For that, she has applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables, and boxes to store them.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, table, and iron.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, iron and table.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, an over sewing machine and an iron.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase an electric saw.

loans.name: Oscar Eliodoro

texts.es: Oscar de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia, el se dedica a la agricultura su principal siembra es el maíz y frijol, comercializa en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Oscar está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y así continuar con sus siembras y poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Oscar, at 36 years old, lives in his own house. He is dedicated to agriculture and his main cultivation is corn and beans. He sells in the different markets that are found close to his place of residence. With the earnings he obtains from his sales he manages to resolve some of his home costs. 

Oscar is requesting a loan for the purchase of seeds, fertilizers, pest controls, herbicides among others and in this way can continue with his cultivation and be able to give his family a better quality of live without any limitation.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, pest control and herbicides.

loans.name: El Control (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito El Control está formado por 7 mujeres quienes son muy responsables y trabajan en diferentes actividades que les ha permitido mejorar la economía de sus hogares. Viven por la parroquia de Turi en Cuenca, esta parroquia se caracteriza por ser el mirador de la ciudad de Cuenca, es muy visitada por propios y extraños, su gente se dedica al comercio, agricultura y cría de animales.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Martha, tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 5 y 3 años de edad, su primer hijo  estudia en la escuela, su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
Doña Martha se dedica a laborar como empleada privada y también en los días de ferias se dedica a la venta de verduras y frutas de temporada. El dinero de su crédito es para la compra de frutas para crecer en su negocio. Su meta es tener un local propio en un mercado de la ciudad.
texts.en:
The credit group El Control is made up of 7 very responsible women. They work in different activities that have allowed them to improve their households’ finances. They live near the Turi parish in Cuenca. This parish is known for being a lookout to the city of Cuenca. It receives many visits from locals and foreigners. Its people work in commerce, agriculture and farming.

One of the members of this group is Martha. She is 28 years old and she is married. In her marriage, she has had 2 children, aged 5 and 3.  Her first child is in school and her husband works as a private employee. They don’t have a house, so they live in a rental home.

Martha also works as a private employee and on holidays she sells fruits and vegetables. The money she will get from this loan will be destined to buying fruits to grow her business. Her goal is to own a shop in a market in the city.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Carmen Beatriz

texts.es: Carmen de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Carmen esta solicitando un crédito para poder mejorar el terreno que es el que muestra la fotografía y comprar los insumos necesarios como abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, etc. y poder tener junto con su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Carmen is 34 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and children. She grows corn and beans and sells the product in the different markets located close to her home. With what she makes from her sales and with the help of her husband she manages to pay some of the household expenses.

Carmen is requesting a loan so she can improve the land shown in the photo. She wants to buy manure, seeds, fertilizer, pest control, etc and be able to enjoy a better financial stability with her family.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds fertilizer, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente de 28 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica a la agricultura principal mente a la siembra de maíz y frijol, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego salir a comercializarlos a los diferentes mercados, el cliente esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de  semillas, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, etc. y así obtener mejores ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en: The client, 28, lives in his own house with his wife and two children. He is dedicated to farming, mainly planting maize and beans. When his harvest is ready, he stores it in the silos shown in the photo to then go out and sell it at the different markets. The client is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, pest control, etc. and thus obtain better income and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Aisha Group

texts.en:
Aisha is a group consisting of five women from Sana'a, Yemen. They are requesting a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

Arwa is 26 years old and lives with her husband and her children in Sana'a, Yemen. She works as a tailor. She set up her business in her place of residence, two years ago. She started in her business as a tailor sewing all kinds of clothes for the people in her area. She started in her own business when she took a loan from AMB and purchased a sewing machine and some fabrics. She is very thankful for AMB lenders for their first loan. The first loan was the first step of Arwa's dreams. She decided to enlarge her business through purchasing the ready-made children's clothes, accessories and makeup  for her customers to purchase in her store beside the dressmaking business. She is very detail-oriented and does a very good job, allowing her to have the loyalty of many customers, friends, and neighbors. Arwa is asking for a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB to buy more fabric in different colors and prints, as well as thread, needles, buttons, and all things she needs in her business. She also wants to purchase different kinds of accessories, makeup, cosmetics in order to face all the demands of her customers.

Arwa looks forward to obtaining better profits to give her family a better qualtity of life. She hopes to furnish her home with all kinds of furniture.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics in different colors and prints, as well as threads, needles, buttons, and all the things she needs in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase items and goods for the shop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more goods, an air-conditioner, and to renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, meats, lunch meats, bread, sodas, coffee, and some school supplies such as notebooks and pens

loans.name: Jose  Horacio

texts.es: Jose de 57 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus hijos, desde hace varios años se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de maíz y frijol cuando ya esta lista la almacena en  los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego salir a comercializarlos a los diferentes mercados que se encuentran ceca de su casa, Jose está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y así poder tener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Jose, 57, lives with his wife and children. For many years, he has been dedicated to farming, especially planting maize and beans. When ready, he stores them in the silos shown in the photo and then sells them at the different markets found near his house. Jose is requesting a loan to buy seeds, organic and chemical fertilizers, pest control, etc. and will thus be able to have better income and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, chemical and organic fertilizers, pest control,etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente de 18 años de edad vive con sus padres en casa propia, el se dedica a la agricultura principal mente a la siembra de maíz y frijol, adicional a eso le ayuda a su padre en el cuido del ganado, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego salir a comercializarlos a los diferentes mercados, el cliente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de  semillas, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, etc. y así obtener mejores ingresos y tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: The client is 18 years old and lives with his parents in their own house. He works in agriculture, principally growing corn and beans. In addition to this he helps his father take care of the cattle. When the harvest is ready he stores it in the silos shown in the photo and later sells it to the various markets. The client is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, pest control, etc. so he can generate more income and together with his family have a better quality of living.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Bebelibeth

texts.en:
Bebelibeth is 56 years old, and lives in Palayan, Aloran Mis. Occ. She was gifted with beautiful children. Bebelibeth is the breadwinner for the family. She has experienced hardships, especially in raising her family. This industrious member finds herself plowing the rice field, planting vegetables, and other varieties of agricultural commodities. 

In need of additional working capital, Bebelibeth decided to join Paglaum Cooperative. She has received several loans already and recently requested PHP 5,000 for buying farm and garden fertilizer and paying labor costs for cultivating their land. Being a MIGS (Member in Good Standing) of the cooperative, she has been able to manage her income. She is able to provide for the daily needs of her family. Bebelibeth is very thankful, because if it were not for Paglaum, she might not have any savings at all nor be guided properly in her finances. She hopes to have capital someday to use for farming inputs.

loans.use: to buy farm and garden fertilizer and pay for land cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more mobile accessories and recharge cards.

loans.name: Rommy Isabel

texts.es: Es originaria de Waspam, tiene 43 años de edad, casada, tiene 5 hijos, dos cursan su carrera universitaria y 3 estudian su secundaria. Su esposo se dedica a alquilar pangan en el Rio Coco. Cuenta con una experiencia de 25 años de dedicarse a la labor de enfermería. Desde hace aproximadamente 23 años vive en una casa de concreto. Con el propósito de mejorar su vivienda y que su familia viva de manera segura y digna solicita su segundo financiamiento para comprar materiales, para mejorar su vivienda: 800 pies de madera, 10 láminas de zinc, pintura, 15 libras de clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es tener una casa segura y con las condiciones básicas para la comodidad de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rommy is a native of Waspam. She is 43 years old, married and has 5 children. Two of them study at university and the other three study at Secondary school. Her husband rents boats in the Rio Coco. She has 25 years experience working as a nurse. She has lived in her house made of concrete for about 23 years.

With the objective of improving her house and having her family live in a secure and dignified manner, Rommy is requesting a second loan to buy materials to improve her house: 10 zinc laminates, paint, 15 pounds of nails and to pay for labor. Her dream is to have a safe house with the basic conditions for comfort for her children.

loans.use: to buy materials to make improvements on her house.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en: Marlyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing net to sell. Marlyn has been in this business for 13 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net to sell.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rosalinda works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell kitchenware business in the Philippines and also earns income from farming vegetables. Rosalinda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional kitchenware to sell.

Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional kitchenware to sell.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma works hard to support her family. Wilma is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy boxes of fish to sell.

Wilma has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Wilma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: My

texts.en: My (pictured here), is 27 years old and lives in a Phnom Penh suburb. She has been married since 2007 and has two young daughters. My and her husband are farmers. In addition, they also raise ducks at home. When a duck is fully grown and lays eggs, My collects the duck eggs and takes them to sell in the local market. She wants to increase her volume of duck eggs for sale, so she has decided to apply for a loan to buy additional ducks.  My plans to purchase 200 more of ducks, which will cost 20,000 riel (about $5 each).

loans.use: to expand her duck farming business by buying additional ducks.

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Sophy (in the photo) lives on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. He has two young daughters. 

Sophy is a wooden house constructor while his wife raises cows at home. He wants to buy additional construction materials need in his business to replace old, ineffective materials. Hence, he decided to apply for a loan.

loans.use: To buy additional construction materials need in his business.

loans.name: Gulchira

texts.ru:
Гулчира 52-летняя женщина, проживающая в селе предгорного района Вахш. Она имеет среднее образование и работает уборщицей в местной школе. Одновременно в течение последних 5 лет Гулчира занимается еще и животноводством. Она разводит крупнорогатый и мелкорогатый скот. 
Гулчира проживает вместе с сыном и невесткой. Сын работает мастером по стройке и ремонту домов, а невестка домохозяйка. Они живут скромно, но счастливо. Гулчире по уходу за скотами помогает невестка. Сейчас она хочет увеличить поголовье скота в своем скотном дворе и с такой целью обратилась за кредитом для купли 5 голов мелкорогатого скота. Этот кредит ей очень важен для развития своей животноводческой деятельности.
texts.en:
Gulchira is a 52-year-old woman who lives in a village in the piedmont district of Vakhsh. She has a secondary education and works as a janitor in a local school. For the past 5 years, she has been simultaneously practicing livestock breeding. She breeds cattle and sheep.

Gulchira lives with her son and daughter-in-law. Her son works as a construction foreman and home repairman. Her daughter-in-law is a homemaker. They live modestly but happily. Gulchira's daughter-in-law helps her look after the cattle. Now she wants to increase the number of cattle in her barn yard. With this goal, she applied for a loan to buy 5 sheep. This loan is very important to her so that she can develop her livestock breeding business.

loans.use: to buy several sheep to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Leizil

texts.en:
Leizil is a businesswoman who sell bags of sand and gravel retail in the barangay of Toril, Aloran. She is 39 years old, married, and a microfinance member of Paglaum MPC.

She has maintained her membership in good standing with the cooperative and has repaid all her loans in a timely manner. Recently, she applied a loan to restock inventories of sand and gravel to sell. She wants to expand her business with additional inventory.

Leizil hopes to become a sand and gravel supplier in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to restock inventories of sand and gravel to sell

loans.name: Farogat

texts.ru: Эту скромную молодую жительницу района Вахш зовут Фарогат. Ей 23 года. Она рано вышла замуж и уже имеет двух детей. Ее муж работает вдали от семьи в Российской Федерации. Фарогат вместе с детьми живет у родителей мужа. Она там в течение 4 лет занимается разведением скотов. Она в основном разводит молодых ягнят, козлят и бычков. У нее очень хорошо получается и ей нравится ухаживать за животными. Фарогат в данный момент нуждается в кредите. Она хочет закупить несколько голов козлят и ягненок и таким образом увеличить поголовье скота. Фарогат надеется на финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: This modest young resident of the Vakhsh district is named Farogat. She is 23 years old. She got married early and already has two children. Her husband works away from the their family in the Russian Federation. Farogat and her children live with her husband's parents. She has practiced livestock breeding there for four years. She primarily raises young lambs, goats and bull calves. She does a very good job with this and likes to look after animals. Farogat currently needs a loan. She wants to buy several baby goats and lambs in order to increase the size of her herd. Farogat relies on this financial support.

loans.use: to buy baby goats and lambs to develop her business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 27 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, desde hace varios años se dedica a la pesca artesanal y es así como ayuda a su familia en los gastos del hogar, cuenta con una lacha y algunas redes para pescar, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable con su familia y es por esa razón que ha decido solicitar un crédito a INTEGRAL para poder comprar trasmayos para continuar con su pesca ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo e ingresos y así poder seguir ayudando a su familia y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: The client is 27 years old and lives in her own house with her family. For the last few years she has been doing small scale fishing as a way to help her family with the household expenses. She has a boat and some nets to fish. She is a hardworking and responsible woman and she has decide to request a loan from Integral to be able to buy nets (trasmallo) to continue her fishing . This is her only form of work and income and she will be able to continue helping her family to have a better quality of living.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es: Jose de 40 años de edad es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Actualmente vive junto con su grupo familiar, él es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultora su principal siembra maíz y frijol. Jose desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso visitó las oficinas de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar: abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas, herbicidas, entre otros y mejora el terreno que muestra en la fotografía. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Jose, 40, is a man who is very responsible with his family obligations since he has always been characterized as providing the best to his family. Currently, he lives together with his family. He is very hard working and does his work with happiness and enthusiasm. He is dedicated to being a farmer. His main crop is maize and beans. Jose wishes to increase his sales and for this, visited the offices of Integral to request a loan which allows him to buy organic and chemical fertilizers, pesticides, herbicides, among others and to improve the land shown in the photo. He wishes to have the help requested since he has no other monetary income and thus he will keep bringing home the daily bread every day without any limitation.

loans.use: to buy organic and chemical fertilizers, herbicides, among other and to improve the land.

loans.name: Marita

texts.en: Marita owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She has been doing this for more than nine years and she earns good income from this business. With her generated income, she has successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying chemicals. She always finds ways to improve her farm. Without hesitation, she took a new loan to buy organic fertilizer and pay for weeding maintenance costs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and pay for weeding maintenance costs.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a microfinance member of PMPC from Toril, Aloran. She is 42 years old, married and a businesswoman. She has a quarrying business in the small town of Aloran. 

She is a member in good standing and has no record of default. Recently, she has reached to Paglaum for another loan to pay for stall materials. Alma will put up a stall for storage of her quarrying materials and equipment. Alma hopes to construct a house and give a better life to her children.

loans.use: to pay for stall materials.

loans.name: Marionito

texts.en: Marionito operates a farm, planting and harvesting corn. He earns a living by selling his corn in town and he gets a higher price for delivering it in volume. He has been in this business for more than seven years and has earned enough to support his family and to successfully repay his previous loans from GDMPC. To prepare for the next cropping season, he took a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer and new seeds. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his farm.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and new seeds

loans.name: Darwin

texts.en:
Darwin previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan to purchase varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in his business. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in meeting their personal, household, and business expenses.

He would like to apply for another 51,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to his inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in higher profit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain his family's daily needs and pay for the education of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Darwin dreams that his business will grow bigger and hopes to have a good future for his family. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week, and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for his business.

loans.name: Garciano

texts.en:
Garciano makes a living by providing motorcycle transportation and rental services to people in his community. He has been in this business, from which he earns a good income, for many years.  He also manages the family's farm, which grows coconuts and bananas to sell. He uses his motorcycle to transport produce.

Garciano has requested a loan to renew licenses and buy bananas and other farm produce. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to renew licenses and buy bananas and other farm produce

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan, 48, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Manuel, an employee, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating their retail clothing business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Susan buys general merchandise from wholesalers and sells it for a little profit. Her products are men's and women’s clothes. Customers are attracted to buy from her due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 400 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, Susan is requesting a PHP 18,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy ready-to-wear merchandise like dresses, polo shirts for men and women, socks, and shirts to expand her product inventory.

Susan dreams that her business will last for a long time and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for ready-to-wear merchandise like dresses, polo shirts for men and women, socks, and shirts to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to buy additional stocks of toys and other products. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 51,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional items such as toys, plasticware, and other related products. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Evelyn dreams that her business will last longer and stronger, and hopes that her children will finish their education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 people who meet each week to study the Bible, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional items such as toys, plasticware, and other related products.

loans.name: Joey

texts.en:
Joey is thankful for the financial assistance extended to him. He was able to buy the spare parts and accessories needed in his transportation business. His loan helped not just in his business but also in the education of his children. His business income is assisting with his family's household expenditures. He and his wife work hard to provide for their everyday needs. He also has a farm for additional income.

Joey would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan to pay for spare parts and maintenance of his jeepney. The profits from his business will definitely help him to meet his family's daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Joey dreams of having additional jeepney vehicles and hopes to give his family a good future. He meets with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from his study of the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance for his jeepney vehicle

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.en: Bonifacia is 56 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like soft drinks, shampoo, detergent soap, coffee, sugar, juice, biscuits, etc. to sell. Bonifacia has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from raising pigs. Bonifacia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like soft drinks, shampoo, detergent soap, coffee, sugar, juice, biscuits, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 37 years old and married, with nine children.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Ester is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ester has been in pig-fattening for two years and also earns additional income from food-vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Es originaria de Waspam, tiene 30 años de edad, casada con 3 hijos en edad escolar. Su esposo se dedica a alquilar pangan en el Rio Coco. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 7 años estableció su pequeño negocio de venta de ropa y calzado nuevo, en el mercado municipal, también oferta sus productos de manera ambulante en las comunidades. Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar mercadería en Managua y venderla a precios accesibles en Waspam: pantalones para hombres y mujeres, camisas para varones, blusas, faldas, ropa interior, mosquiteros, uniformes, gorras, fajas, vestidos, trajes para niños y calzado. Su sueño es tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en: She is a native of Waspam, 30 years old, married with 3 children who are school age. He husband is dedicated to renting out pangan in the Rio Coco. With the purpose of having her own source of income, 7 years agao, she established her small business selling new clothes and shoes in the town market. She also offers her products door-to-door in the community. She is requesting her first loan to buy merchandise in Managua and sell it at accessible prices in Waspam: men's and women's pants, men's shirts, blouses, skirts, underwear, mosquito nets, uniforms, hats, belts, dresses, suits and clothes for children. Her dream is to have a prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's pants, mens shirts, blouses, skirts, underwear, mosquito nets, uniforms, hats, belts, dresses, suits and clothes for children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an assortment of dishes and home products

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.ru:
Людмила живет и работает в Мелитополе, где она торгует на крупном местном рынке спортивной одеждой. Торговое место у нее собственное. Опыт работы — 20 лет. 
Людмила планирует закупить сезонный товар на сумму 25 000 гривен для того, чтобы выгодно его реализовать этим летом. Она хочет закупить футболки, майки, шорты и прочее, что хорошо расходится в жаркое время года среди населения в Украине.
texts.en: Ludmila lives and works in Melitopol, where she sells sports clothing at a large local market. She owns a shop and has 20 years of experience. She plans to buy seasonal items for 25,000 hyrvnia to sell this summer. She wants to buy t-shirts, shorts, and other items that people in Ukraine will want in the hot weather.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal sportswear for sale

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
This is Arlene, who is 27 years old and married with three kids. She is engaged in a food production business in the community. She is a very patient and loving person. If she encounter some problems, she makes sure that she can resolve them quickly with the help of her husband. Arlene's passion is to cook food; that's why she decided to put up a business. She displays all the foods that she sells in front of their house. 

To have additional capital and to meet the demands of her customers, Arlene is requesting a loan of 17,000 PHP to buy ingredients like meat, chicken and spices for her business. In the future, Arlene hopes that she can build her own stall to display all the food that she makes.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, chicken and spices for her business

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Phalla is 38 years old and lives in a village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. She has been married since 2002 and has two children: one son and one daughter. One of her children attends school and the other is still too young. Phalla is a garment worker, while her husband is a construction worker. 

Phalla used to stay with her grandmother because she did not have her own house. Now she has built her own house, so she does not need to stay with her grandmother anymore. She wants to organize her house in order to visually enhance it; hence, she decided to apply for a loan to buy construction materials such as bricks, cement and sand.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to organize her house

loans.name: Kheang

texts.en:
Kheang lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has two sons and three daughters. Two of her children attend school while two others are garment factory workers and one one assists his parents' business.
