Kheang and her husband grow vegetables on their farmland in their village. Kheang wants to replace their motorbike for her family transportation because the old one always breaks down and use much gasoline. 

Hence, Kheang decided to apply for a loan in order to make the purchase.

loans.use: To replace a motorbike for her family's transportation.

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en:
Sophorn (in photo), age 35, lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh. She has five children: four sons and one daughter. All of her children are in school.

Sophorn is a garment factory worker, while her husband is a moto kangbei taxi driver. In the past, they were commonly known as 'tuk tuks' (three-wheeled motorcycle taxis), but they are now officially called 'moto kangbeis' by government authorities.

The moto kangbei is breaking down. It’s difficult for Sophorn’s husband to continue his business and he wants to make repairs. Hence, Sophorn decided to apply for a loan to help her husband!

loans.use: to repair the moto kangbei for her husband.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecila has been helping her husband operate their own transportation services to make a living. For more than six years, it has been their only way of earning an income for the family. She earns well from this to provide for her family and she successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying tires. To continue her business, she is taking out a new loan to cover the cost of motor repairs and maintenance. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to cover the cost of motor repairs and maintenance

loans.name: Mansita

texts.en: Mansita is 70 years old, and a microfinance member from Caputol, Aloran.  She runs her own small business to help support her husband in generating income for the family. She raises pigs to sell commercially. She earns a promising income doing this type of work and has successfully repaid her previous loan.  Mansita is able to sustain her piggery business. She took a new loan recently to purchase an additional two pigs to raise. She hopes that in the near future, her business will be improved.

loans.use: to purchase an additional two  pigs to raise.

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato is a 53-year old married man with two children. One child is still in school. 

Renato is a very hard-working entrepreneur. He has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Renato has been in this business for 18 years. He earns additional income from farming vegetables.
 
Renato has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell. He successfully paid back his previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build his business. In the future, Renato would like to save enough money to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 50 years old and married, with three children. 

Mercy is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional piglets, feed, and other supplies for her business.

Mercy has been in pig-fattening for four years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feed, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Genara

texts.en: Genara is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Genara is 33 years old and has two children who are in school. She has a general store business in the Philippines. Genara requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell in her general store. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business. Genara has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Genara would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 30 years old and has four children. Victoria is married and has three children who are currently in school.

Victoria is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs.

Victoria has been raising pigs for seven years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Victoria would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Angel Abelino

texts.es: Angel de 49 años de edad  es muy amable y trabajador, vive con sus hijos en casa propia, El trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela donde siembra maíz y maicillo; adicional a eso también trabaja como albañil, sus productos son de muy buena calidad por eso tiene mucha clientela, Angel solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plagas, fertilizantes, abonos, semillas entre otras cosas que necesita para su siembra y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía,  él ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Angel 49 years old and is very friendly and hard-working. He lives with his children in his own house. He works very hard on his own plot of land, where he grows corn and sorghum. He also works as a builder. His products are of very good quality and so he has many customers.

Angel is asking for this loan from Apoyo Integral in order to have the money needed to buy agricultural supplies such as pest controls, fertilizers, seeds etc. which he needs for sowing seed and to improve the soil shown in the photograph. 

He is eager to increase his sales to earn higher profits and give his family more economic stability.

loans.use: to buy pest controls, fertilizers, seeds etc.

loans.name: Ma. Doria

texts.en:
Ma. Doria works hard to support her family. She is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Ma. Doria requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle.

Ma. Doria has been in this business for ten years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Saruon

texts.en:
Saruon (in photo), age 60, lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh. She has six children: three sons and three daughters. Four of her children are married and live separately and the other two are garment factory workers.

Saruon sells vegetables. She buys vegetables from the market in Phnom Penh and sells them in from of the garment factory. Her husband works for a government office. 

Saruon wants to buy a new motorbike for her daughter to drive to work because the old one is breaking down very often. So, she decided to apply for a loan in order to make the purchase.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.name: Manuel Alexander

texts.es: Manuel vive con esposa y sus dos hijos en casa propia el se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene muchos años de trabajar en este rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el comercia en todas las zonas aledañas y ya tiene mucha clientela fija, estas personas siempre prefieren su producto pues es de calidad y a precios realmente accesibles además el servicio es inigualable, el quiere invertir en insumos agrícolas pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, abono, insecticida, fertilizantes, controles de plagas herramienta, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía, Manuel  tiene buenas referencias de pago y está seguro que podrá saldar su deuda a tiempo, y a la vez tiene la confianza que podrá darle a su familia la vida que se merecen.
texts.en:
Manuel lives with his wife and two children in his own home. He works in agriculture, specifically the cultivation of corn and beans. He has been doing this for many years and has developed valuable experience that allows him to obtain the best harvests.

He trades in all the surrounding areas and already has many regular customers, these people always prefer his products because they are of high quality and his prices are really affordable. In addition, his service is second to none.

He wants to invest in agricultural supplies but needs capital and therefore has asked Apoyo Integral for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, pest control, tools etc. and improve the land shown in the photograph.

Manuel has good payment references and is sure that he can settle his debt on time. He also has confidence that he can give his family the life they deserve.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, pest control, tools etc. and improve the land

loans.name: Mala

texts.en:
Mala lives on the island of Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has two young children; one son and one daughter.
 
Mala is a weaver, while her husband sells mangoes. He buys the mangoes under contract from villagers from blooming season until the harvesting season comes. He needs to use pesticides to protect mangoes from insects. He wants to continue his business and buy pesticides to prevent mangoes from insects.

Hence, Mala decides to apply for a loan order to help her husband's capital.
  
Photo: Mala with her loom.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides to protect mangoes from insects.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is a businesswoman from Caputol, Aloran. She is married and a Micro-finance member of PMPC. She manages her store in Barangay, and is able to sustain it with a monthly income of PHP 10,000. 

Aurelia has maintained her membership with the cooperative as her financing partner. Recently, she asked for a loan to pay for stocks of canned goods, sugar, and noodles. With no record of defaults, Aurelia hopes to repay this loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: to pay for stocks, such as canned goods, sugar, and noodles.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty works hard to support her family. Betty is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Betty requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts and tools for her business.

Betty has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Betty would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and tools for her business.

loans.name: Amie

texts.fr:
La dame Amie, âgée de 47 ans, évolue dans le domaine du commerce il y a maintenant 10 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq enfants. Son commerce consiste à vendre des tissus et des draps de lit. Son  capital n’étant pas assez consistant, il ne peut pas acheter en grande quantité et pourtant la clientèle existe, c’est pour pallier a cela qu’elle décide de demander un crédit de 150 000F CFA pour au moins satisfaire la clientèle.
Amie a des enfants qui vont à l’école, et comme elle se débrouille pas mal, elle se charge de leur payer des cours et de régler leurs besoins journaliers.
Amie veut élargir son commerce et ouvrir une grande cantine où elle pourra aussi vendre des produits cosmétiques.
texts.en:
Amie is 47 years old and has been in her line of business for 10 years. She is married and the mother of five children. Her business consists of selling fabric and bed sheets. Amie's business capital is not consistent enough to purchase in bulk. She does, however, have a customer base and it is for this reason that she is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs CFA in order to meet the needs of her customers.

Amie has children who attend school and since she does fairly well with her business, she has taken on the responsibility of paying for their classes and to provide for their daily needs. She would like to expand her business and to open a large shop where she will be able to also sell cosmetics products.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and bed sheets to resell

loans.name: Mercedes Elizabeth

texts.es: Mercedes de 38 años de edad  es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta y elaboración de tortillas su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia tiene mucha clientela ya que las tortillas que elabora las vende a buen precio y es muy amable con sus clientes, Mercedes está solicitando un crédito para comprar maíz por mayor y cal para seguir elaborando las tortillas ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo e ingresos y así poderle dar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a 38-year-old single mother who lives in her own home with her three children. She makes a living by making and selling tortillas from her store, which is located in her home. She has a lot of customers since she sells the tortillas at a good price and she is very friendly with her customers. 

Mercedes is requesting a loan to buy corn and lime powder at wholesale to continue making tortillas, since it is her only job and source of income, so that she is able to give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn and lime powder at wholesale.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, 48 years old, is married, with six children. She loves to communicate with other people. She is a very jolly and hard-working person. 

According to Josephine, her asset in her business is being jolly because some of her clients love to talk with her. She has charisma in the selling business. That's why she set up a retail business. She offers different products in the community. 

Josephine is requesting a loan, amounting PHP 12,000, to buy dresses, shorts, umbrellas, and shoes to offer to her customers and to create another income.

loans.use: to buy dresses, shorts, umbrellas, and shoes.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 42 years old and lives in San Jose, Pagadian City. She is married, with seven children.

Geraldine has a sari sari store. She had this business for seven years. She requested a loan for this type of business. She has requested a loan to buy additional products to sell/retail, like basic commodities. Geraldine wants to have more inventories, so that she will have good sales, also.

Geraldine has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for three years. In the future, she hopes for a store expansion.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell/retail, like basic commodities.

location.town: Pagadian - San Jose District, Pagadian City

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah plants, harvests and sells bananas in order to make a living. For more than seven years, Sarah was able to provide the needs of her family. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for farm supplies. 

Aside from this activity, she was was engaged in a transportation business where her husband personally operated a motorcycle after his work from their farm. To maintain the services, she took a new loan to purchase new tires. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase new tires.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy the spare parts needed in her business and have it well maintained. Her loan helped, not just in her business, but also in the education of her children. Her income from the business is assisting their everyday household needs. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy spare parts and maintain her tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her sustain the daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Maricel hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of the tricycle.

loans.name: Isidora

texts.en:
Isidora previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories, and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children, and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 17,000 PHP loan for her to buy spare parts and maintain her tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her sustain their daily needs and in the educational expense of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Isidora dreams that her business will expand, and hopes to have a better future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and the maintenance of the tricycle unit.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her, as she was able to buy more products for her direct selling business. Her income from the business is assisting her everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs. She also has an apartment and a jeepney for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Adelaida hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams that her family will always be in good condition. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 
 
*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 38 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Rosario has a fishing business in the Philippines. Rosario requested a PHP 35,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy an additional unit of pump-boat for her fishing business.

Rosario has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Rosario would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional unit of pump-boat for her fishing business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 30 years old and single with 3 children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries like shampoo, snack foods, beers, soft-drinks, seasonings, cereals, etc. to sell.

She has borrowed and paid off 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from raising pigs. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to build her business further. Evelyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like shampoo, snack foods, beers, soft-drinks, seasonings, cereals, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Ana Deisy

texts.es:
Ana de 56 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, es casada el esposo por el momento no hace nada ya que se encuentra mal de salud, en esta relación procreo 4 hijos los cuales todos ellos ya están en hogares apartes,  ya se casaron.


Ana es comerciante ella tiene una tienda desde ya hace 20 años, ella decidió abrir esta tienda porque en el lugar no habían y ella vio la necesidad de poner ese negocio;  pero también cultiva la tierra desde hace 2 años, ya que el esposo cayo con una enfermedad que no puede hacer nada,  ella decidió trabajar en la agricultura con personas que le ayudan a ella este trabajo lo hace de las 6 a las 12 del mediodía. 

Ana cultiva en lo propio, por lo tanto el crédito lo necesita para comprar el abono.

Los sueños que tiene es que Dios siempre le preste vida para seguir en la tienda y cuando pueda poder cultivar la tierra ya que su esposo no puede trabajar.
texts.en:
Ana is 56 years old, she studied until the second grade, and she is married. At the moment, her husband is unable to do anything since he got sick. Together they have four children who are already married and live in their own homes.

Ana is a shopkeeper and she has already had a store for 20 years. She decided to open this store because there had not been a store in the area and she saw the need of having one there, but she has also been farming for 2 years. Since her husband fell ill and has not been able to do anything, she decided to work in agriculture with people that help her. She works this job from 6:00 am until noon. Ana farms her own land, therefore she needs the loan to buy fertilizer.

Her dream is that God will always give her life to continue in the store and whenever possible, to be able to farm the land since her husband cannot work.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Tagoigul

texts.ru: Тагойгул является сотрудницей государственного учреждения. У нее высшее образование. Она в течение 15 лет работает ведущим специалистом в Управлении по занятости населения района Вахш. Ей 58 лет. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. Ее муж обычный мастер, предоставляющий услуги по ремонту домов. Дочери тоже работают. Единственный сын Тагойгул в этом году оканчивает третий курс в Техническом Университете, в факультете энергетики. Он любит свою будущую профессию и стремится успешно окончить университет. Сейчас им необходимо оплатить за четвертый учебный год вперед. Для этой цели Тагойгул берет кредит. Она очень надеется на финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Tagoigul is a government agency employee. She has a higher education. Over the course of 15 years, she has worked as a leading specialist in the Administration of Employment Services of the Vakhsh District. She is 58 years old. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a common craftsman, offering his services in home repairs. Her daughters also work. This year, Tagoigul's only son is completing his third year of university at the Technological University in the energy engineering department. He loves his future profession and strives to successfully graduate from university. Now they must pay for his fourth year tuition in advance. Tagoigul is taking out a loan for this purpose. She really relies on your financial support.

loans.use: to pay her son's yearly university tuition.

loans.name: Sreypeou

texts.en:
Sreypeou is a 23-years-old single woman, living with her parents and siblings in Romeas Haek district, Svay Rieng province. Sreypeou is an employee of the public sector, and earns a decent salary from teaching students. The income barley meets the family's needs, so she’s also dedicated to agriculture to supplement her income and satisfy their needs. She has been teaching for almost three years.
 
By applying for this loan, Sreypeou will be able to buy a set of solar home system to install on the top roof of her house, which is located in the off-grid area of the province. 

After being with Hattha Kaksekar, she can gain access to micro-finance services and solar energy, which she uses to support household appliances, such as light, TV, and radio, so everyone in her family can even work or study at night. 

She expresses her thanks to all lenders in advance.

loans.use: to buy a solar home system to install on the roof of her house.

loans.name: Mohira

texts.ru: Мохира молодая способная девушка из района Шахритус, где она живет со своими родителями. Ей уже 21 год. После окончания школы Мохира не смогла поступить в ВУЗ из-за финансовой трудности. В  возрасте 19 лет она научилась профессии швеи и самостоятельно начала свой швейный бизнес, который она продолжает и нынче. Вот уже два года как Мохира шьет женские национальные платья на старой ручной швейной машинке. Она хочет расширить свое дело и брать больше заказов, но для этого ей необходимо обновить свою машинку. В связи с этим Мохира обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить новую модернизированную швейную машинку. Она нуждается в данном кредите для развития своего швейного дела.
texts.en: Mohira is a capable young woman from the Shahrituz District, where she lives with her parents. She is already 21 years old. After graduating from school, Mohira was unable to enroll in university due to financial difficulties. At the age of 19, she learned the seamstress profession and independently began her own sewing business which she continues to this day. For two years already, Mohira has been sewing women's ethnic Tajik-style dresses on an old, manual sewing machine. She wants to expand her business and take more orders but she needs to replace and upgrade her sewing machine to do so. In connection with this, Mohira requested a loan to buy a new, modernized sewing machine. She needs this loan to develop her sewing business.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine to develop her sewing business.

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida is a 21-year-old single woman from Preah Sihanouk, Cambodia. She lives with her family comprised of her parents and siblings. Lida is now a second-semester student of her first academic year at Life University. At this nursing college, her major is midwifery. Her ambition is to be employed in a public sector after graduation. Currently her education is subsidized by her parents.

Due to the shortage of funds, Lida would like to borrow a new loan to cover the costs of her school tuition for the second semester and pay for other related expenses. In the future, Lida hopes to earn a good salary, so she will be able to help her parents when they are older and to improve their general living conditions. Lida is very happy and thankful for the loan funded via a program like Kiva to allow poor students to pursue a higher education while contributing to the future development of Cambodia.

loans.use: to cover the cost of her school tuition for the second semester and pay for other related expenses.

loans.name: Sabath

texts.en:
Sabath is 21 years old, married, and lives in Bakan district, Pursat province, Cambodia. 

In order to earn a living, she is engaged in a farming business, growing rice on a few parcels of land which she got from her parents as heritage, after marriage. Having been in this field for more almost four years, she is able to earn approximately KHR 20,000 per day.

Thanks to Hattha Kaksekar Limited's new water loan program, with a special rate, Sabath is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, safeguarding her family's health, and protecting the environment. 

She will use the loan she's applying for, to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank, to improve her household sanitation practices for the sake of her family.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank, to improve her household sanitation practices.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang, age 42, lives with her husband and children in a rural village of the Krong Battambang district, Battambang province. 

To meet the needs of her family, Neang is in the business of farming rice, alongside her husband, earning approximately USD 10 per day. She has been in the business for almost 20 years and earns additional income from selling vegetables in the local markets of the province.

Thanks to Hattha Kaksekar Limited's new water loan program with a special rate, Neang is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, safeguarding her family's health, and protecting the environment. 

She will use the loan she's applying for, to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank, to improve her household sanitation practices for the sake of her family.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank, to improve her household sanitation practices.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
This is Maribel, who is 39 years old and married with three children. As a mother, Maribel does her best to sustain the needs of her family, most especially the children's school needs. Her husband works on their small farm where they grow what they need in their house, but having a farm is not enough to sustain the daily needs of their family. 

That's why Maribel is asking for a loan amounting to Php 10,000 to buy meat, chicken, rice and spices for her food production and sales business to have additional income. In the future, she hopes that she can save enough money for her family.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, rice and spices for her business.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe has been selling snacks in their community as an aid to her husband's income from working as carpenter. She makes the snacks delicious to suit her customers' tastes. She has many competitors in the village, but even so she has her loyal customers buying and making orders. She had successfully repaid her previous loan that was used for buying ingredients. 

Recently, she took a new loan to buy additional raw ingredients to prepare snacks to sell in order to improve sales. In the future, she wants to renovate their house to have better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients to prepare snacks to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn owns and operates farmland. She helps her husband plant and harvest bananas to sell for a living. With her generated income, her previous loan used for farm supplies was successfully repaid. She also was able to provide the needs of their children as well as her family. 

To prepare for this planting season, she took a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer and seedlings. She strives to improve the farm and secure a stable source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Jade

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Jade works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from electronic mobile load retailing. Jade is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to resell to her customers in her vegetable-vending business.

Jade has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Thelma works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Thelma is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Analiza is 41 years old and has two children who are in school.

Analiza has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Analiza requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients, such as fish, vegetables, meat, spices, etc. for her food production.

Analiza has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Analiza would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, such as fish, vegetables, meat, spices, etc. for her food-production business.

loans.name: Cindy

texts.es:
Ella es Cindy una mujer de 25 años, tiene muchos sueños y uno de ello es ser cosmetóloga, ella vive con la hija Nicole y el esposo Arturo un hogar con felicidad, angustia y algunas peleas como cualquier hogar normal, ella es una mujer emprendedora que le gusta trabajar y luchar junto al esposo, para que la hija este bien y poderle brindar una buena educación. 
Cindy se dedicaba a trabajar como impulsadora, ella se considera que hace las cosas bien, puesto que no le gusta la mediocridad.  
Ella siempre le había gustado la cosmetología y estética integral y decidió que como la hija entraba al colegio este año ella también iba estudiar, ya  que tenía la mañana libre, porque la hija se iba a estudiar y ella trabajaba en la tarde.
Finalmente se  matriculo y ahora está estudiando feliz por era lo que ella siempre había querido pero no lo había hecho por que se había dedicado solo a trabajar y ahorrar, porque otro sueño que ella tiene es lograr tener la propia casa, pero esta vez decidió que no iba seguir 
Ahorrando si no que iba a estudiar y después seguía el ahorro, que primero estaba el estudio para superarse y ser una mujer con muy buena experiencia laboral, pero también con estudios. Desafortunada mente Cindy después de que entro a estudiar se quedó sin empleo y se le ha hecho muy difícil económicamente, porque a pesar de que no paga igual que otros estudiantes la cosmetología requiere de muchos materiales y pues a pesar que el esposo la apoya ella es consciente de los gastos de un hogar, el estudio de la hija y el estudio de ella, todos estos gastos que ella menciona requieren de plata sin contar otros gastos que a veces se tienen, es por eso que  ella solicita el convenio con kiva, ella no se desanima, ella va a salir adelante con la carrera y conseguirá trabajo para ayudar en el hogar.
texts.en:
This is Cindy, a 25-year-old woman who has many dreams. One of them is to become a cosmetologist. She lives with her daughter Nicole and husband Arturo in a happy home but there are some anguish and fights like any normal home. She is an enterprising woman who likes to work hard alongside her husband so that they can provide a good education to their daughter.
Cindy was working as a salesperson. She likes to do things right because she does not like mediocrity. 
She has always liked cosmetology and esthetics and decided to enter school this year because her daughter was also going to school. Cindy had the morning off because her daughter went off to school and then she worked in the afternoon. 
She finally enrolled and is now happy with her studies because it is what she has always wanted but had not done because she had to work and save. Her other dream is to have her own home but she is not pursuing that dream.
She was saving money in order to study and continued saving. First, she wanted to study and then excel and be a woman with good work experience and an education. 
Unfortunately, Cindy lost her job after enrolling in school and it has been very hard financially because cosmetology, while not having as expensive tuition as other students, requires many materials. Her husband supports her but Cindy is conscious of the costs of their home, her daughter's education, and her tuition. All of these expenses require money, not to mention all of their periodic expenses. That's why she requested the loan agreement with Kiva. She is not discouraged, she will go ahead with her studies and get a job to help at home.

loans.use: to pay a semester of tuition

loans.name: Vera

texts.ru:
Вера живет в Мелитополе. Она работает предпринимателем на местном рынке, торгует мужской одеждой и обувью. Работает в этой сфере торговли уже 14 лет. 
Вера планирует закупить сезонный товар для продажи летом и для этого ей необходима дополнительная сумма в 10 000 гривен. Она хочет закупить партию рубашек, футболок и маек на этот сезон торговли.
texts.en:
Vera lives in Melitopol. She works as a businesswoman in the local market, selling men's clothing and shoes. She worked in this field for 14 years already.

Vera plans to buy seasonal merchandise to sell in the summer. She needs additional funds for this in the amount of 10,000 hryvnia. For this seasonal merchandise, she wants to buy a shipment of button-up shirts, t-shirts and tank tops.

loans.use: to buy a variety of button-up shirts, t-shirts and tank tops.

loans.name: Nou

texts.en:
Nou is 33 years old and married to a local woman who operates the same farming business as he does. They have been blessed with three children who live with them in a small house located in the Svay Check district in Banteay Meanchey province. Nou has been engaged in farming and raising birds, including laying hens and roosters, for almost 15 years. From these activities, he is able to earn well for his family. 

Thanks to Hattha Kaksekar's new water loan program with a special rate, Nou is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, safeguarding his family's health and protecting the environment. He will use the loan he's applying for to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank to improve his household sanitation practices for the sake of his family.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank to improve the household sanitation practices for the sake of his family.

loans.name: Ledis

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Ledis quien con su credikiva anterior, con el que logró comprar mas mercancia variada, y con ello mejoró los plazos de sus clientes. con su credikiva pudo ofrecer mas comodidad e incrmentar sus ventas. Hoy trabaja mas cómodamente ayuda a sus clientes a acceder a productos que puedan pagar y en los plazos convenientes para ellos. Ledis envia un mensaje a sus financiadores de Kiva : "Gracias po su ayuda y espero seguir contando con ustedes" En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará ropa, moderna e innovadora para atraer a su clientela y vender mucho mas.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Ledis, who, with her previous Kiva loan managed to buy more general merchandise, and in turn, improve payment deadlines for her customers. With her loan from Kiva, she can offer a more comfortable customer experience and increase her profits. 

Today, she works more comfortably and helps her customers to buy the products they can pay for in time frames that are convenient to them. Ledis would like to give a message to her Kiva funders: "Thank you for your help and I hope to receive your continued support".

She is now applying for Kiva loan, with which she will buy modern and cutting-edge clothing to attract her customers and sell much more.

loans.use: to buy modern and cutting-edge clothing to attract more customers

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Due to financial insufficiency, Maxima aims to improve her small variety store in order to increase her income. She is 49 years old and has seven children attending school. Despite the hardship of living, she and her husband want to continue sending their children to school so that they will be the ones to support them when they get old. 

To improve her store, Maxima wants a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy additional stock of grocery items to sell, like soft drinks and vegetables. Having patience and strong determination, she believes that she will make more improvements in the business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of grocery items to sell, like soft drinks and vegetables.

loans.name: Relinda

texts.en:
Relinda and her husband are both farmers who have aimed to improve their status of living to give their children a better life. Relinda is 53 years old and has three adult-age children. They help each other in cultivating their farmland by planting various vegetables and root crops to sell. 

They aimed to expand their plantation but they don't have enough capital. For this reason, Relinda is asking for a loan of PHP 23,000 to buy fertilizers and herbicides needed for growing vegetables. Through this loan, they believe that they will expand their vegetable plantation and increase their production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides needed for growing vegetables.

location.town: Brgy. Bone North, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es: Rosa 48 años de edad vive junto con sus hijos en casa propia; Ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas, tiene varios años con este trabajo y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia que le permite obtener los mejores resultados, su negocio esta ubicado en una zona muy estratégica y frecuentada por las personas de la comunidad, es muy conocida pues sus tortillas son las mas ricas y siempre están calientitas, tiene mucha clientela. Rosa es una mujer luchadora, entregada a su labor, en estos últimos meses ha aumentado la demanda y quiere aprovechar para aumentar su inversión pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor, gas propano, etc. ella tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de otras instituciones y se hace responsable del pago completo de la deuda, y a la vez tiene la esperanza que podrá darle a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Rosa, 48 years old, lives with her children in a house that she owns. She works selling tortillas and has run this business for several years. Her experience in this work has allowed her to keep improving her results. Her tortilla shop is strategically located in a busy are where many people from the community visit. Rosa has many customers and her store is well know because her tortillas are delicious and always hot.

Rosa is a fighter and very dedicated to her work. In the last few months, demand for her tortillas has increased, so she wants to take advantage of the opportunity and invest in her business, but she does not have enough capital. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow her to buy corn in bulk, propane gas, etc. Rosa has very good references from paying her share of loans from other institutions. She pledges to repay her debt in full.

Rosa hopes that she will be able to give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy rice in bulk, propane gas, etc.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients like milk, sugar, flour, etc. for her food production business.

Gemma has been in this business for 16 years. Gemma earns additional income from electronic mobile load retailing.

Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like milk, sugar, flour, etc. for her food production business.

loans.name: Metchie Marie

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Metchie Marie works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from electronic mobile load retailing. Metchie Marie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients and materials for her business.

Metchie Marie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients and materials for her business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a married woman with eleven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Gloria is 48 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Gloria has a fishing business in the Philippines. Gloria requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fishing net for her fishing business.

Gloria has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fishing net for her fishing business.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 29 years old and has two children. Joy is married and has one child who is still in school.

Joy is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Joy requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Joy has been in pig fattening for 4 years now and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

Joy would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nicanora

texts.en:
Nicanora works hard to support her family. Nicanora is widowed and has a buy and sell ready to wear clothing business in the Philippines.

Nicanora requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of ready to wear clothing to sell to her customers.

Nicanora has been in this business for 5 years now.

Nicanora would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of ready to wear clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Verosalie

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Verosalie works hard to support her family.

She has a bamboo strips weaving business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Verosalie is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy more bamboo for her business.

Verosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more bamboo for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a generator and electric scissors.

loans.name: Petronela

texts.en:
A loan of $600 is offered to Petronela to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as candles, water, fish, coffee and salt. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Petronela independent because she can be responsible for herself and also helping her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy candles, water, fish, coffee and salt.

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza is 31 years old and has four children. Annaliza is married and has three children who are currently in school.

Annaliza is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Annaliza requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Annaliza has been in the pig fattening business for 3 years now and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Annaliza would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa works hard to support her family. Celsa is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Celsa requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Celsa has been in this business for 8 years now.

Celsa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Cristine

texts.en:
Cristine is 26 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cristine has a abaca weaving business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for six years. 

Cristine requested a loan from NWTF for 18,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional raw materials for her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials for her business

loans.name: Rosina

texts.en:
Rosina opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital of $ 200.00. She is earning a good income and she will use the income to support her family and improve their living conditions.

Rosina is taking a loan of $ 800.00 to improve her kiosk business that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy inventory to keep in her store such as body lotion, water, coffee, sugar, salt, noodles, shampoo, fish and milk. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $ 400.00. She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy body lotion, water, coffee, sugar, salt, noodles, shampoo, fish and milk.

loans.name: Raisa

texts.ru:
Раиса уже испытала на себе положительное вливание средств от КИВА. Благодаря кредиту она теперь может торговать намного более разнообразным товаром, увеличив круг покупателей и свою прибыль.
В этот раз Раиса хочет увеличить количество товара, представленного на продажу в ее торговой точке, закупив новые модели купальников на сумму 30 000 гривен. Так как ассортимент реализуемой продукции постоянно растет, Раиса всерьез задумывается о том, чтобы открыть точку побольше.
texts.en:
Raisa already has had a good experience with Kiva loans. Thanks to receiving credit, she has been able to sell a wider variety of products, attract new customers, and increase her profits. 

Raisa currently wants to increase her inventory at her shop and buy new swimsuits for 30,000 hryvnia. Because the range of products she sells is continuing to grow, Raisa is seriously thinking about how to open a larger store.

loans.use: to purchase swimsuits to sell

loans.name: Alfonso De Jesus

texts.es: Alfonso es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar. Actualmente vive junto con su grupo familiar conformado por su esposa y sus hijos, él es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultora siembra maíz y frijol.  Alfonso desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso visitó las oficinas de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar: abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas, herbicidas, entre otros. Y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Alfonso is a man who is very responsible with his obligations to his home. He lives with his family, which is composed of his wife and his children. He is very hard working and he has always carried out his work cheerfully and enthusiastically. He works in agriculture, cultivating corn and beans. 

Alfonso wants to increase his sales, so he visited the offices of Integral in order to request a loan.  It will allow him to purchase compost, fertilizer, pesticide, herbicide, and similar items, and improve the land that is shown in the photograph.

He hopes to have the help that he has requested, as he has no other income, and thus he will continue providing for his family without any limitation.

loans.use: to purchase compost, fertilizer, pesticide, herbicide and similar items, and to improve the land.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Cristita has been in this business for 6 years. She earns additional income from farming vegetables.

Cristita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 47 years old and married with six children. With two of her children currently in school, Dolores works very hard to provide for them.

Dolores runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like snack foods, candies, biscuits, juice, cooking oil, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

Dolores has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, candies, biscuits, juice, cooking oil, detergent soap, etc. 

Dolores would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like snack foods, candies, biscuits, juice, cooking oil, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Oscar Alirio

texts.es:
Oscar de 52 años de edad,  estudio hasta 2° grado, está acompañado, su esposa es secretaria, tiene dos hijas, quienes estudian educación  media.

Oscar es agricultor de toda su vida es la única actividad que realiza, aparte de trabajar como jornalero.
El lugar donde siembra está a 800 mts de su casa y el recorrido lo hace en su bicicleta.

El crédito será invertido para sembrar una área de 7,000 mt2 de cultivo de maíz, gracias al crédito podrá comprar  todos los insumos, como abono, fertilizantes, mano de obra, pesticidas y herbicidas.

El sueño de Oscar es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, trabajar mucho para darle la oportunidad  a sus hijas que continúen estudiando, además le gustaría tener una motocicleta.
texts.en:
Oscar, 52 years old, has a second grade education. His wife works as a secretary and their two daughters are in middle school. 

Oscar has been a farmer all of his life. It is the only work he does besides working as a day laborer. He sows his crops in a field located 800 meters away from his house, to which he rides his bicycle. 

Oscar will use this loan to invest in sowing corn on 7000 square meters. Thanks to this loan, he will be able to buy all the necessary items, such as compost, fertilizers, pesticides, weedkiller, and pay for labor. His dream is to improve his family's quality of life, to work hard to give his daughters the opportunity to finish school, and to have a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizer, pesticides, weedkiller, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Juana de 45 años de edad, estudio hasta 2° grado, está acompañada y tiene 4 hijos, su esposo es jornalero.

Juana trabaja en la agricultura desde los 14 años, ya que sus padres fueron agricultores, ahora produce maíz y yuca, y le toca viajar 1 km en bicicleta y a la vez ayuda a su esposo.

El crédito será invertido para la siembra de maíz y yuca.

A Juana le hubiera gustado terminar la educación básica, también desea mejorar la calidad de vida y le encantaría tener mas ganado.
texts.en:
Juana is 45 years old. She went to school through the 2nd grade. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a day laborer. 

Juana has worked in agriculture since she was 14 years old, because her parents were farmers. Now she grows corn and yucca. She travels 1 km in bicycle and also helps her husband. 

The loan will be invested in planting corn and yucca. 
 
Juana would have liked to finish her primary education. She also wants to improve her quality of life and she would love to have more cattle.

loans.use: to plant corn and yucca.

loans.name: José Nelson

texts.es:
José de 42 años de edad, estudio hasta 5° grado, está casado,  su esposa realiza las labores del hogar; y tiene tres hijos de los cuales dos estudian.


José trabaja como jornalero, y además siembra maíz, el área que cultiva es de 7,000 m2, la cual produce junto a sus tres hijos, y esta 600 mts de su casa.


El crédito será invertido para comprar abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas y herbicidas para sembrar 7,000 m2.

Su sueño es que sus hijos estudien y se preparen académicamente, mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y tener ganado.
texts.en:
José is 42 years old and studied up to the fifth grade. He is married and his wife carries out the household chores. José has three children, of whom two are in school. 

José works as a day laborer and also plants corn. The area that he harvests covers 7,000 square meters. With his children he works this land, which is 600 meters from his home. 

His loan will be invested in the purchase of manure, fertilizer, pesticide and herbicide to plant on 7,000 square meters of land. His dream is for his children to stay in school and prepare themselves academically, to improve his and his family's living conditions, and to own livestock.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, pesticide and herbicide to plan 7,000 square meters.

loans.name: Blanca Maritza

texts.es:
Blanca de 42 años de edad, estudio  hasta 6° siendo una de las mayores de su familia, lo que tenia que ayudar a sus padres en el trabajo, es viuda su esposo murió hace 18 años vive con su hijo los otros dos ya están acompañados es por eso que una persona depende de ella.

Blanca trabaja en casa de empleada domestica de esto ayuda a su hijo en la agricultura, su trabajo esta a 2 kilómetros en bus de su casa  su horario de trabajo es de 7:00 am a 2:00 pm en la tarde ayuda a su hijo en trabajo de campo en la agricultura.


El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar maíz para revenderlo y recibir una ganancia eso servirá y ayudara a su hijo en la agricultura.


Blanca sueña en tener una vivienda  mejor de la que tiene en este momento y poder tener un negocio de maíz y frijoles.
texts.en:
Blanca is 42 years old. She went to school through the 6th grade. Since she was one of the oldest ones in the family, she had to help her parents with the work. She is a widow and her husband dies 18 years ago. She lives with a son. The other children are married and that is why one person depends on her.    

Blanca works as a maid and this helps her son with the farming. Her job is 2 km away from her house by bus. Her work schedule is from 7:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m. In the afternoon, she helps her son with the field work for the farming. 

The loan will be used to buy corn to re-sell and make a profit son she can help her son with the farming. 

Blanca dreams of having a better house than the one she has now and being able to have a corn and bean business.

loans.use: to buy corn to re-sell and make a profit so she can help her son with the farming.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine and a regular sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise and increase her inventory: notebooks, pens, staplers, erasers, backpacks, cosmetics, colognes and perfumes, creams, deodorants, and hair accessories for women and girls.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy electric scissors and an iron.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a responsible housewife who supports her husband in generating income. She engages herself in buying and reselling fruits and vegetables at the public market. She aims to improve her business and increase her income to assist her husband in financing the education of her two children. 

Having inadequate capital, Evelyn wants to avail a loan of PHP 10,000.00 to buy more stocks of fruits and vegetables to resell. Through her patience and strong determination, she believes that she will make her business more profitable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Aninda

texts.en:
Aninda is a 51 year old widow and a resident of Caputol, Aloran. She sells charcoal at the local market to earn an income. She is an active member of PMPC  and enjoys the privileges of being a member in good standing. 

She enjoys her business because she likes interacting with her customers. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase charcoal to offer for sale. Her goal for the future is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to offer for sale.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam, 44 years old, is married to Gerald and they have three children. Her husband is a farmer, and she has also been busy with the hog raising business for six years. 

To maintain her business she is borrowing money amounting PHP 8,000 to buy feed and additional piglets for her hog raising business. Miriam hopes that her business expand so that she can sustain the needs of her children, who are mostly in school.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional piglets for her hog raising business.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesús (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Divino Niño Jesús está formado por 13 mujeres alegres, luchadoras y carismáticas que buscan la superación en sus trabajos y familias. Viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se caracteriza por ser la tercera ciudad más importante del Ecuador, su Centro Histórico, sus 4 ríos que bañan la ciudad y sobre todo su gente que es muy cálida y amable.   
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Nancy, tiene 44 años de edad, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 19, 14, y 9 años de edad, su primera hija trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, su segundo hijo estudia en el colegio y su ultima hija está en una escuela de la localidad, su esposo labora como conserje, la casa en la que vive es de un familiar.
Doña Nancy se dedica a la cría de pollos y cuyes, también se dedica a la agricultura y lo que cosecha es para su hogar. Su fuente de ingreso principal es la elaboración de chompas, bufandas y todo tipo de costuras de forma manual y artesanal. El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de hilos, pollos, cuyes y alimento para animales. Su meta es crecer en sus negocios.
texts.en:
The credit group called Divino Niño Jesús consists of 13 cheerful, charismatic, and hardworking women who are seeking to improve their work and families. They live in the city of Cuenca, a city that is known for being the third largest city in Ecuador that's renowned for its historic center, the four rivers that surround the city, and its warm and friendly people.
One of the members of this group is Nancy, 44. She's married and has 3 children, aged 19, 14, and 9 years old. Her oldest daughter works and helps her financially. Her second son is studying in high school and the youngest daughter is in a school in town. Her husband works as a janitor. They live in a family-owned home.
Nancy raises chickens and guinea pigs. She is also engaged in farming and harvesting for her home. Her main source of income is making sweaters, scarves, and doing all types of sewing and handicrafts. The money from her loan will be used to invest in buying wire, chicks, guinea pigs, and animal feed. Her goal is to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase wire, guinea pigs, chicks, and animal feed

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a buy and sell herbal medicine business in the Philippines.

Florencia requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more boxes of herbal medicines to sell. She has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Florencia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of herbal medicines to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 51 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Gemma has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening and food vending.

Gemma aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan de 35 años de edad, estudio hasta 8° grado, está acompañado, su esposa comercializa frutas y verduras, y tienen dos hijos quienes estudian.


Juan  es agricultor de toda la vida, oficio que aprendió de sus padres. El cultivo que produce es maíz y el área es de 12,000 mts a la cual le dedica mucho tiempo para tener una buena producción.


El crédito será invertido para realizar la siembra de maíz y comprar abono, fertilizantes, herbicidas, pesticidas.

Juan  desea darle lo mejor a su familia y eso solo con trabajo lo lograra, es por eso que se esfuerza al máximo para conseguirlo.
texts.en:
Juan, 35, studied until the 8th grade. He is married and his wife sells fruits and vegetables. They have two children who are in school.
Juan is a farmer, a lifelong craft that he learned from his parents. He is growing corn in a production area of 12,000 meters. He devotes much time to have a good harvest.
The loan will be used to invest in the corn and buy fertilizers, manure, herbicides, and pesticides.
Juan wants to give the best to his family and he can only achieve that through his work which is why he tries his best to get it.

loans.use: to invest in his corn plants

loans.name: Josias Ezequiel

texts.es:
Josias de 21 años de edad, estudio  hasta 8° siendo uno de los mayores de la familia, por lo que tenia que ayudar a sus padres en el trabajo, es soltero no ha decidido casarse debido a que ha tenido malas experiencias con algunas novias que a tenido.

Josias trabaja en la agricultura, y lo ha hecho desde que era niño ya que su padre es agricultor, horario no tiene ya que hasta que termina de hacer lo que tiene programado sale hacia su casa.


El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar abono, fertilizantes, herbicidas, pesticidas y pago de mano de obra,  ya que en estos días es donde empiezan a moverse para la temporada.


Josias sueña con tener una casa digna para darles a sus padres una mejor vida, tener un camión para transportar la cosecha, con su esfuerzo y con la ayuda de DIOS lo podrá hacer posible
texts.en:
Josias is 21 years old and studied up to the eighth grade, because as one of the oldest members of his family, he had to help his parents out with their work. He is single and has chosen not to marry because he has had bad experiences with some girlfriends that he has had. Josias works in agriculture and has done so since he was a boy since his father is a farmer. He does not have a set schedule because he does not go home until he has finished all that he needs to do. 

The loan will be used to buy manure, fertilizer, herbicide, and pesticide, and to pay for the day labor because in these days there is a lot to do because of the current season. Josias dreams to own a dignified home so that he can give his parents a better life, and to have a truck to transport his harvest. With his efforts and the help from God, he will be able to make it happen.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, herbicide and pesticide, and to pay for labor because these days there is a lot to do because of the current season.

loans.name: Pratima

texts.en:
Pratima is only 36 years old and a mother of three children (two sons and one daughter). Her family consists of her children and her husband who is associated with agricultural work. They live in the small village of Shalbari in Jalpaiguri district.  Their children are receiving an education and are in grades 10, 7 and 5 respectively.  They have a small kachha house (made of mud, bamboo and straw).

Pratima's husband Binod, 43 years old, has a small farm that he inherited. It is where he grows some vegetables and fruits like chilies, bitter gourds, beans, cucumbers etc. He sells the produce that he cultivates in the local market.  This is how he tries to run his family. In order to earn additional income Pratima has started a milk-selling business.  She has been successfully doing this business for the last four years.  She sells milk to her neighbors. But her customers are increasing day by day.  So she needs to purchase one more cow to fulfill their demands.

She came to know about Kiva’s partner, BJS, and has taken a loan from them to purchase a cow.  She dreams that her business will bring so much profit that she can help her husband to provide for the family's household.  In the future, she hopes to purchase one big Jersey cow to start a milk products business with her profits.  She is very much touched and pleased by the support of her lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her existing milk selling business.

loans.name: Khursheda

texts.en:
Khursheda is 29 years old, married and has two children. She is always working to provide a better life for her children.

Khursheda began her own business dealing with cows when her children were little. She feeds the cows in a cowshed that is located in her house. She is applying for a 4500 TJS loan through IMON to be used to increase the number of them she has to sell.

Khursheda hopes for Kiva's cooperation in this loan so she can earn more money and improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: To buy more cows.

loans.name: Jewels Group

texts.en: Rita is an active and hardworking woman from Churachandpur, Manipur. She is the featured profile member and is pictured with her hand raised. She is still single and lives with her parents. Rita says its time she earns her living, be financially independent and support her family. In order to increase the income of the family, she opened a variety store near her house. In her store, she keeps a variety of chips, pans, cigarettes, edible oil, spices and the like. She wishes to purchase more items such as cold drinks, fruit juice and bottled water, as in summer these items are in high demand. Therefore, she wants to avail a loan for the expansion and refilling of her shop. This will mean an increase in income for Rita. The extra income means she can save more for her future. As she is still single, she wants to save some amount for her marriage. She doesn't want to place an extra burden on her parents for her marriage. She is elated that she can fulfill her plans and desires through her Kiva loan. She thanks and appreciates Kiva for such a great help. Likewise, the rest of her group members are engaged in a grocery store, a pan shop, vending vegetables, etc.

loans.use: To buy items like betel leaf, nuts, chips, candles and edible oil to sell

loans.name: Angie Vanessa

texts.es:
Ella es Angie Vanessa le emociono mucho el día que se acercaba su grado, pronto sabría que podría estudiar y ejercer la carrera que siempre le había llamado la atención y no solo eso que la apasionaba ya que sabría que así podría ayudar a las personas, pero sobre todo a un familiar que ella adoraba mucho, la mama.
Ella sabía muy bien que si estudiaba en esto no solo podría ayudar a cuanta persona  necesitara si no con las enfermedades de la mama y es más, ya sabría que hacer como atenderla y lo mejor lo haría de corazón.
El día que Vanessa recibió el diploma fue muy feliz y desde ese momento empezó a buscar unas institución donde ella pudiera cumplir el sueño que tenía, entre tanta búsqueda por fin encontró lo que buscaba y tenía todo lo que algunas vez pensó, se llama " Campo Alto"  tiene todo lo que necesita Vanessa para poder lograr el objetivo.
Hasta hoy iniciara las clases y espera dar todo de ella y mucho más para decir con orgullo “Se graduó de la mejor institución " Campo Alto".
Ella solicita el convenio con kiva ya que es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante pero que no cuenta con los recursos económicos suficientes para poder pagar las cuotas que en este momento paga en el instituto.
texts.en:
This is Angie Vanessa who is very excited about her education. Soon, she knows that she will study and pursue the education that has always attracted her attention and passion. She knows that she could help people but especially the family member that she loves so much, her mom.
She knew very well that if she studied she could not only help everybody who needs it but she could also help her mother with her illnesses. She already knows how to care for her but it's better to do it with her whole heart.
The day Vanessa received her high school diploma she was very happy. From that moment, she began looking for an educational institution where she could fulfill the dream she had. After a lot of searching, she found what she wanted. It had everything that she thought it would. It's called CampoAlto and it has everything Vanessa needs to achieve her goal.
Her classes began today and she expects it will give her all she needs so she can proudly say she graduated from CampoAlto, the best institution.
She requested the loan from Kiva because she is a person who is eager to move forward but she does not have enough to pay the fees because she currently does not have economic resources.

loans.use: to pay a semester of tuition

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is married and for the past nine years has worked hard fattening pigs to sell to support her family.

Gina is applying for a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her hogs. Her intent is to save money to grow her pig business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman, with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 40 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Jocelyn has a knitting business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional materials for her business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her knitting business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 42 years old and has two children. Josephine is married and has two children who are in school.

Josephine is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 28,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Josephine has been in pig-fattening for 15 years now and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Faziran

texts.en:
Faziran is a rural housewife and lives with her husband and three children (two sons and one daughter) in the small town of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.  Though Faziran and her husband are uneducated, they are providing an education to her children. Two of them are in grade 10. The eldest son is engaged in agriculture with his father.

Faziran’s husband has been involved in agriculture for the last five years.  He cultivates tomatoes and grows different fruit trees.  She helps her husband harvest and sell the produce in the local market to gather income for the family's living expenses. 

Realizing the importance of the agribusiness, Faziran wants to expand their business, but they lack the capital.  So she has taken a loan from Kiva's partner BJS.  She plans to purchase jute seeds, fertilizer and pesticides to start the cultivation of jute.  As it is a very important crop, being in great demand in the present market, she hopes to earn a good revenue from it. Then Faziran can easily have some financial help to give a healthy life to her children and save money for their education.

She dreams of buying a car for her family with the profit.

She will be very much grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for cultivating jute.

loans.name: Gita

texts.en:
Gita, 31, is a very young, energetic and hardworking woman from the village of Baroghoria in the district of Jalpaiguri where she lives with her husband and three school-going children (two sons and one daughter). Gita and her husband Ashinath are illiterate and can only sign their names.  As they did not get an education because of their parents' poor economic resources, they are determined to provide an education to their children at any cost.  Their children are in grades nine, seven and three, respectively.

Gita's husband has been engaged in agricultural activities for a long time to give all the basic needs to the family.  He has an acre of farmland that he inherited from his father.  He grows potatoes, beans and chilies.  Gita, though a housewife, assists her husband in his work, especially in harvesting and selling the produce.  They somehow manage the household with this income but are unable to provide a decent lifestyle.

Now she is requesting a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to start a jute business. She plans to purchase seeds, fertilizers and manure to cultivate this crop. Her plan for the future is to have a large plantation of this crop.  She can then earn more and strengthen the inheritance that she will leave for her children. In addition to this, Gita's priority is the education of her children. She wants her son to be a teacher in the future.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva for fulfilling her dreams by giving her a loan.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural inputs like fertilizers and seeds to cultivate jute.

loans.name: Ezerea

texts.en:
Ezerea is a hard working woman. She is 17 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the Iganga region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past two years, Ezerea has been working hard to manage her retail clothing business. 

To help expand her business, Ezerea has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Ezerea to generate greater profits. She will be able to pay her house rent and provide for her family. Ezerea hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Ezerea is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Merlinda
