texts.en: Merlinda is a hard working mother who owns and manages a small tailoring shop within her community. She is 43 years old and has two children who attend school. Due to the high cost of school fees, she needs to increase her income in order to support their education. With this goal, Merlinda aims to improve her tailoring shop in order to generate sufficient income. Having inadequate capital, she would like to avail a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy fabric, thread, and other accessories needed in the tailoring shop. Through this loan, she believes that she will be able to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and other accessories

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is 51 years old, married, and has six children.

She earns a living by farming tomatoes in the Philippines. Jovita is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other supplies for her business. Jovita has been farming tomatoes for seven years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other supplies

loans.name: Jyotsna

texts.en:
Jyotsna is a 42-year-old woman and lives with her husband and three children (two sons and one daughter). The son is grown up and in college.  One of their daughters reads in grade four and the other is too young and below the school-going age.  They live in Shalbari in the district of Jalpaiguri.  Jyotsna is a housewife who attended school until grade eight, but could not study further as her parents could not afford the expenses.

Jyotsna's husband Keshab, 46 years old, is a labourer in a factory. To earn more for his family, he is also engaged in a fishery business. He catches fish from his pond and sells them in the local market.  They have their own pond where they raise fish.  Jyotsna helps her husband sell the fish in the market.  The demand for fish in the region is very high, as it is consumed by most of the people.  This is the only source of income for the family.

Jyotsna is requesting a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase fingerlings to grow more fish in their pond. She will use a portion of her loan to buy fishing net and insecticides to prevent the fish from decaying. She thinks that this will help her to strengthen the business and respond to the clients' demands.  She hopes to earn more profit to give steady financial help to her family.

She wants to get ahead with her business and she wants to thank her lenders (BJS and Kiva) for the loan.

loans.use: To buy fingerlings, fishing net and insecticides

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 41 years old, married and has four children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

For the past three years Helen has sold ready-to-wear clothes in the Philippines. She is applying for a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell. Her goal is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: o buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos es una persona muy trabajadora, es vendedor ambulante, y viene trabajando para poder ayudar a su familia por medio de ese esfuerzo. El comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso para poder comprar sobrecamas y hamacas para la venta, que le ha sido de mucha ayuda.
Hoy pide un nuevo préstamo para poder comprar mas hamacas y sobrecamas, para que de esa manera pueda seguir trabajando y luchando por su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is a very hard worker. He is a street vendor and works in order to help his family. He says that he used his previous loan to purchase bedspreads and hammocks to sell, which was very helpful.

Today he is requesting a new loan to be able to purchase more hammocks and bedspreads so he can continue working and striving for his family.

loans.use: to purchase hammocks and bedspreads.

loans.name: Nadia's Group

texts.en:
Nadia's Group is comprised of  hard-working women. Nadia is 18 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba, in the Iganga region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past two years, Nadia has been working hard to manage her food stall business, in which she sells Irish potatoes. 

To help expand her business, Nadia has requested a loan of UGX 600,000 (Ugandan shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more raw food items, like cassava and sweet potatoes, and will help Nadia to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her siblings. Nadia hopes that, in the future, she will be able to open up an account. 

Nadia is a member of BRAC Uganda's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more raw food items, like cassava and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 37 years old and has four children. She is married and has four children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business and fattens pigs in the Philippines. Emily has been in this business for 10 years.

Emily requested a 29,500 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feeds, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs. She has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Emily would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Estella

texts.en:
Estella is 45 years old and single.

She earns a living farming vegetables in the Philippines. Estella has been farming vegetables for nine years and also earns additional income from buying and reselling used clothing.

Estella is borrowing 15,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and reselling root crops in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from raising livestock. 

Evelyn is borrowing 18,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more root crops to sell for her business buying and reselling root crops. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more root crops to sell

loans.name: Armandina

texts.en:
Armandina is taking a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. 

She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as water, noodles, coffee, sugar, bread, and shampoo. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $200. 

Armandina is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy water, noodles, coffee, sugar, bread, and shampoo.

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
Pedro de 35 años de edad, estudio hasta 5 grado, está acompañado, su compañera de vida trabaja en oficios domésticos, tienen tres hijos de los cuales 2 están estudiando educación básica.


Desde la edad de 10 años ha trabajado en la agricultura junto a su padre, además aprendió el oficio de albañilería. Produce 10,000 mt2 de cultivo de maíz, el cual está a una distancia de 200 mts y lo recorre a pie.


El crédito será invertido para comprar  bono, fertilizantes, pesticidas y hetbicidas. De esta forma  se ayuda a que Pedro pueda tener ingresos este año.

El sueño de Pedro es que sus hijos estudien y logren prepararse, para enfrentar los retos de la vida, también planifica trabajar mucho para mejorarles la calidad de vida y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Pedro is 35 years old, and he attended school until the 5th grade. He lives in a relationship and his life partner works as a housekeeper. They have three children, two of whom are studying in grade school.  He has worked in agriculture since he was 10 years old, alongside his father, and he also learned bricklaying. 

He produces corn on about one hectare (about 2.5 acres), which is about 200 meters away, and he goes there on foot. The loan will be invested in the purchase of compost, fertilizers, pesticide, and herbicide; and in this way Pedro will have help so that he can have earnings this year.

Pedro’s dream is that his children can attend school and be able to prepare themselves to face life’s challenges. He also plans to work hard in order to improve their quality of life and to improve their home.

loans.use: to purchase compost, fertilizers, pesticide and herbicide, which will help him to have earnings this year.

loans.name: José Ramón

texts.es:
El señor José Ramón, labora como obrero de la construcción en la Ciudad de León desde hace tres  años, inicia sus labores desde las 7:00 am finalizando a las 5:00 pm el realiza este trabajo para llevar el sustento a su hogar.

Don José solicito este crédito a Ceprodel para la  compra de zinc y perlines para reparación del techo de su humilde vivienda ya que está próximo el invierno, así tener un mejor nivel de vida junto a su familia.
texts.en:
José Ramón has worked in construction in the city of León for three years, starting work at 7:00 a.m. and finishing at 5:00 p.m.  He does this work in order to provide for his home. 

He is requesting this loan from Ceprodel for the purchase of zinc sheeting and purlins in order to repair the roof of his simple home, as winter is near; and in this way he and his family will have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase zinc sheeting and purlins.

loans.name: Virgen Del Parana Group

texts.es:
Virgen del Paraná lo conforman mujeres de Ciudad del Este, están en su 3º ciclo  del programa de comité de Mujeres, pasaron a este ciclo sin ningún atraso ni cualquier otro inconveniente; son muy unidas y trabajadoras y mediante la ayuda entre todas van fortaleciendo el grupo donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y  ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde gracias al trabajo de todas han ido mejorando bastante.
Ninfa es parte de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas que vende de manera ambulante, y que por medio de su trabajo lucha por dar a su familia todo lo que no pudo tener. Es una mujer muy dedicada y que quiere mejorar sus condiciones de vida por medio de su trabajo. Quiere este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas de invierno, ya que quiere tener una mejor variedad para poder ofrecer a sus clientes una buena variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Virgen del Paraná is made up of women from Ciudad del Este. They are in their third loan cycle with the women's committee program, and have made it to this cycle with no setbacks or other problems. They are very united and hardworking, and with them all helping each other, the group is getting stronger. In this group everyone commits to work and help each other to get ahead. They are doing the poverty elimination survey, where, thanks to all of their work, they have improved significantly.

Ninfa is part of this group. She sells various items of clothing from place to place, and by means of her work she fights to give her family everything she couldn't have. She is a very dedicated woman who wants to improve her conditions of life by working. She wants this loan so she can invest it in the purchase of winter clothing, since she wants to have a better variety in order to offer her clients a good variety of products.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing to sell

loans.name: Rosa Idalia

texts.es:
Rosa de 29 años de edad,  estudio  hasta 8° siendo una familia de 7 hermanos y sus padres eran muy pobres y no pudieron darle mayor estudio, su compañero de vida hace viajes en un carro su hogar esta formado de tres personas que dependen de él.

Rosa actualmente se dedica a comprar pollos de engorde que en un termino de 5 semanas los esta vendiendo tiene 10 años de hacer esto ey o aprendió de su madre su horario es difícil de describir por el tipo de negocio que lo tiene en la casa. 


El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar mas pollos y cancelar una deuda en otro banco.

Rosa sueña en preparar a sus hijos académicamente y poder tener una vivienda propia por que la casa donde viven es de su hermano.
texts.en:
Rosa, 29, studied until the eighth grade. She is from a family of seven siblings and her parents were very poor they weren’t able to provide further schooling. Her life partner is a driver. Her home is made up of three people who depend on him.

Now, Rosa’s job is purchasing broiler chickens which in a 5-week term, she sells. She has been doing this work for 10 years which she learned from her mother. Her schedule is hard to describe because of the type of business she has which is done from her home. 

The loan will be used to purchase more chickens and to pay off her debt to another bank.

Rosa dreams of preparing her children academically and having her own house as the house she lives in belongs to her brother.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens and pay off her debt to another bank.

loans.name: Carlos Emilio

texts.es:
Carlos, su esposa tiene un cafetin sus hijos estudian ademas su madre vive con él.
Carlos actualmente trabaja Como empleado en un cañal, es jefe tiene 4 años de estar trabajando,  trabaja como agricultor la mayor parte de su vida y lo aprendió de sus padres su horario de trabajo es de 6 am a  2:00 pm su trabajo esta a una hora de de casa.


El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas y herbicidas, para su milpa que tiene en este momento ya que donde vive es de riego y están a punto de sacar la cosecha en elotes 

Carlos sueña a futuro tener ganado para no salir a trabajar sino que mantener un negocio propio y tener vehículo propio para transportarse con su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos’ wife has a snack stand. Their children are in school, and his mother lives with him. Carlos works as an employee in an irrigation channel, where he has worked for 4 years and is a manager. He has worked as a farmer for most of his life; a trade he learned from his parents. His work schedule is from 6 am to 2 pm, and his work is one hour from home.

The loan will be used to buy manure, fertilizers, pesticides and herbicides for his land, as his area is irrigated and they are about to remove the corn harvest.

Carlos dreams of a future where he will not have to travel to work, but can manage his own business and have his own car to transport his family.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers, pesticides and herbicides for his land.

loans.name: Zebuniso

texts.en:
Zebuniso is a woman who is always learning and researching. She is married and is raising six children. She has a big family.  Zebuniso’s husband is an entrepreneur. He sells women's clothing. 

Since 2010,  Zebuniso has been busy with her wedding dresses salon. She rents wedding dresses. Her salon is located in the capital of Tajikistan. Zebuniso has a lot of clients so she wants to widen the assortment of dresses in her salon. 

She is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy wedding dresses. She is going to improve her living conditions and send her children to good schools. 

Zebuniso awaits your support and thanks you for support in advance.

loans.use: to buy wedding dresses for widening the assortment of her salon

loans.name: Salud

texts.en:
Salud is 50 years old and married with one child. She is busy with her business everyday, but even though she is busy, she makes sure that she can do all her household obligations. 

Salud's services are very much in demand in the community. She is well known in her area for cleaning nails. She has a good relationship with the community. Starting at 9 a.m. in the morning, she begins her business by going house-to-house. She enjoys what she is doing. Nail art is one of her joys when her customers like what she has done.

She is obtaining a 9,000 PHP loan to buy materials like nail cutters, nippers, and nail color for her business. Salud dreams that someday she can have her own shop so that the customers can easily find her.

loans.use: to buy materials like nail cutters, nippers, and nail color for her business

loans.name: Zounu Group

texts.en:
“When you become a widow, no matter the age, I feel you have little or no idea what to expect," says Manneikim. She is the featured profile member of Zounu Lom and is pictured with her hand raised. She is very energetic, hardworking and enthusiastic and always devotes her time to get her family ahead. Manneikim is a mother to two sons and a daughter. They all live in Churachandpur, one of the districts of Manipur in the northeastern states of India. 

As the children are still young and dependent, in order to generate income and sustain the family, Manneikim opens a small variety store near her house. In her store, she keeps biscuits, cold drinks, chips, pan and accessories made by her. Initially, she started the business with a low profile and limited investment and purchased few items. Gradually, she expanded her business and added new items in the store, thereby, increasing her income. She wants to increase the product items she sells, however, due to shortage of money, she cannot afford to do so. Therefore, she wants to avail another loan from Kiva to stock up and refill the shop. 

With Manneikim's first loan, she purchased a refrigerator and used it for her business. It tremendously helped her in her business, says Manneikim. She also has a desire to send her children to a good school to get a decent career and become somebody in their lives. She appreciates and thanks Kiva for helping her and her group.

The other members of the group run a pan shop, sell vegetables, run a grocery shop, and run a tea stall, etc.

loans.use: to buy items like cold drinks, chips, biscuits, pan, etc., for the store to sell for more profit.

loans.name: Mafuza

texts.en:
Mafuza is from Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is a young lady of only 26 years, married and is blessed with three children (one son and two daughters). She studied up to grade 10, as she got married at a very tender age. Due to her parents' poor economic condition, she could not continue her studies. Her husband, Ajinur, aged 34 years and illiterate, is a farmer by profession. Two of their children are receiving education, and the third one is too small.

The income from Mafuza's husband’s agribusiness is very scanty, so Mafuza is also engaged in a dairy business. She has a cow on her farm, and she sells milk to her neighbors. She is highly motivated and struggles to increase her income in order to provide a better quality of life to their family.

Mafuza is a hardworking and optimistic woman. She is looking to raise her family out of poverty through her work. She wants to expand her business by purchasing one more cow. She has decided to start a milk products (curd, cheese, etc.) business to meet her customers' demand. She is very popular in her locality for her polite and good behavior. So, she expects these qualities will help her to develop her business.

Mafuza has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase a dairy cow to grow her business.

She hopes to construct a concrete-made house for them with the profit. Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for her dairy business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase wooden support poles for construction.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, an iron, and a table.

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es:
Oscar de 29 años de edad,  estudio hasta 9° grado esta acompañado, su compañera de vida se dedica a trabajos domésticos, son dos personas las que dependen de él.

Oscar actualmente trabaja como ayudante de albañil, y jornalero trabajo que hace desde que era muy pequeño aparte de eso cultiva maíz trabajo que realiza los fines de semana para el gasto de su hogar, el horario de trabajo es de 7am a 4pm. Trabajo que no le queda muy largo.


El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar abono, fertilizantes, herbicidas, pesticidas y para el pago de la renta de la tierra donde cultiva. 


Oscar sueña en ver crecer a su hijo y poder darle todo lo que él no tuvo y poder tener una vivienda digna  para  su familia.
texts.en: Oscar is 29 years old. He studied up to 9th grade. He has a domestic partner, who works in domestic chores. There are two people, who depend on his support. Currently Oscar works as a mason assistant and as a daily worker, a job that he performs since he was young. Besides that he grows corn, a job that he does on weekends to get income for his household. His schedule is from 7 am to 4 pm. This job is not far away. He will use this loan to buy fertilizers, herbicides, pesticides, and to pay for the rent of the land where he farms. Oscar dreams of seeing his son grow and of being able to give him everything he did not have, and to have the house that his family deserves.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides, pesticides and to pay the rent of the land where he farms.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana was born in 1961. She is divorced and has no children. She lives alone. 

For the last 10 years, she works at an organization as a cleaning woman. She uses her salary to provide herself with all necessary things. 

Tatyana lives poorly as her salary is small. She works hard every day for eight hours. She is ill now and does not have enough money. 

She is asking for a loan of 1,000 TJS to buy medicines for treatment. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy medicines for treatment

loans.name: Minati

texts.en:
Minati lives in the small village of Promod Nagar in the district of Jalpaiguri. Her family consists of her two children (one son and one daughter) and her husband, Bimal, who is a farmer. Minati has a primary education, but her husband is illiterate and can sign his name only. But, they are providing education to their children, who are in grade 7 and grade 1. They have a small kachha house (mud, wood and straw-made).

Minati's husband has an agricultural farm where he grows different vegetables in different seasons. He is visionary and focused. He has been involved in this business for seven years. He struggles hard to grow quality vegetables to satisfy his customers. His land is very fertile and productive. His primary customers are individuals.  

Minati, though a housewife, helps her husband a lot by sowing, planting and carrying the produce to the market. They need to expand their business in order to cope with the increasing expenses of their family, but their main challenge is capital.

So, Minati has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to cultivate ribbed gourd on their farmland. She wants to utilize the loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other necessary agricultural inputs to start the cultivation. She has chosen this crop, as it is the best season to cultivate ribbed gourd, and there is a high demand for this crop in their locality.

Her goals are to strengthen their family business and economy, to provide better education to her children and construct a better house for them to live in.

She thanks her lenders for helping her by giving her the loan.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivation of ribbed gourd.

loans.name: Kara Group

texts.en:
Coming from a small town in Manipur doesn't stop these hardworking women from having big dreams. Like all mothers, it is their dream to fulfill the wishes of their children. They are ready to put in as much work as required to achieve their dream. They need a loan for their businesses and to accomplish their goals.

Vungngaihlian is the featured borrower profile member for the Kara Lom group. She is pictured with her hand raised. She lives with her husband and two daughters. Her husband works as a paid laborer. As his income is not reliable, Vungngaihlian sells vegetables, dry fish, smoked meat, etc. at the market. She buys fresh vegetables from the suppliers and sells them for more profit. She wanted to add more varieties in her vendor, but due to the shortage of money, she couldn't refill the vendor nor buy new items.   

With the assistance of the Kiva loan, she is planning to purchase a variety of stock. This will enable her to make more income than usual and will help her manage her savings. She is happy that she could at least generate income and is satisfied because she can also take care of her household chores and manage the family affairs at the same time. 
 
She thanked Kiva for being such a great help towards her and the group. The rest of the group members are engaged in vegetable vending, pan shop and weaving.

loans.use: to buy more vegetable varieties, dry fish and smoked meat and sell it for more profit.

loans.name: Al-Bahr Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Bahr, and it consists of three ladies who live in Aden, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank.

Nada is a hardworking woman. She is married and lives with her family in a rented house in a poor area of Aden. She is the leader of the group. 

She started her business selling women's clothes and accessories door-to-door three years ago. She started her business with a small amount of capital. 

In the beginning, she applied to AMB and took a first loan. From that loan, Nada started the first step of her business. That loan helped her to improve the conditions of her life. She is very thankful for AMB lenders. Year-by-year, her business improved more and more. She loves her business very much because she loves what she does. She has good experience with this business. 

Thanks to her experience, she deals with her own business with ease. To further improve her business, Nada applied for another loan of 70,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more women's clothes and accessories so that she can resell them to her customers.

Nada looks forward to expanding her business, and she hopes to provide her children with a secure future.

loans.use: to purchase more women's clothes and accessories to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Racheal's Group

texts.en:
Racheal's group is comprised of hardworking women. Racheal is 18 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the Iganga region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past year, Racheal has been working hard to manage her salon business, which deals in hairdressing. 

To help expand her business, Racheal has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy braids, weaves and driers. This will help Racheal to generate greater profits and encourage self-development. Racheal hopes that in the future she will be able to return to school. 

Racheal is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy braids, weaves and driers

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.es:
17 son las mujeres que integran este grupo llamado Amanecer, todas ellas son mujeres muy luchadoras, que quieren mejorar sus condiciones de vida por medio del trabajo en conjunto. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas están luchando y trabajando arduamente.
Isidora es una mujer muy trabajadora que se está esforzando para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y ayudar a su familia. Ella se dedica a la venta de asaditos que ella misma hace y que con esfuerzo sale a a vender de manera ambulante. Comenta que le está yendo muy bien, y que se está esforzando cada día más.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar carne, condimentos, panificados y demás productos para poder seguir haciendo sus asaditos, ya que es de esta forma que procura los ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
The group “Amanecer” (“Dawn”) is made up of 17 women. They are all very hardworking and determined women who want to improve their living conditions by working together. They are undergoing the poverty elimination survey, where they are all striving and working hard to improve their economic levels.

Isidora is a hardworking woman who strives improve her life and help her family. She makes a living selling her homemade barbecue which she sells as a traveling vendor. She says that her business is doing very well, and that she works harder every day. 

She is requesting this loan to buy meat, spices, bread and other products to keep making her barbecue, as this is the way she makes a living for her family.

loans.use: to buy meat, spices, bread and other products.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
La Señora Maria Luisa,  es madre soltera de seis  hijos  de los cuales solo uno está a su cargo, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, pozol, tiste, nacatamales y gaseosas, desde hace 22 años ella ha realizado esta labor para la mantención del hogar ya que es padre y madre para sus hijos.  

Doña Maria,  se acercó a Ceprodel a solicitar un crédito el que utilizo  en la Compra de maíz, leña, gaseosas al por mayor, lo cual le permitirá aumentar su capital de trabajo y así poder brindarle un mejor nivel de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Maria Luisa is a single mother of six children of which only one is not under her care. She works selling tortillas, pozol [drink made from corn], tiste [drink made from corn and cacao], nacatamales [corn and meat wrapped in a banana leaf], and soft drinks. For 22 years, she has done this work to maintain her home since she is both father and mother for her children. Maria came to Ceprodel to apply for a loan that she used to buy corn, firewood, soft drinks in bulk. This will allow her to increase her business revenue so she can provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Argentina, es madre soltera de 5 hijos de los cuales 4 están bajo su responsabilidad y  labora vendiendo atol en unos de los mercados de la ciudad de León, desde hace doce  años, inicia sus labores a las 9:00 am con la elaboración del atol posteriormente se traslada a su puesto de trabajo para la comercialización del mismo y finaliza a las 6:00 pm en este mismo horario de lunes a sábado.  

El crédito que solicito la señora Rosa a Ceprodel lo utilizó para la Compra de hierro, bloques, cemento, arena para acondicionar su humilde vivienda y de esa manera brindar un mejor nivel de vida a sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa Argentina is a single mother of five children, four of which are under her care. For the last twelve years, she has worked selling "atol' [drink made from cornflour] in one of the markets in the city of León. She begins her work at 9:00am with the preparation of the atol. Then she moves to her business stand to sell it. She finishes at 6:00pm and has the same schedule Monday through Saturday. 

Rosa applied for a loan with Ceprodel which she used to buy iron, blocks, cement, and sand to set up her humble home. This way she can give a better quality of life for her small children.

loans.use: to buy iron, blocks, cement, sand, etc.

loans.name: Karla Vanessa

texts.es: Es una mujer emprendedora, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 34 años de edad, madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos, en edad escolar. Desde hace aproximadamente 3 años estableció su negocio de repostería, gracias a las ganancias percibidas y al primer financiamiento otorgado por PANA PANA, le permitieron establecer una pequeña pulpería. Solicita su segundo financiamiento para comprar mercadería: granos básicos y chiverías. Su sueño es mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio y diversificar los productos que oferta.
texts.en:
She is an enterprising woman.  She is from Puerto Cabezas, and she is 34 years old.  She is a single mother, and she has three school age children.  

Approximately three years ago she established her pastry business.  Thanks to the profits that she got and the first loan from Pana Pana, she was able to establish a small grocery store.

She is requesting her second loan in order to buy merchandise such as basic grains and snacks.  Her dream is to improve the infrastructure of her business and to diversify the products that she sells.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as basic grains and snacks.

loans.name: Municipal Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 3 mujeres emprendedoras que se unieron para poder acceder a financiamiento mediante crédito para ir incrementando sus pequeños negocios y mejorar sus ingresos. Todas ellas quieren lograr mejorar sus condiciones de vida, poder cubrir las necesidades básicas, asegurar la educación de sus hijos, mejorar sus viviendas.

Mery: Es la coordinadora del Grupo Solidario Municipal, es originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 29 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos, el mayor de 9 años cursa su tercer grado de primaria y dos menores de edad. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal, vende de manera ambulante helados. Con grandes esfuerzos hace 6 años ella estableció su pequeña pulpería, en un anexo de madera que alquila, pagando mensualmente C$ 300 (Trecientos Córdobas Netos). Está solicitando su primer crédito en PANA PANA, con el propósito de comprar productos para su pequeña pulpería: pan, avena, chivería, cepillo de dientes, cloro, jabón de lavar ropa, de lavar traste, de baño, huevo, sal, gel para el cabello, papel higiénico, máquina para afeitar. También vende nacatamal de viernes a domingo. Su sueño es vender mortadela, granos básicos, pollo, carne molida y lácteos.

Antonieta: Tiene una pequeña cafetería en un colegio de Puerto Cabezas. Está solicitando financiamiento a Pana Pana para comprar chiverias. Su sueño es tener un negocio prospero.

Flor: Tiene 26 años, es madre soltera de un pequeño de 9 meses. Vende cosméticos por catálogos de manera ambulante y los fines de semana vende frito en los colegios de Puerto Cabezas. Solicita su primer crédito para comprar: perfumes, cosméticos, pilipitas, repollo, vinagre, sal, bolsas, tomate, aceite, carbón y pollo. Sueña con ampliar su volumen de venta de fritos, actualmente vende 40 unidades los fines de semana.
texts.en:
This communal bank is comprised of three enterprising women who joined together in order to be able access financing through this loan.  They do this in order to expand their small businesses and to improve their income.  All of them want to manage to improve their living conditions, to be able to cover the basic necessities, to assure the education of their children, and to improve their houses.

Mery is the coordinator of the Municipal Group.  She is from Puerto Cabezas, and she is 29 years old.  She is married and has three children.  The oldest is nine and in the third grade, and there are two other minor children.  Her husband works in an informal way by selling ice cream in an itinerant manner.  With great effort, six years ago she established her small grocery store in a wooden annex that she rents.  She pays 300 córdobas netos a month. 

She is requesting her first loan from Pana Pana in order to buy products for her small store.  She will buy bread, oatmeal, snacks, toothbrushes, bleach, various detergents, eggs, salt, hair gel, toilet paper, and razors.  She also sells tamales on Fridays through Sundays.  Her dream is to sell cold cuts, basic grains, chicken, ground meat, and dairy products.

Antonieta has a small cafeteria at a school in Puerto Cabezas.  She is requesting a loan from Pana Pana to buy snacks.  Her dream is to have a prosperous business.

Flor, age 26, is the single mother of a little nine month old child.  She sells cosmetics by catalog in an itinerant manner.  On the week-ends she sells fried snacks at the schools in Puerto Cabezas.  She is requesting her first loan to buy perfume, cosmetics, bananas, cabbage, vinegar, salt, bags, tomatoes, cooking oil, charcoal, and chicken.  She dreams of increasing her sales volume of fried snack .  She currently sells 40 units on the week-ends.

loans.use: to buy products for her small grocery store.

loans.name: Grace Group

texts.en:
Mankhoniang is a loving and hardworking mother. After her husband’s death, she became the family’s sole earner. She takes care of her four children and family affairs all by herself. She is 55 years old and lives with her children in Churachandpur, which is 60 km from the city of Imphal, Manipur, one of the states of India. Her two sons are doing sand sheaving on a daily wages basis. 

As the cash flow in the family is unreliable, Mankhoniang engaged herself in making liquid tobacco (local name: tuibuh tui) as a business. She usually buys the tobacco leaf from the market or from a distant village, and then brews it. The extracted liquids are bottled, and she sells them in the market. 

She wanted to invest more money to expand her business. However, due to the shortage of money, she could not prepare more than 20 liters. She runs her business and family with the little amount her husband had left as a pension. With the Kiva loan, she will buy more essential products to continue with her business.

She thanked Kiva for being such a great help. Likewise, the rest of the group members are doing grocery shop, weaving and variety store businesses.

loans.use: to buy tobacco leaf to make tuibuh tui (liquid tobacco) and sell it to make more profit.

loans.name: Jomawa

texts.en:
Jamawa is a hardworking woman. She is 17 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the Iganga region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past two years, Jamawa has been working hard to manage her fuel business.

To help expand her business, Jamawa has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy petrol and diesel, and will help Jamawa to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her siblings. Jamawa hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a retail shop. 

Jamawa is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy petrol and diesel.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a hardworking woman. She is 19 years old and lives in the town of Bugiri in the Iganga region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past four years, Juliet has been working hard to manage her fish vending business.

To help expand her business, Juliet has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fish, and will help Juliet to generate greater profits and take care of her family. Juliet hopes that in the future, she will be able to become self-employed. 

Juliet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fish.

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en:
Hamida is a hard-working woman who is 20 years old and lives in the town of Bugiri, in the Iganga region of Uganda. She has two children who are both in school. For the past two years, Hamida has been managing her beauty salon, which provides hair-dressing services. 

To help expand her business, Hamida has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy weaves, braids, chemicals, and oils and will help Hamida generate greater profits and build up her business. Hamida hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Hamida is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy weaves, braids, chemicals, oils

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a hard-working woman who is 25 years old and lives in the town of Bugiri, in the Iganga region of Uganda. She has two children who are both currently in school. For the past three years, Rosemary has been working hard to manage her hair salon business. 

To help expand her business, Rosemary has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy chemicals, braids and dryers, and will help Rosemary generate greater profits and pay school fees. Rosemary hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Rosemary is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, braids, and dryers.

loans.name: Broda's Group

texts.en:
Broda's group is composed of hard-working women. Broda is 16 years old and lives in the town of Iganga, in the Iganga region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past two years, Broda has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells beans, sugar, flour, and biscuits. 

To help expand her business, Broda has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy beans, sugar, flour, and biscuits and will help Broda generate greater profits and pay rent on her house. Broda hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Broda is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, flour, and biscuits

loans.name: Ditas

texts.en:
Ditas is 44 years old, has three children, and is married to Gimar. She is engaged in ice cream making and her business is well known in the community. Her ice cream is among the best locally. She plans to buy ingredients for her ice cream production like milk, salt, and flavorings. That's why Ditas is requesting a loan of PHP 35,000.

In the future, Ditas hopes that her business expands so that she can meet all the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy milk, salt and flavoring for her ice cream business

loans.name: Safina's Group

texts.en:
Safina's group is composed of two hard-working women. Safina is 18 years old and lives in the town of Iganga, in the Iganga region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past two years, Safina has been working hard to manage her business selling men's and women's clothes. 

To help expand her business, Safina has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes and will help Safina generate greater profits to provide for the basic needs of her family. Safina hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Safina is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Liezyl

texts.en:
Liezyl works hard to support her family. She is married and has a firewood vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years now.

Liezyl requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of firewood to sell.

Liezyl would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Claudia Fidelia

texts.es:
Claudia de 40 años de edad,  estudio  hasta bachillerato ya no pudo seguir estudiando por su situación económica, su esposo es electricista sus 3 hijos están estudiando, por lo que son tres personas que dependen de ellos.

Claudia actualmente vende tortillas y frescos en su casa en un tiempo pasado trabajo en la agricultura, ya no pudo conseguir empleo por no tener una carrera universitaria, el negocio tiene 8 años de tenerlo así a podido darle el estudio a sus hijos, horario de entrado no tiene el trabajo lo hace según la demanda de la clientela. 


El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar maíz y leña y así fortalecer la venta de tortillas y lo demás sera  para cancelar  otra deuda en otro banco que le sale mucho mas caro.


Claudia sueña en poder darle todo lo necesario a sus hijos, para que no sufran lo que ella sufrió, tener una tienda que le genere ingresos económicos y poder ir saliendo de sus deudas.
texts.en:
Claudia is 40 years old and she studied up until high school, as she was unable to continue studying because of her economic situation. Her husband is an electrician. They have three children who are attending school, and they are the three people who depend on them. 

Claudia sells tortillas and soft drinks from her house, and in the past she worked in agriculture, as she was unable to obtain employment because she did not have a college degree.  She has had the business for 8 years, and in this way she has been able to provide her children with an education. Her work does not have set hours, as she works according to customer demand.

The loan will be used to purchase corn and firewood, and in this way, strengthen her tortilla sales; and the rest will be used to pay off another debt with another bank that costs her much more.

Claudia dreams of being able to give her children everything that they need, so that they won’t suffer what she has suffered; and of having a store with which she could generate income and be able to continue getting out of debt.

loans.use: to purchase corn and firewood, and in this way, strengthen her tortilla sales; and to pay off another debt with another bank that costs her much more.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 61 years old and widowed with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Marilyn is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Marilyn has been raising pigs for 19 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia works hard to support her family. Lilia is married and has a candle-vending business in the Philippines.

Lilia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more candles to sell to her customers.

Lilia has been in this business for three years now.

Lilia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more candles to sell to her customers

loans.name: Lyneth

texts.en:
Lyneth is 47 years old, widowed and has six children, two currently in school.

Lyneth is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Lyneth requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Lyneth has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Lyneth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 45 years old, married and has seven children. Her house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her food vending business and is committed to working hard to regain what she lost.

Gina has been a NWTF client since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. She is applying for an 8,200 PHP housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

With your help, Gina will be able to start once more in a new home. She plans to save money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials and pay for labor to build a new house.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a electronic mobile phone load retailing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional load to sell for her business.

Maricel has been in this business for five years. Maricel earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Maricel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional amount of electronic mobile phone load to sell

loans.name: Nubia Del Socorro

texts.es: Es originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 44 años, casada. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos desde ingresos, desde hace 02 años estableció una pequeña pulpería en su vivienda. Solicita su primer financiamiento, para comprar mercadería: Granos básicos, gaseosas, harina, aceite, crema, embutidos, jabón de lavar ropa, de bañar, de lavar traste. También vende helados de frutas naturales. Su sueño es mejorar su vivienda y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
She is from Puerto Cabezas, is 44 years old, and married. With the objective of having her own source of income, two years ago she established a small grocery store at her own house.

She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise: staple grains, sodas, flour, oil, cream, cold meat, soaps (for clothes, body and dishes). She also sells natural fruit ice creams. Her dream is to improve her house and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise: staple grains, sodas, flour, oil, cream, cold meat, soaps (for clothes, body and dishes).

loans.name: Marriam's Group

texts.en:
Marriam's group is composed of four hard-working women. Marriam is 17 years old and lives in the town of Iganga, in the Iganga region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past three years, Marriam has been working hard to manage her retail shop selling beans, sugar, flour, and biscuits. 

To help expand her business, Marriam has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy beans, sugar, flour, and biscuits, and will help Marriam generate greater profits and pay school fees for her siblings. Marriam hopes that in the future she will be able to start up a boutique. 

Marriam is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, flour, and biscuits

loans.name: Kamuyati's Group

texts.en:
Kamuyati's group is composed of two hard-working women. Kamuyati is 16 years old and lives in the town of Iganga, in the Iganga region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past two years, Kamuyati has been working hard to manage business selling clothes. 

To help expand her business, Kamuyati has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes and will help Kamuyati generate greater profits and pay school fees for her siblings. Kamuyati hopes that in the future she will be able to start up a retail shop. 

Kamuyati is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Si Thul

texts.en:
Si Thul is a 42-year-old widowed woman and has only one child who is living with her in a small house in Prey Kabbas district, Takeo province. Si Thul is a seasonal farmer growing rice to earn a living.  She has been doing this for nearly 25 years. Farming is the major source of her family’s income, which she utilizes to support her family financially and pay for her child's education.

Thanks to Hattha Kaksekar's new water loan program with a special rate, Si Thul is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, safeguarding her family's health and protecting the environment. She will use the loan she's applying for to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank to improve her household sanitation practices for the sake of her family.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank to improve her household sanitation practices for the sake of her family.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is a hard working woman. Sharon is 18 years old and lives in the town of Iganga in the Iganga region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past 2 years, Sharon has been working hard to manage her clothing business, which sells children's and adult clothes. 

To help expand her business, Sharon has requested a loan of 200,0000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Sharon to generate greater profits and buy home basic needs. Sharon hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a retail shop. 

Sharon is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 38-years-old, is married and has four children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Marie has a buy and sell used clothing business in the Philippines. Marie requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional bundles of used clothing to sell.

Marie has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, Marie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional bundles of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more women clothes to resell to her customers.

loans.name: José Candelario

texts.es:
José de 67 años de edad, estudio hasta 9°grado por lo económico ya no pudo seguir estudiando. Esta viudo y tiene dos hijos los cuales ya están acompañados, él vive en casa con su madre y nadie más vive con ellos.

José se dedica a la agricultura, trabajo que lo aprendió de su padre, además le gusta la crianza de ganado. Es motorista oficio que lo aprendió con su amigo, es  hojalatero y nos cuenta que para sacar a su familia adelante él ha trabajado de todo un poco hoy a sus 67 años dice que se siente fuerte para sembrar maíz y maicillo. Se levanta a las 4:30 am para ordeñar 3 vacas que tiene y luego las traslada al potrero, para llegar ahí camina unos 15 minutos, luego regresa para hacer su comida para irse a la milpa donde trabaja unas 6 horas y luego regresa para el almuerzo y por la tarde recoge el ganado.
 

El crédito será invertido en la compra de semilla, abono, pesticidas, herbicidas para la siembra de 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz.

Sus sueños son:
-  Tener 10 vacas lecheras.
-  Comprar unos 21,000 metros cuadrados de tierra para tener su ganado.
-  Pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
José, 67 years old, went to school until the 9th grade, however due to his economic situation he was unable to continue studying. This widower has two children, both of whom are married. He lives at home with his mother and no one else lives with them.

José is a farmer and he learned this work from his father. He also enjoys raising cattle. In addition he is a driver, a skill he learned with his friend, as well as a tinsmith. He tells us that he has done a little of everything in order to help his family get ahead. Today, at the age of 67, he says he feels strong enough to plant corn and a corn field. He gets up at 4:30 a.m. to milk his three cows and then walks them to pasture, which is about 15 minutes away. Then he returns home to cook some food only to leave for his parcel of land where he works some 6 more hours. Then he returns home to eat lunch and in the afternoon he goes to bring in his cattle.

The loan will be invested in purchasing seed, fertilizer, pesticides and herbicide in order to plant his 14,000 sq. meters of corn.

His dreams are:
-to own 10 milk cows;
 -to purchase some 21,000 sq. meters of land to herd his cattle
 -to pay off his loan.

loans.use: to purchase seed, fertilizer, pesticides and herbicides to plant 14,000 sq. meters of corn.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario trabaja por cuenta propia en la compra-venta de prendas de vestir, calzados deportivos para damas y caballeros. Él es una persona muy trabajadora y dedicada, que también está estudiando para poder seguir creciendo como persona y como profesional.
La carrera que eligió es la de Administración de empresas, donde por medio de su esfuerzo está saliendo adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus gastos de manutención, como copias y gastos de pasaje. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Mario works for himself buying and selling clothing and athletic shoes for men and women.  He is a very hardworking and dedicated person.  He is also attending school to continue growing as a person and a professional.  He is studying Business Administration, and with his efforts, he is succeeding.  

He is requesting this loan to pay for his supplies, such as copies, and transportation costs.  He is grateful for the opportunity that he is receiving since it will be a lot of help.

loans.use: to pay for supplies and transportation costs.

loans.name: Emilce

texts.es:
Emilce es de la ciudad de Luque, está casada y es madre. Comenta que está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, lo que le permitirá poder seguir sus ideales y sueños de ser una buena profesional.
Comenta que es su familia quien la inspira a poder seguir con sus estudios, ya que quiere ser un ejemplo para su hijo y poder ayudar a su marido.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus metas y sueños.
texts.en:
Emilce is from the city of Luque.  She is married and a mother.  She is studying for a degree in nursing since it will allow her to follow her goals and dreams of being a good professional.

She says that her family inspired her to continue with her studies, since she wants to be an example for her son and be able to help her husband.

She is requesting this loan to pay university fees so that she can continue with her goals and dreams.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen has a backyard business raising cattle to earn a living. She uses the benefit of having a few hectares of land at her home to raise large cattle. 

She has successfully repaid her previous loan used in buying a cow, for she had another income aside from this, which is farming. 

She took a new loan from GDMPC Microcredit to buy additional cattle for fattening.

In the future, Carmen hopes to have her own cattle ranch on one acre of land.

loans.use: to buy additional cattle for fattening.

loans.name: Clemente Alexis

texts.es:
Constancia es la mayor virtud que posee Clemente, hombre que desde temprana edad aprendió el oficio de sus padres, la artesanía, la cuál ha sido una de sus principales fuentes de ingresos durante veinte años. Tiene 40 años de edad, está casado y tiene dos hijos. Al conformar una familia, se vio con la necesidad de buscar otro trabajo, para brindarles a sus hijos educación y salud de calidad. Ahora es guarda de seguridad y al mismo tiempo artesano; recibe encargos de artesanías, la que realiza en su tiempo libre.
Él solicita el crédito para mejorar el sistema de su servicio higiénico en su hogar, con el objetivo de brindar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. Clemente deposita su confianza en el financiamiento, puesto que le ayudará a fortalecer el desarrollo social y económico en su familia. Su meta es seguir dando lo mejor de sí mismo en sus dos trabajos. Cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su esposa,  el sueño de ambos es terminar la construcción del inodoro y acondicionar mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Perseverance is Clemente’s greatest virtue. From an early age he learned his parent’s trade, craftsmanship. This has been one of his main sources of income for the past twenty years. He is 40 years old, married and has two children. 

Having a family forced him to find another job. He had the necessity of giving his children an education and a decent health care. Now he is a security guard and at the same time, a craftsman. He receives different orders, which he carries out during his free time. 

With the objective of improving his family’s living conditions, he is requesting a loan to improve the sanitary facilities of his house. Clemente is putting his trust on this credit, since it will help him to strengthen the social and economic improvement of his family.

His goal is to keep giving the best of him at both of his jobs. He has the unconditional support of his wife. Their dream is to finish the installation of a toilet and to improve their home.

loans.use: to improve the sanitary facility of his house.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel, a sus 26 años es un hombre con muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar, por esta razón se ha dedicado a varias actividades durante toda su vida.
Actualmente se dedica a la cría de cerdos, activad que aprendo a lado de sus padres desde que era un niño. a través de los años ha ido perfeccionando sus técnicas y es todo un experto en este oficio.
Tiene la esperanza de poder comprar mas crías de cerdo y de esta manera poder aumentar sus ingresos.
su mayor motivación es su hijo de 2 años por el cual trabaja y lucha día a día.
Su mayor desafío es la falta de capital para mantener su negocio vigente pero se le nota muy entusiasmado y feliz con su negocio.
texts.en:
Manuel is 26 years old, and he is a man with a great desire to move forward and to advance; and this is the reason that he has worked in various occupations throughout his life.

He raises pigs, an occupation that he learned alongside his parents when he was a boy. Through the years he has been perfecting his techniques and he is an expert in this field. He hopes to be able to purchase more piglets, and in this way, be able to increase his earnings.

His major motivation is his two-year-old son, for whom he works and fights every day, and his major challenge is lacking the capital to keep his business strong, but he is very enthusiastic and happy with it.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to raise and sell.

loans.name: Viani

texts.es:
Viani es una mujer de grandes esperanzas y sueños. Sueña con tener un gran supermercado que utilice el autoservicio.
Ella en estos momentos tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su casa, desde allí vende variados productos a sus clientes. Pero desea que su negocio crezca y sea mas versátil, por esta razón solicita un apoyo económico para comprar surtido, insumos e instrumentos de cocina ya que desea comenzar a vender desayunos y almuerzos en su establecimientos.
Tiene gran dedicación y fe en su actividad y su principal motivación es su hijo.
texts.en: Viani is a woman with great aspirations and dreams. She dreams of owning a large self-service supermarket. Currently she runs a small grocery store out of her house. From there she sells various products to her customers. But she wishes for her business to grow and be more diverse. For this reason, she seeks financial aid to buy goods, ingredients and cooking sets as she wishes to start selling breakfast and lunch from her store. She has great dedication and faith in this activity and her main motivation is her son.

loans.use: To buy goods, ingredients and cooking sets to prepare lunches and sell them from her store

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis esta estudiando la carrera de veterinaria, es una persona que se esta esforzando bastante en poder cumplir sus metas y sueños. Comenta que su anterior préstamo lo uso en poder comprar materiales de estudios, que le ha sido de mucha ayuda.
Hoy pide un nuevo préstamo ya que quiere pagar las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando. Agradece por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Luis is studying to be a veterinarian. He is a person who works extremely hard in order to accomplish his goals and dreams. He says that he used his previous loan to buy study materials, and that it has been a great help.
He is now requesting a new loan because he wants to pay his university tuition and keep studying. He is grateful for this opportunity; it will be a great help to him.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Rosa de Lima está en su ciclo número  7º del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas son mujeres jefas de familia, que quieren poder ayudar a sus familias por medio de su trabajo y esfuerzo. Cada una es una persona muy emprendedora que quiere crecer y capacitarse.
Maria es una de estas mujeres que integra este grupo, ella es manicurista, hace todo tipo de formar, dibujos en las uñas de sus clientes, ella es una mujer muy creativa que está saliendo adelante gracias a su empeño y lucha. Ve una gran oportunidad de progreso en formar parte del programa de comités, es por eso que se está esforzando y lucha cada día más.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de esmaltes, acetonas, pinceles, y demás insumos para poder seguir con su trabajo, ayudando a sus seres queridos y mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The Santa Rosa de Lima Communal Bank is in its 7th loan cycle of the women’s committee program. They are single mothers who are heads of household and want to be able to help their families through their work and effort. Each one is a very enterprising person who wants to grow and get the necessary training.

María is one of these women who has joined the group. She is a manicurist who shapes and draws pictures on her customers’ nails.  She is a very creative woman who is getting ahead thanks to her grit and determination. She sees a great opportunity to progress by becoming part of the program of committees. It is because of this that she is struggling and striving more each day.

She is requesting this loan in order to purchase nail polish, nail polish remover, brushes and other supplies so she can continue working and also helping her loved ones improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase nail polish, nail polish remover, brushes and other supplies.

loans.name: Ivette

texts.es: Ivette tiene un novio y un hijo ella vive con sus padres en la ciudad de El Alto en una casa de ladrillo y cemento Ivette se dedica a la venta de productos de salud (cremas, shampoos, lociones, tónicos) y necesita un credito para comprar mayor mercadería y poder incrementar sus ventas. Aunque la madre y el padre de Ivette trabajan, la situacion economica de la familia es dificil. Por eso Ivette quiere que le ayuden porque planea independizarse Ivette no tiene una tienda, ella hace visitas a domicilio por el momento.
texts.en:
Ivette has a boyfriend and a child. She lives with her parents in El Alto in a house made of brick and cement. She sells health products (creams, shampoos, lotions, toners) and needs a loan to buy more merchandise and to increase her sales. Even though her parents work, the family's economic situation is difficult. For this reason, Ivette wants help. She plans to become independent. 
Ivette does not have a store; she does home visits at the moment.

loans.use: to buy health products (creams, shampoos, lotions, toners) for her business.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Marcos es una persona muy trabajadora que esta luchando por poder salir adelante, el esta estudiando la carrera de Administración de empresas, a lo que esta poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder conseguirlo.
Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder pagar las clases de su universidad, lo cual le ha sido de mucha ayuda.
Hoy pide un nuevo préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, y de esa forma poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la nueva oportunidad que esta recibiendo de seguir sus metas.
texts.en:
Marcos is a very hard-working person who is fighting to be able to get ahead. He is studying business administration, and giving his all so that he will succeed.
He says that he used his previous loan to pay university tuition, and that it has been a great help to him.
He is now requesting a new loan to pay tuition and continue studying as he has been. He is grateful for this new opportunity to continue with his goals.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar es un joven trabajador, que a la vez está estudiando para poder salir adelante. Comenta que poder seguir una carrera universitaria es muy costoso, es por eso que se está esforzando bastante.
Comenta que está siguiendo la carrera de administración agropecuaria, que le permitirá ayudar a las demás personas y luchar por sus metas.
El también comenta que para ir a la universidad tiene que ir distancias muy lejanas, y es por eso que pide este préstamo, para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de transporte, y de esa forma poder cubrir ese gasto.
texts.en:
Oscar is a young worker who is also studying in order to get ahead. He says that studying at university is very expensive, which is why he is working so hard.
He says that he is studying agricultural administration, which will allow him to help others and to achieve his goals.
He also says that in order to get to the university, he has to travel a long way. For this reason, he is requesting this loan to cover his transportation costs.

loans.use: to pay transportation costs to get to university.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto es una persona dedicada, estudiosa, y solidaria. Le gusta la carrera que está estudiando, la cual es la de Ingeniería Comercial.
Su familia está integrada por 7 personas, 5 hermanos más su  papa y mama. Terminada su carrera se ve trabajando en una empresa en donde pueda aportar sus conocimientos adquiridos durante mi carrera. 
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de título, ya que ello es muy costoso y le gustaría poder cubrir. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is a dedicated, studious, and loyal person. He is studying commercial engineering, and he enjoys it.
There are 7 people in his family: 5 siblings and his parents. 
When he has finished his studies, he sees himself working for a business where he will be able to bring the knowledge he has gained from his degree.
He is requesting this loan to invest in his tuition costs; it is very expensive, and he would like to be able to cover it. He is grateful for the opportunity he is receiving.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Sumaya's Group

texts.en:
Sumaya's group is comprised of four hard-working women. Sumaya is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in the Iganga region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past year, Sumaya has been working hard to manage her retail shop which sells sugar, salt, beans, and flour. 

To help expand her business, Sumaya has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar, salt, beans, and flour, and will help Sumaya to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her siblings. Sumaya hopes that in the future she will be able to start up a boutique. 

Sumaya is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy more sugar, salt, beans, and flour

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a hard-working woman. Christine is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in the Iganga region of Uganda. She has one child. For the past two years, Christine has been working hard to manage her local brew business, which sells beer and local brew. 

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more millet and sorghum for brewing, and will help Christine to generate greater profits and provide basic needs for the family. Christine hopes that in the future she will be able to start up a retail shop. 

Christine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy more millet and sorghum

loans.name: Horacio Manuel

texts.es:
Horacio es un hombre aguerrido y luchador, ha hecho todo lo que esta a su alcance para sostener a sus esposa y sus 5 hijos.
Él tiene una pequeña tienda en la que vende productos básicos de la canasta familiar, la tiene instalada en su propia casa y desde allí genera los ingresos para su hogar
Él tiene el deseo de tener un gran supermercado en el que pueda ofrecer múltiples productos y expandir su negocio a mas personas, pero el problema es que no cuenta con el dinero para lograrlo.
Por eso acude a un apoyo económico para comprar surtido de productos para su tienda y de esta forma empezar a vender en mayores cantidades y mas variedad.
texts.en:
Horacio is a courageous and persistent man. He has done everything in his power to support his wife and five children. 

He has a small grocery store where he sells products of basic needs. He established the store at his own house, and from there he generates the household income.

He wishes to have a big supermarket where he can offer multiple products and reach more clients. The problem is that he doesn’t have the enough resources to accomplish this.   

That is why he is asking for a loan, with which he will buy different products for his store. With this he hopes to start selling in larger quantities and a larger variety of products.

loans.use: to buy different products for his store.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Narcisa is 48 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Narcisa has a ice cream vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stocks of ice cream to sell to her customers.

Narcisa has been in this business for five years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of ice cream to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rosylvia

texts.en:
Rosylvia is 38 years old and has two children. She is married and her two children are in school.

Rosylvia is in the agricultural business, doing pig fattening in the Philippines. Rosylvia requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rosylvia has been in pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Rosylvia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando came from Cuba to the United States over ten years ago. He has always had visions of becoming his own boss and, when the chance to act as a transport agent for Doral ARA Logistics arose, he jumped at the opportunity.  Rolando provides commercial transportation services on items such as metal sheets, coils, vehicles, etc. between the Miami airport and naval port.

Doral ARA works closely with Port Miami and expects to rapidly increase its size of operations starting in 2015. In order to keep up with demand and hopefully expand his enterprise, Rolando sought to purchase an additional transportation vehicle. 

Help Rolando purchase a new vehicle and grow his business!

loans.use: to purchase an additional transportation vehicle.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her food vending business and is now requesting a PHP 8,040 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Lorna will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more jewelry, umbrellas and plastic slippers to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cement for his business.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Meet Salamatu. She is a 39-year-old woman from Jui, a western, rural area in Freetown. She is married, with three children. 

More than ten years ago, Salamatu established her clothing material business. She began her business because she wanted to generate a permanent source of income to empower herself. She works at the business from 8:00am until 5:30pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Salamatu requires a loan in order to purchase more bras, underwear, and different kinds of clothing material to sell. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. 

In the future, Salamatu plans to further expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more bras, underwear, and different kinds of clothing material to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more artificial hair for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more electrical goods and electronics items for his business,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a single parent who lives in near Kikuyu market with her three children. She is a member of Victory Group, Kikuyu. She lost her husband in a fire accident, which had been caused by a kerosene stove at their home. She was left with three children to take care of. Two of them are in high school, while the other is in the nearby primary school. 

She uses kerosene and firewood to light and cook at her home, since she has no know-how of other available options.
