VEP officials, through her group, went to her home and advised her about the biogas plant, since she has pigs, chickens and three dairy cattle that she depends on for a living. She gets around 30 litres of milk from her cows which she sells at ksh 54 per litre. She takes the milk to the dairy every morning. She also sells her chickens and pigs a few months after delivery.

The biogas plant will enable her to use the gas for light and for cooking at her home. It will also help her save a lot from kerosine and also improve her vegetable-farming project, which she started recently.
 
Since biogas plant will enable her cut the cost of buying kerosine and firewood, that savings and the income from the sale of vegetables and milk will enable her service the loan at ease.

loans.use: to construct a biogas plant for light and cooking.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino de 54 años de edad, solo estudio hasta 3 grado y no siguió, porque no tenía los recursos económicos para seguir el estudio. Actualmente vive con sus 3 hijos de edades entre 10 y 25 años, los tres le ayudan a trabajar en la milpa y su esposa se encarga de los oficios domésticos.

Marcelino es un hombre trabajador y dedicado a su familia,  trabaja en la agricultura desde que tenía 8 años, trabajando al lado de su padre que fue quien le enseño a cultivar la tierra, aparte de cultivar la tierra, también trabaja de jornalero en el mismo rubro obteniendo un ingreso más para ayudar a sus hijos.


Al cliente se le estará apoyando para que pueda comprar sus insumos agrícolas para la siembra de maíz, con el préstamo expreso que comprara 2 quintales de urea, 2 quintales de sulfato para fertilizar el cultivo en su primera y segunda etapa. Con esta técnica podrá darle un buen manejo al cultivo mejorando su producción y poder tener más ingresos y sacar sus granos básicos para darles una buena alimentación a sus hijos. 


Marcelino quiere seguir produciendo granos básicos, ya que es su pasión es trabajar en la agricultura.
texts.en:
Marcelino, age 54, only studied up to grade 3 and and did not continue because he did not have the economic resources. He now lives with his three children who are between the ages of 10 and 25. They help him to work in the cornfields and his wife takes care of the home.
Marcelino is a hard-working man who is dedicated to his family. He has worked in agriculture since he was 8, next to his father, who taught him to work the land. Aside from cultivating the land, he also works as a farm labourer and makes an additional income to support his children.
You will be supporting this client in purchasing agricultural supplies for planting corn. With this loan, he says he will buy 2 quintals of urea and 2 quintals of sulphates in order to fertilize his crops in their first and second stages.
With this, he will be able to give good care to his crops and improve his production. He will have a greater income and harvest grains in order to give his children good nutrition.
Marcelino wants to keep producing grains, because agriculture is his passion.

loans.use: to buy 2 quintals of urea and 2 quintals of sulphates to fertilize his crops in the first and second stages.

loans.name: Enith Elena

texts.es:
La Señora  Enith Elena quiere mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y la de los hijos, está segura que cambiando de trabajo  y conseguir uno que le represente mejores ingresos puede lograr este objetivo.
Para este propósito debe continuar con el progreso en la formación académica profesional. Está segura de que quiere formar el perfil LABORAL por la carrera de gastronomía, para  así cumplir con el propósito de tener  un mejor futuro y brindárselo  a los hijos. 
No hay que olvidar que la educación ayuda, forma y trasforma, quien se educa sabe formarse en un futuro mejor  
por esta razón solicito a kiva el apoyo que le brindan a los estudiantes financieramente  para lograr  que este sueño se le  convierta en una Realidad.
texts.en:
Enith Elena wants to improve her quality of life and that of her children. She is certain that she will achieve this goal by changing jobs and getting one that will provide a greater income.
In order to do this, she needs to continue progressing in her professional academic formation. She is certain that she wants to work in gastronomy in order to achieve her goal of having a better future and offering a better future to her children.
One must not forget that education helps, develops, and transforms; he who becomes educated can shape a better future.
For this reason, Enith Elena is requesting support from Kiva in order to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: to pay a semester's tuition.

loans.name: Marva

texts.es: Es una joven comerciante de 27 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos, dos en edad escolar y un pequeño de un año de edad. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal, como buzo. Con el propósito  de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 3 años estableció una pequeña  pulpería, en el porche de su vivienda en la que vende granos básicos, chiverías y otros. Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar mercadería e incrementar el inventario de su negocio. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y comercializar mariscos.
texts.en: Marva is a young shopkeeper, 27 years old, who is married and has three children, two of whom are school age, while the youngest is one year old. Her husband works as a diver in the informal sector. With the goal of having her own source of income, she established a small shop on the porch of her home 3 years ago. There she sells basic grains, dairy products and other items. She is requesting her first funding in order to purchase merchandise and increase the inventory of her business. Her dream is to expand her business and sell seafood

loans.use: to purchase merchandise and increase her business inventory.

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es:
Joaquín de 40 años de edad, es un señor muy trabajador  y a la vez muy emprendedor,  ya que busca oportunidades de superación. Actualmente, vive con su esposa  que realiza los oficios domésticos y sus dos hijas que estudian en el centro escolar.

Joaquín se ha dedicado a la agricultura toda la vida, pero hoy en día está buscando otras oportunidades de conseguir el pan de cada día para la alimentación de su familia, ya que este año empezó a trabajar como guardia de seguridad, siendo un trabajo muy cansado, pero él tiene la necesidad de superación y hará lo posible para salir adelante.


El préstamo lo utilizará para la compra de 2 sacos de abono, media camionada de gallinaza para mezclar y tener una mejor fertilización de sus cultivos. Además, comprara una caneca de herbicidas para hacer labores de limpieza en su milpa.

 Joaquín quiere mejorar su vivienda, para dejarle un buen patrimonio a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Joaquín, age 40, is a very hard-working and enterprising man who is looking for opportunities to succeed. He currently lives with his wife, who does the housework, and his two daughters who are in school.
Joaquín has worked in agriculture all his life, but he is now looking for other opportunities to earn his daily bread and provide for his family. This year he started working as a security guard, which is very tiring work, but he needs to succeed, and he will do whatever is necessary.
He will use this loan to purchase two bags of manure and a half load of droppings to mix in, in order to better fertilize his crops. He will also buy a canister of herbicides in order to clean up his corn farmland.
Joaquín wants to improve his home in order to leave a good legacy for his children.

loans.use: to buy two bags of manure and a half load of droppings, as well as a canister of herbicides to cultivate and clean his cornfields.

loans.name: Pedro Alfonso

texts.es:
Pedro de 51 años de edad, es un señor muy trabajador  y a la vez muy emprendedor, es conocido por toda la comunidad como una persona muy responsable y cumplidora de sus compromisos. Actualmente vive con su esposa, su hija y un nieto de 10 meses de edad.


Pedro se ha dedicado a la agricultura toda la vida, pero hoy en día está buscando otras oportunidades de negocio como: la siembra de hortalizas, ya que tiene el apoyo de instituciones como el Centro Nacional de Tecnología Agropecuaria y Forestal (CENTA) que le brinda asistencia técnica y ayuda con insumos agrícolas.

El préstamo lo utilizará para reparar un vehículo de carga pesada, ya que se le arruino y requiere de un gasto un poco elevado, porque hay que cambiar algunas piezas del motor y son muy caras.

 Pedro, su sueño es cultivar siempre la tierra con hortalizas y frutales,  para que no le falte nada de alimentación a sus hijos, nietos y puedan crecer fuertes y sanos.
texts.en:
Pedro, age 51, is a very hard-working and enterprising man. He is known throughout the community as a very responsible and reliable person. He currently lives with his wife, daughter, and 10-month-old grandchild.
Pedro has worked in agriculture all his life, but he is now looking for other business opportunities such as planting vegetables; he has support from institutions such as the Centro Nacional de Tecnología Agropecuaria y Forestal (CENTA) [National Centre for Agricultural and Forest Technology] which provide technical assistance and help with agricultural supplies.
He will use this loan to repair a heavy cargo vehicle which is unusable and needs costly repairs. He has to change some parts of the motor which are very expensive.
Pedro's dream is to always cultivate the land with vegetables and fruit trees so that his children and grandchildren will never lack food and will be able to grow up strong and healthy.

loans.use: to repair a heavy cargo vehicle, since it is unusable and requires costly maintenance.

loans.name: Ana Víctoria

texts.es:
Ana de 49 años de edad, es una mujer perseverante, que ha logrado ver crecer sus hijos y  que formado su propia familia. Ella vive actualmente con su hijo menor, quien trabaja en la agricultura.


Ella trabaja como promotora de salud, desde hace 21 años, trabaja de lunes a viernes, teniendo que viajar  5km. De su casa hasta su lugar de trabajo, además de esta labor, realiza los quehaceres del hogar y los fines de semana va a traer leña a la montaña.

El préstamo lo utilizara para cancelar unas deudas que la tienen preocupada, estos compromisos los adquirió, debido a problemas de salud que le incurrieron a gastos, pero ahora quien se lo presto le solicita el dinero en su totalidad, pero ella no puede pagárselo de una solo vez, por ello necesita se le ayude a consolidar la deuda y así ir pagando por cuotas hasta salir del compromiso.

Su deseo es poder iniciar un negocio, establecer una granja de pollos de engorde, donde obtenga ingresos que puedan ayudarle a cubrir con los gastos del hogar y otros gastos necesarios.
texts.en:
Ana, age 49, is a persevering woman who has been able to see her children grow and start their own families. She currently lives with her youngest child, who works in agriculture.
Ana has worked as a health promoter for 21 years. She works Monday to Friday and has to travel 5 km from her home to her workplace. On top of this job, she does the housework. On the weekends, she gets firewood from the mountains.
She will use this loan to repay some debts that have her preoccupied. She took on these debts because of some health problems, but now the lender wants the full loan amount back; she can't pay it all at once, so she needs help to repay the debt and then pay the loan off by quotas until she has paid in full.
She would like to be able to start a business, to establish a chicken farm, in order to have an income to help her to cover her household costs as well as other costs.

loans.use: to repay a debt.

loans.name: Elina's Group

texts.en:
Elina's group is comprised of  hard working women. Elina is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in the Iganga region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past three years, Elina has been working hard to manage her hotel (restaurant) business, which deals in hotel (restaurant) services. 

To help expand her business, Elina has requested a loan of 700,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy maize flour, cooking oil, rice,   and meat, and will help Elina to generate greater profits and supplement her business needs. Elina hopes that in the future she will be able to own a plot of land. 

Elina is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy maize flour, cooking oil, rice, and meat

loans.name: Marriam

texts.en:
Marriam is a hard working woman. She is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in the Iganga region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past three years, Marriam has been working hard to manage her fruit-selling business. 

To help expand her business, Marriam has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fruits like mangos, oranges, passion fruits, and avocados, and will help Marriam to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her siblings. Marriam hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Marriam is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy more fruits like mangos, oranges, passion fruits, and avocados

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora is 57 years old and a widow. For the last five years, she has managed a transportation business. Her son helps by driving their passenger jeep in town. Because she is single mother, she does her best to save enough money for her children's future. Flora is asking for a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy spare parts for her transportation business. This will allow her to provide better service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her transportation business

loans.name: Rochelle

texts.en:
Rotchele works hard to support her family. She is single and has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Rotchele has been in this business for three years now.

She requested a PHP 10,500 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins, and vaccines for her pigs.In the future, Rotchele would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins, and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Maria Lolita

texts.en:
Maria Lolita is 54 years old, widowed, and has four children. She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

She is taking out a housing loan amounting to 8,200 PHP to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor in order to build a house for her family. 

Maria Lolita has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her  rice-farming business. With your help, Maria Lolita can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she  would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel de 23 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora, que a pesar de no haber estudiado, lucha por salir adelante, actualmente ayuda a su padre a cultivar granos básicos ya que ella le lleva los alimentos hasta el terreno donde cultiva y se queda un par de horas ayudando a realizar las labores agrícolas que normalmente se realizan. Esto lo hace a pasar de ser madre soltera, pero eso no le impide seguir adelante, al contrario eso la motiva más para seguir luchando y poder sacar adelante a su hijo de 5 años de edad.


Isabel se ha dedicado a realizar este tipo de actividades agrícolas, desde que tenía 12 años de edad. Ella acompañaba a su madre cuando se trasladaba a dejarle los alimentos a su padre, así también en las labores del hogar.

El dinero lo invertirá en la compra de insumos agrícolas, tales como maíz, frijol y maicillo, ya que son esenciales para la producción de granos básicos, pues es el alimento de cada día en su familia. Por el momento, ella no cuenta con los recursos para invertir por lo que solicita apoyo.

Su sueño es darle a su hijo una buena educación, para que no dejen de estudiar como ella lo hizo, por lo que ella lucha, para poder darles primeramente la alimentación y la educación.
texts.en:
Isabel, age 23, is a hard-working woman.  In spite of not having gone to school, she struggles to get ahead.  She currently helps her father cultivate basic grains.  She takes the food to the land where he cultivates, and she stays a couple of hours helping with the agricultural work that they normally do.  She has been doing this in spite of being a single mother.  She does not let this stop her from getting ahead.  To the contrary, this motivates her more to continue struggling and to be able to get her five year old son ahead.

Isabel has been doing this type of agricultural work since she was 12 years old.  She went with her mother when she traveled to leave her father the food.  She also helped her mother with the household chores.

She will use the loan to buy agricultural supplies like corn, beans, and sorghum.  These are essential to the production of basic grains.  It is the everyday food for her family.  At this time she does not have the resources to invest, and she is therefore requesting help.

Her dream is to give her son a good education so that he does not lack an education like she does.  That is what she struggles for, to be able to give him primarily food and an education.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies like corn, beans, and sorghum.

loans.name: Heuy

texts.en:
Heuy is 28 years old and married with one little child. She owns and manages a farm in the Bakan district, Pursat province. She has learned to work in agriculture, which is her family's traditional business and a primary source of income, from her parents and elder people. Having been in the business for over 10 years, she can earn well for her family and pay for her child’s education. 

Thanks to Hattha Kaksekar's new water loan program with a special rate, Heuy is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, safeguarding her family's health, and protecting the environment. She will use the loan she's applying for to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank to improve her household sanitation practices for the sake of her family.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank to improve her household sanitation practices for the sake of her family.

loans.name: Mariam's Group

texts.en:
Mariam's group is composed of hardworking women. Mariam is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in the Iganga region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past three years, Mariam has been working hard to manage her charcoal business, which sells charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Mariam has requested a loan of 550,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more charcoal, and will help Mariam to generate greater profits and pay house rent. Mariam hopes that in the future she will be able to start up a retail shop. 

Mariam is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal.

loans.name: Vickelyn

texts.en:
Vickelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years now.

Vickelyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional bicycle unit for her business.

Vickelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional bicycle unit for her business.

loans.name: Muwanuzi

texts.en:
Muwanuzi is a hard working woman. She is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in the Iganga region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past two years, Muwanuzi has been working hard to manage her drugstore (pharmacy), which sells drugs of different kinds. 

To help expand her business, Muwanuzi has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more tablets, capsules, and injections, and will help Muwanuzi  to generate greater profits and provide basic needs for the family. Muwanuzi hopes that in the future, she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Muwanuzi is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more tablets, capsules and injections

loans.name: Elly

texts.en:
Elly is a 33-year-old gentleman from Katito who is married to Alice, a business lady in the same town. They have two children who are eight and one years old.

Elly has operated a tailoring business for the last nine years, earning an average income of Kes 7,000 per month. He is taking his first loan of Kes 30,000 with VisionFund Kenya to buy material in bulk. The profits will be used to repay the loan and save.

Elly's dream is to prosper.

loans.use: to buy material in bulk

loans.name: Zita

texts.en:
Zita is 48 years old and has four children. Zita is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Zita is in the agricultural business doing pig fattening in the Philippines. Zita requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Zita has been in the pig fattening business for 8 years now and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Zita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Kidaya

texts.en:
Kidaya is widowed with four school-going children. They live in their own house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her kids, as she is the breadwinner. 

She has operated a business selling Khanga (women's wrap cloth) from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase two bales of Khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of Khangas for resale

loans.name: Zosanitas

texts.en:
Zosanitas works hard to support her family. She is married and has a firewood vending business in the Philippines.

Zosanitas requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of firewood to sell.

She has been in this business for 14 years now.

Zosanitas would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more firewood to sell

loans.name: Babie Rose

texts.en: Babie Rose  owns and operates a general store in their village to make a living. She also sells fire wood, and she earns additional income from this. For more than seven years, she has earned a good income for the family and has successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying goods.  To improve sales, she took a new loan to buy more fire wood and grocery goods. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fire wood and grocery goods

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy more raw materials, like abaca fiber, etc., for her business.  Zosima has been in this business for 41 years. Zosima earns additional income from food vending.

Zosima has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials, like abaca fiber, etc,. for her business

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a divorced woman.  She has three children, all of whom attend school.  She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her kids.

Fatuma has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a stiff competition from other operators in her business.  With the loan she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Eledixo Rafael

texts.es:
Eledixo de 40 años de edad, estudio hasta 4º grado, esta acompañado, trabaja en un negocio de panaderia, vive con su familia, sus hijos estan estudiando y solo sus hijos y su compañera de vida dependen de él.

Eledixo tiene un negocio de panadería, en el cual trabajan muchos miembros de su familia, gracias a un proyecto de capacitaciones.

El crédito sera utilizado en la compra de herramientas y maquinaria para mejorar su panadería y así ampliar las lineas de productos.


El sueño de él,  es mejorar su calidad de vida, y darle un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Eledixo, 40, has a 4th grade education and lives with a partner.  He has a bakery and lives with his family.  His children are in school, and only his children and partner are dependent upon him.

Eledixo has a bakery business where many members of his family also work, thanks to a training program.  He will use this loan to buy equipment and machinery to improve his bakery and expand his product line.  

Eledixo's dream is to improve his quality of life and give his children a better future.

loans.use: to buy equipment and machinery to improve his bakery, and to expand his product line

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is a hard working woman. She is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in the Iganga region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past two years, Sharon has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, salt, juice, and other items. 

To help expand her business, Sharon has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sugar, salt, juice, and other items and will help Sharon to generate greater profits and provide basic needs for the family. Sharon hopes that in the future, she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Sharon is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.


"

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, juice and other items

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.en: Mehriniso is a kind woman from a rural area. She is married. Her husband is a pensioner. Mehriniso is a careful mother of five children. Her children are adults. Mehriniso is higher educated person. She has a higher pedagogical education. Mehriniso teaches Tajik language and literature. She has worked in a school for more than 41 years. Mehriniso has great experience in teaching. She always tries for the well-being of her family. Some years ago, she began building a new house for her family but does not have enough money to finish building the house. There is some work to finish it. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy building materials such as cement, bricks, soil, etc. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, bricks, and soil

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a hard-working woman. She is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in the Iganga region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past two years, Monica has been working hard to manage her hotel (restaurant) business. 

To help expand her business, Monica has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy saucepans, rice and bananas, and will help Monica to generate greater profits and earn extra income. Monica hopes that in the future, she will be able to open up a big restaurant. 

Monica is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy saucepans, rice and bananas

loans.name: Madina's Group

texts.en:
Madina's group is comprised of hard working women. Madina is 16 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the Iganga region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past two years, Madina has been working hard to manage her jewelry store. 

To help expand her business, Madina has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy necklaces, earrings and chains and will help Madina to generate greater profits and pay for land. Madina hopes that in the future, she will be able to self development. 

Madina is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy necklaces, earrings, and chains

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is 32 years old and married with three children.  With two children in school, Mylene works very hard to provide for them.

Mylene's business and family home was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Mylene has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Mylene has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Mylene is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future, would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Luís Beltran

texts.es:
Luis de 51 años de edad,  estudio hasta 6º grado no continuo con sus estudios debido a la situación económica que vivia su familia, esta acompañado, padre de tres hijos, dos de ellos estudian.

El señor Luis se dedica a la pesca, ese es su oficio, este trabajo lo aprendió de sus padres a la edad de 13 años.


El señor Luis utilizara el préstamo para la compra de material de construcción, como grava, cemento, arena, hierro,  con el cual desea mejorar su vivienda para darle un lugar digno a sus hijos.


Sus sueño, es darle a sus hijos un mejor futuro y dejarles una casa.
texts.en:
Luis, 51 years old,  studied up to the 6th grade.  He did no continue his studies due to the economic situation of his family.  Luis has a partner, and is a father of three children, two of which are students.  

Luis is a fisherman and that is what he does for a living.  He learned this work from his parents at the age of 13.

Luis will use the loan to purchase building materials such as gravel, cement, sand, iron, with which he hopes to improve his home in order to give his children a decent place to live. 

His dream is to give his children a better future and to leave them a home.

loans.use: to purchase building materials such as gravel, cement, sand, iron, with which he hopes to improve his home.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.es: Melissa es una joven de 28 años de edad, es soltera y vive con su mamá, una hermana y un hermano. La idea de comerciante nace en el momento que Melissa quiere terminar y fortalecer su educación; para no tener que pedirle dinero a su mamá empieza a vender ropa que una distribuidora le trae desde Estados Unidos, con el primer crédito logró viajar a México para traer mercadería, compro suficiente, el negocio iba creciendo cada vez más, ha logrado aportar más dinero al hogar y termino su curso de inglés, actualmente viaja cuatro veces al año a México y desea empezar a viajar hacia New York, ya que su clientela necesita diferentes diseños para cada época del año y allá la consigue a un precio más bajo con el fin de mejorar las ganancias. Ella inicio con esta actividad hace cinco años, actualmente cuenta con 142 clientas fijas, las cuales le solicitan, ropa, maquillaje, productos para el cabello, zapatos y hasta electrodomésticos. Desea este crédito para comprar nueva mercadería que le solicitan. Actualmente continua estudiando, ahora está realizando un curso de contabilidad porque desea ir mejor preparada a la Universidad. Actualmente cumplió uno de sus sueños, compro una motocicleta a contado, también tiene estantes y percheros para colocar la ropa. Ella agradece el apoyo que le brindo Fundación Mujer con el crédito anterior y promete continuar con una excelente moral de pago.
texts.en:
Melissa is a young 28-year-old woman. She is single and lives with her mother, and one sister and brother. The idea to be a businesswoman was born when Melissa desired to finish and strengthen her education. She began to sell clothes that a distributer brings her from the United State so she wouldn't have to ask her mother for money. With the first loan, she managed to travel to Mexico to bring merchandise. She bought quite a bit; each time, the business grew more. She has managed to contribute more money to the household and she finished her English course.

She currently travels four times a year to Mexico and wants to start travelling to New York because her clientele needs different designs for each season of the year. She can get them at a lower price there, so her profits will improve. She started this business five years ago. She currently has 142 loyal customers, who request clothes, make-up, hair products, shoes and even appliances. She wants this loan to buy new merchandise that they are asking for. 

She is still studying; now she is taking an accounting course because she wants to be better prepared when she goes to the university. She recently achieved one of her dreams; she bought a motorcycle in cash. She also has shelves and racks to hang the clothes. She appreciates the support that Fundación Mujer gave her with the previous loan and promises to continue to have an excellent payment standard.

loans.use: To buy merchandise that her clients order from her.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soft drinks wholesale.

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr:
Ousmane âgée de 25 ans, est un jeune commerçant qui vend des denrées alimentaires : riz, sucre, huile, savon, lait dans une boutique qu’il a ouvert il y a 3 ans de cela avec ses propres moyens. Ousmane à démarré avec une petite somme tirée d’une épargne personnelle qu’il a mis de coté pendant un bon bout de temps, ce qui lui a permis de faire l’ouverture du local où il allait faire l’activité. Ce crédit lui permettra d’acheter les denrées nécessaires : riz, sucre, huile, savon et d’augmenter son stock.
Il rêve de détenir un grand magasin de vente de divers produits alimentaires et autres.
texts.en:
Ousmane, 25 years of age, is a young vendor selling food and other staple  items: rice, sugar, vegetable oil, soap, milk etc in a store he opened three years ago with his  proper funds. He has launched his business with a modest sum from his personal savings, grown over a long time. Thanks to these savings, he was able to open the store he works in. This loan will allow him to stock up on staple items such as rice, sugar, vegetable oil and soap.
His dream is to open a big store selling various food products and other items.

loans.use: to buy staple foods for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies, such as compost, seeds, fertilisers, pesticides, and herbicides

loans.name: Maria Fernanda

texts.es:
Maria Fernanda es una persona la cual realizo y termino  los estudios en el colegio, se graduó en el año 2012, ella es alguien que siempre le ha gustado el estudio y es muy responsable, en el año 2013  ya tenía claro lo que quería estudiar, era Auxiliar en Enfermería, un  día ella iba pasando por una calle cuando escucho  una  serie de programas que provenían de una institución, así que ella decidió acercarse allí para obtener mas información del programa de auxiliar en enfermería, así que averiguo lo que pudo y decidió estudiar este técnico en este lugar.
Llego el día de la inducción y así comenzó, ella eligió este programa por que le gusta ayudar mucho a las personas  cuando tienen una necesidad como de la salud y también esta siempre dispuesta ayudar a quien lo requiere mientras pueda, le encanta esta profesión, ayudar a las personas es algo que ella siempre ha tenido muy presente, ella quería estudiar  medicina pero debido al presupuesto de la mama que es la persona que la apoya en todo pues eligió algo que fuera de un valor más bajo, después de un año y 2 meses que han pasado ella se encuentra en tercer semestre de Auxiliar de Enfermería, está en prácticas, ella ha aprendido demasiadas cosas, como el valor de la vida, de las cosas materiales que tiene, de la familia y de las personas que están en el diario vivir.
Ella tiene planeado y como metas graduarse en este técnico primero que todo, conseguir un trabajo en cuanto de gradué para poder colaborar en el hogar económicamente y poder pagar una carrera profesional, la carrera profesional que le gustaría estudiar a Maria Fernanda es la de fisioterapia, le gusta mucho lo que tiene que ver con terapias y cosas así, poder llegar hacer una gran profesional en un futuro para ayudar a las personas que mas la apoyaron en el trayecto.
Ella solicita el convenio con kiva ya que en este momento no se encuentra en la mejor situación económica y para ella sería de gran ayuda contar con este beneficio, que la respalda bastante en los pagos que ella debe realizar mensualmente.
texts.en:
Maria Fernanda is a person who finished her high school studies and graduated in 2012. She is someone who always liked to study and is very responsible. In 2013, she already knew exactly what she wanted to study: to be a nursing assistant. 

One day, she was going down the street when she heard a series of programs that came from an institution. So she decided to go there to get more information about the nursing assistant program. She found out what she could and decided to study for this technical degree there. The day of her induction arrived and that is how she started. 

She elected this program because she likes to help people a lot when they have a need, such as health. And she is always willing to help whoever needs it when she can. She loves this profession, helping people is something she has always had in mind. She wanted to study medicine but because of her mother's budget, who is the person that supports her in everything, she chose something that was of lower value. 

One year and two months later, she is in her third semester to be a Nursing Assistant and is doing her internship. She has learned so many things, like the value of life, of the material things that she has, of her family and of the people in her everyday life. First and foremost, she plans to and has the goal of graduating with this technical degree, and getting a job as soon as she graduates so she can contribute financially to the household and can pay for a professional degree. The professional degree that Maria Fernanda would like to study is Physical Therapy. She really likes everything related to therapies and things like that, so she can become a great professional in the future and help the people that supported her the most along the way. 

She is requesting the agreement with Kiva because at this time she is not in the best financial situation and it would be a great help if she could count on this benefit, which would back her up a lot on the monthly payments that she has to make.

loans.use: To pay for a semester of registration

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan  de 31 años de edad, no estudio pero sabe leer, es padre de cuatro hijos, esta acompañado, dos de sus hijos estudian primer grado y el de cuatro años estudia parvularia y tienen un hijo de dos años, solo su compañera de vida y sus hijos dependen de él

Desde muy pequeño se ha dedicado al trabajo de la agricultura, trabajo que aprendió de sus padres, se dedica a la siembra de sandia lo que le permite tener ingresos durante el año, la distancia a su lugar de trabajo es de 15 minutos a pie, su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 am a 12:00 pm


El dinero del crédito lo utilizara para cancelar el alquiler del terreno, pagar a los mosos, comprar fertilizantes, y semilla, lo cual le permitirá tener una buena cosecha, necesidad que ayudara a mejorar el capital de trabajo.

El sueño principal de Juan es mejorar su vivienda, ayudar a sus hijos a preparase en el estudio, mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
31-year-old Juan has not studied, but he knows how to read. He is the father of four children and has a partner. Two of his children are in the first grade, his four-year-old son is in kindergarten, and he has a two-year-old son. Only his partner and his children are dependent on him.

Juan has worked in agriculture since he was little. He learnt this work from his parents. He makes a living by growing watermelons, which enables him to have earnings throughout the year. The place where he works is 15 minutes away by foot and he works from 6am until noon. 

The money from the loan will be used to pay the rent for the plot of land, pay for labour, and buy fertilizers and seeds. This will enable him to have a good harvest, which will help him to improve his working capital.

Juan’s main dreams are to improve his home, help his children with their studies, and improve his income and his quality of life.

loans.use: to pay the rent for his plot of land, pay for labour, and buy fertilisers and seeds

loans.name: Monina

texts.en: Monina is 54 years old. She has three children and is married to Ruben. She has been engaged in selling different products in the community for six years. Monina is a very hardworking woman and she is borrowing money amounting to 10,000 PHP to  buy canned goods, snack foods, drinks and spices for her business. She is doing this so that she will have additional income and can save for the future of her family. Monina hopes someday that she can give a great quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snack foods, drinks and spices for her business.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Don Miguel Ángel es un Agricultor de 65 años de edad, con muchas ganas de continuar con su actividad productiva, es conocido en el barrio como un señor muy trabajador y responsable, actualmente esta con la siembra de papa chiricana que vende a los diferentes comerciantes de San Carlos ya que en la localidad esta papa es más reconocida y preferida por la población.Don Miguel Ángel inicio hace cinco años con la siembra de esta papa, aunque toda su vida se ha dedicado a los cultivos nunca había experimentado con este producto, le ha ido muy bien y desea continuar sembrando ya que gracias a esta actividad él ha logrado apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios y salir adelante con su familia. Él vive en una zona donde no hay suficientes fuentes de empleo, por lo que toda su vida se ha dedicado a cultivar diferentes hortalizas, actualmente cuenta con tres hectáreas donde tiene sembrado la papa chiricana, de cada mata puede recolectar un kilo, depende de su tamaño vende el kilo en 1000 colones o 1800 colones. Actualmente vive con su esposa la cual le ayuda en su actividad, sus tres hijos están ya casados y viven aparte. Desea este crédito para continuar con su actividad ya que les permite mejorar su condición de vida. Eligió Fundación Mujer por la baja tasa de interés y buena atención.
texts.en:
Miguel Angel is a farmer, 65 years old, eager to continue his productive activity.  He is known in the neighborhood as a hardworking and responsible man.  He is currently planting the Chiriqui potato which is sold to different merchants in San Carlos because, in the town, this potato is recognized and preferred by the population.

Miguel Angel started five years ago planting this potato.  His whole life has been devoted to crops however he had never experienced with this product.  It went very well and he wants to continue growing.  As a result of this activity, he has managed to support his children in school and help his family get ahead.

He lives in an area where there are not enough sources of employment.  For this reason, his whole life has been dedicated to growing different vegetables. He currently has three acres where he has sown the Chiriqui potatoes; each plant can produce one kilo.  Depending on its size, a kilo sells for 1000 or 1800 colones.

He currently lives with his wife, who helps him in his business.  His three sons are married and living apart. Miguel Angel has requested this loan to continue operating as it allows him to improve their living conditions. He chose Fundacion Mujer for the low interest rate and good service.

loans.use: to purchase seed potatoes and provide for their care.

loans.name: Ma. Presentacion

texts.en:
Ma. Presentacion is 60 years old and married with four children. Ma. Presentacion works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Presentacion's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Ma. Presentacion has restarted and now needs to provide her family with a safe shelter.

Ma. Presentacion has taken a 9,940 PHP housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home and to pay for construction labor. She is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Halimah

texts.en:
Halimah is a hard working woman. She is 16 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Iganga region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past two years, Halimah has been working hard to manage her food stall business where she sells vegetables. 

To help expand her business, Halimah has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more vegetables, and it will help Halimah to generate greater profits and expand on her business. Halimah hopes that in the future she will be able to complete her house. 

Halimah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables.

loans.name: Vilma Angelica

texts.es:
Vilma de 44 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado,  ella abandono los estudios ya que su familia no tenía los recursos económicos para seguir mandándola a la escuela, se dedicó a trabajar en la jarcia junto a sus padres para tener un ingreso extra,  así apoyar a sus padres en los gastos del hogar y para que sus otros hermanos menores pudieran estudiar. Está casada el esposo se dedica a trabajar como jornalero y como agricultor, con él han procreado 6 hijos de los cuales los primeros 5 son hombres y solo la ultima es mujer;  ellos están estudiando el mayor estudia ingeniería civil y trabaja para  darse el estudio el mismo, ya que los ingresos económicos son muy pocos en el hogar, el segundo trabaja como jornal junto a su padre, los demás estan cursando básica en el centro escolar que está a unos 2 kilómetros de su casa todos son una familia muy unida y trabajadora.

Ella desde su niñez se ha dedicado a los oficios domésticos y a la elaboración de lazos, ella aprendió de sus padres ya que ellos desempeñaron este rubro, fue como pudieron ir saliendo adelante con los gastos familiares.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y 3,500 de frijol, con el complemento ella desea legalizar una escritura, con esto ella podrá realizar las compras de fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra en la agricultura y también podrá realizar el trámite en el registro para tener su documento legal del inmueble.

Ella desea que todos sus hijos culminen todos sus estudios, para que no se queden a medias como ella y que puedan tener un trabajo donde sean bien remunerados, también espera que la producción de granos básicos sea muy buena para tener suficiente para la temporada de verano y desea tener sus documentos legales donde ya ella pueda disponer de las tierras sin temor a que algo pueda pasar.
texts.en:
Vilma, 44 years old, studied up to fifth grade. She dropped out because her family did not have the economic resources to continue sending her to school. She worked at rope-making, together with her parents, to make extra income and help her parents with the household expenses and so her other younger brothers and sisters could study. 

She is married and her husband is a day laborer and farmer. Together they have 6 children; the first 5 are boys and the last one is a girl. They are studying. The eldest studies civil engineering and works to pay for his own studies, because the economic income for the household is very low. The second child works as a day laborer with his father. The rest are in elementary school at a school about 2 kilometers from their house. They are a very united and hard-working family. 

Since her childhood, she has worked doing household chores and making ropes. She learned from her parents since they worked in this field. That was how they were able to get ahead with the family expenses. 

The loan she is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to grow 7,000 square meters of corn and 3,500 of beans. With the rest, she wishes to legalize a title, so she can buy fertilizers and pay the farmworkers and also go through the process at the registry to get the title on the property. 

She wants all her children to finish their studies, so they won't be incomplete like hers, and they can get a job where they are well paid. She also hopes that the production of staple crops is very good, so she will have enough for the summer, and she wants to have the legal documents so she can do what she wants with the land without the fear that something could happen.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay for farmworkers and she also will be able to go through the process at the registry to have the legal title on the property.

loans.name: Salam

texts.en:
Salam is a hardworking woman. She is 20 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Iganga region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past year, Salam has been working hard to manage her produce business, which sells produce.

To help expand her business, Salam has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more potatoes and rice, and will help Salam to generate greater profits and pay house rent. Salam hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a retail shop.

Salam is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes and rice

loans.name: Leoniza

texts.en: Leoniza owns and operates a retail business to earn a living. She has been successful in this business for eight years, and she repaid her previous loan used for the business. She finds ways to improve her income. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase more grocery goods for additional stock. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods for additional stock

loans.name: Asinah

texts.en:
Asinah is a hardworking woman. She is 17 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Iganga region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past two years, Asinah has been working hard to manage her charcoal business, which sells charcoal.

To help expand her business, Asinah has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more charcoal, and will help Asinah to generate greater profits and pay rent for her work place. Asinah hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a savings account.

Asinah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a hardworking woman. She is 18 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Iganga region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past three years, she has been working hard to manage her tailoring business, which sells cloth materials.

To help expand her business, Irene has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more materials, and will help Irene to generate greater profits and pay school fees. Irene hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a big shop for clothes.

Irene is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more materials

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a hardworking woman. She is 16 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Iganga region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past two years, she has been working hard to manage her fish vending business, which sells fish.

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fish, and will help Rose to generate greater profits and supplement her business needs. Rose hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land.

Rose is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 49 years old and married with two children. She earns a living with her pig fattening business in the Philippines. Sonia is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase an additional piglet, feeds and vitamins for her business.

Sonia has been in pig fattening for 10 years and also earns additional income from food vending. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream which is to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase an additional piglet, feeds and vitamins for her business.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 33 years old, married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Nida's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store business and is committed to regaining what she lost. Nida is taking out a PHP 7880 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Nida has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Nida would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Grolia

texts.en:
Grolia is a hardworking woman. She is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro in the Iganga region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past four years, Grolia has been working hard to manage her salon business, which deals in hairdressing.

To help expand her business, Grolia has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy chemicals, braids and dryers, and will help Grolia to generate greater profits and use the profits to build a house. Grolia hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a supermarket.

Gloria is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, braids and dryers

loans.name: Zaituni

texts.en:
Zaituni has operated a coconut and mango selling business. She cites theft and competition as the major challenges in her business. In addition she sells food consumables in her shop.

She is requesting KES 50,000 to boost her shop by purchasing bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking oil. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking oil

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en: Ivy is 31 years of age, married and blessed with one child. They live in a rural community planting and harvesting vegetables and root crops to sell. She also runs a small retail store to have an additional source of income. She and her husband aspire to improve their status of living in order to give their child a better life. With this regard, she plans to increase her product offerings to satisfy her customer demand. Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy more stock of grocery items, frozen foods, soft drinks and gasoline to resell. Through this financial assistance, she believes that she will make more improvements in the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of grocery items, frozen foods, soft drinks and gasoline to resell.

loans.name: José Cruz

texts.es:
José de 32 años, estudio hasta bachillerato, esta casado, padre de dos hijos, su esposa es empleada, viven en casa propia, y solamente tres personas dependen de él.

José es propietario de un taller de enderezado y pintura, trabaja desde los 13 años en ello, este trabajo lo aprendió de un tío, también se dedica a la compra y venta de vehículos, la distancia de su hogar hasta su trabajo es de 50 metros, trabaja con él un primo, su horario de trabajo es de 7: 00 am a 5:00 pm

El crédito lo utilizara en la compra de materiales y herramientas, para el taller de enderezado y pintura; para mejorar el servicio a sus clientes y la calidad de el servicio que brinda.

El sueño  José es mejorar sus ingresos, mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio, que sus hijos estudien y se preparen para tener una buena calidad de vida y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
32-year old José has a high school education, is married, and has two children. His wife works as a servant. They live in their own house and José only has three dependents. He has been the owner of a bodywork and painting workshop for 13 years, a profession he learned from an uncle. He now also buys and sells vehicles. His place of work is only 50 meters away from his home. He has a cousin working for him. His hours of work are 7 am to 5 pm.

José plans to use the loan to buy materials and tools for his workshop so he can provide better quality service to his customers.

His dreams include increasing his income and improving his business including its infrastructure. He also hopes that his children will continue their education so they can have a better standard of living.

loans.use: Buy materials and tools for his bodywork and painting workshop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy drinks wholesale

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Las personas que luchan todos los días son imprescindibles, tal es el caso de Rigoberto, que a pesar de las difíciles circunstancias económicas que ha pasado ha logrado salir adelante. Tiene 59 años de edad. Él es comerciante, día a día, es el primero en abrir su tramo, donde los colores llamativos de las sandalias, zapatos y ropa, captan la atención del cliente, quienes son recibidos amablemente y con buena voluntad. 
Rigoberto solicita su segundo crédito para aumentar el capital de su producción, requiere de la compra de sandalias, zapatos y ropa tanto para mujeres como hombres. Él está muy agradecido con el primer financiamiento, con el que logró abrir su tramo en el mercado, incrementar su mercadería y al mismo tiempo la clientela, lo que le ha generado buenas ganancias. Él quiere asegurarse un futuro tranquilo y estable, por lo que labora con esmero y dedicación. Asegura que la clave del éxito, es la perseverancia.
texts.en:
People who work hard every day are indispensable; Rogoberto is one such person. Despite a difficult financial situation, he has managed to get ahead. He is 59 years old and a businessman. He is always the first person to open his premises where the bright colours of the sandals, shoes, and clothing attract the attention of his customers whom he serves in a friendly and very willing way.

Rigoberto is seeking a second loan to invest in his business. He wishes to buy sandals, shoes, and clothing for women as well as men. He is very grateful for the first loan which enabled him to open a stall in the market, expand his inventory, increase his customer base, and increase his income.

He wishes to be certain of a quiet, stable future for which he works hard and with dedication. He knows that the key to success is perseverance.

loans.use: Buy sandals, shoes, and clothing for both men and women

loans.name: Pheobe

texts.en: Pheobe is a hard working woman. Pheobe is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kaliro, which is in the Iganga region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past 2 years, Pheobe has been working hard to manage her charcoal business, where she sells charcoal. To help expand her business, Pheobe has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more charcoal, and will help Pheobe to generate greater profits and pay her house rent. Pheobe hopes that in the future, she will be able to go for further studies. Pheobe is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en: Manzura is a divorced woman. She is bringing up her little child alone, who is now 2 years old. Manzura is a sewer. She sews national women clothes. Manzura learnt sewing in her parent’s home and she is very glad now. Sewing is her only source of income. Manzura has been busy with this sewing business for more than 5 years. She provides her sewing services to clients in her house. Little by little, Manzure is improving her living conditions from the profits of her business. Manzura is going to repair her house because her house is in bad condition. She is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy building materials such as cement, wood and etc. for repairing her house. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement, wood and etc. for repairing her house

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana is 52 years old, married and has five children, three of whom are in school. Ana is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Ana has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Ana has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Ana would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Cecilio Sr.

texts.en: Cecilio Sr. is a father of three who operates a piggery, raising pigs for sale. He had been in this business for many years and he earns well for his family. He also sells pork meat in their village to earn more profit. He is applying for this loan from GDMPC micro finance to buy feeds. His plan in the future is to hopefully improve his business as well as the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy feeds

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: As a way of generating income, Delia engages in making handicrafts for sale. She is 48 years old and has four children who are attending school. She has been in this business for almost 15 years. She aims to continue and improve this business in order to increase her income and to support the education of her children. Having inadequate capital, she would like to avail a loan of PHP20,000.00 to buy rope, abaka, rattan and other materials needed to make more handicrafts to sell. Being a hard working mother, she believes that she will improve her business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy rope, abaka, rattan and other materials needed in making handicrafts

location.town: Brgy. Villa Flores, Sta. Fe, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe is 52 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Fe works very hard to provide for her family. Fe runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Fe has been in this business for twenty years now, and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. In the future, Fe would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Carina

texts.en: On November 8, 2013, Carina's business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan. She has restarted her business and has been in NWTF since 2010. Carina is now requesting a PHP 7000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor, so she could build a house for her family. With your help, Carina will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner. In the future, Carina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Carlita

texts.en: Carlita is 56 years old and married with four children. Carlita works very hard to provide for them. Carlita's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Carlita has restarted her general store business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. Carlita has taken a PHP 10000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor. Carlita is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in future would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en: Mwanakombo has operated a retail shop business, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. With this loan, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. Mwanakomo appreciates the support from her previous loan, which helped her with good profits, and which in turn boosted her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goats to raise and resell them

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy products such as rice, beans, sugar, soap, personal care, etc.

loans.name: Lucia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lucia de 33 años de edad,  estudiado hasta bachillerato, esta acompañada, el esposo trabaja como investigadora de la PNC, es madre de tres hijos, dos estudian y el otro lo dejan con su madre ya que no tiene edad para asistir a la escuela.   
 
El negocio de ella es venta de frutas y verduras, hace dos  años, ella lo empezó por la necesidad de obtener mas ingresos, ya que ella trabajaba en la despensa familiar y ganaba muy poco y por eso se decidió a instalar su negocio propio,su sobrina le ayuda a vender y otras dos personas mas empiezan el día de 4.AM a 5:PM

 El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar más frutas y verduras para surtir mas su negocio y que otras personas le ayuden a vender en carretas en el centro de la ciudad,así la necesidad quedara sastisfecha; porque mejoraran mas sus ingresos y su familia podrá vivir en mejores condiciones.

El sueño de Lucia es mantener su negocio surtirlo y siempre mantener a sus clientes, y lo mas importante darles lo mejor a su familia y la eduación que se merecen y seguir trabajando con la  institución.
texts.en:
Lucia, 33, has a high school education, is married and has three children.  Two of them are in school and the youngest is still at home.  Her husband works in research at the PNC.

For two years she has been selling fruits and vegetables in an aim to earn extra income.  She used to work at a family store but earned very little and decided to set up her own business.  Her niece helps her, as do two other people.  They work from 4:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.

The loan she is requesting is to buy more fruits and vegetables to stock her business and to let other people help her by selling products in the city center, using carts.  This will cover demand and increase her income so her family can enjoy better living conditions.

Lucia's dream is to keep her business stocked so she can keep her customers happy.  The most important thing for her is to give her family the best she can as well as the education they deserve.  She also wants to continue receiving support from the institution.

loans.use: To buy more fruit and vegetables to stock her store and to let other people help her by selling goods from carts in the city center.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sewing materials such as fabric, elastic lace and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy construction materials such as cement, sand, blocks and wood to build an annex onto the house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy educational toys and supplies, and small chairs.

loans.name: José Carlos

texts.es:
José de 21 años de edad, está acompañado, es padre de 2 hijos los cuales están al cuidado de ellos, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, él vive con sus padres y 6 personas más.

José se dedica a la agricultura desde pequeño actividad que aprendió de su padre, tiene 10 años de trabajar en siembra de maíz y Fríjol, tiene que caminar una hora a pie por veredas ya que no hay carretera de acceso para llegar a donde vive; cuando quiere comprar productos para la agricultura le toca llevar cargando en su espalda  hasta su casa.  

El préstamo que esta solicitado, es para comprar bloque de cemento, Hierro, para terminar de construir la casa ya que en estos momentos vive con sus padres. Además,  hará la construcción de un muro de retención.

Su deseo es terminar de construir su casita para vivir en mejores condiciones para su familia,  ya que están pequeños y necesitan de un cuido para que no tengan problemas de salud ya que se aproximan las lluvias.
texts.en: 21-year-old José is married with 2 dependent children.  His wife takes care of the household chores.  He lives with his parents and 6 other people. José has worked in farming since he was small, having learned his trade from his father. He has been growing corn and beans for 10 years and has a one-hour walk along trails as there is no road access to where he lives. When he wants to buy agricultural products, he has to carry them home on his back. The loan he has applied for will be used to buy concrete slabs and iron so he can finish building a house, because he currently lives with his parents. He will also build a retaining wall. His ambition is to finish building his house so he can provide better living conditions for his family as they are young and need care to avoid health problems now that the rainy season is approaching.

loans.use: to buy concrete slabs and iron so he can finish building a house, because he currently lives with his parents. He will also build a retaining wall.

loans.name: Hajira's Group

texts.en:
Hajira's group is comprised of hardworking women. Hajira is 16 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba, which is in the Lganga region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past three years, Hajira has been working hard to manage her food stall, where she sells raw food items. 

To help expand her business, Hajira has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy cassava, Irish potatoes and bananas. This will help Hajira to generate greater profits and expand her business. Hajira hopes that in the future she will be able to buy some land. 

Hajira is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to lending micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy cassava, Irish potatoes and bananas.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Wilma is 44 years old and all of her children are in school.

Wilma has a business selling salted and coated peanuts in the Philippines. Wilma has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy more peanuts and ingredients for her food business.

Wilma has been in this business for six years. In the future, Wilma would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more peanuts and ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 28 years old and married with two children. 

Cristina and her family survived the super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. As a result, both her business and family home were wiped out. 

Cristina is taking out a housing loan in the amount of PHP 8,500 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Cristina has been an NWTF borrower since 2013 and plans to recover through her general store business.

With your help, Cristina can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of the super typhoon Haiyan. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, potatoes, oil, seasonings and vegetables.

loans.name: Issifou

texts.fr:
Issifou est un homme âgé de 31 ans. Il est marié å une revendeuse. Il a un enfant de 02 ans.
Issifou travaille comme revendeur depuis 2006. Il vend des pneus, des jantes et des écrous pour tous clients dans un marché de la ville de Lomé. Il achète les produits au port autonome de Lomé et travaille seul. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pouvoir pas satisfaire toutes les demandes.
Issifou a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des pneus, des jantes et des écrous. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Issifou voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité en ouvrant une seconde boutique. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit d’assurer un avenir radieux à sa famille.
texts.en:
Issifou is a 31-year-old man. He is married to a retailer. He has a 2-year-old child. Issifou has been a retailer since 2006. He sells tyres, rims, and nuts to all sorts of customers at a market in the town of Lomé. He buys his products in the autonomous port of Lomé and works alone. At the moment, Issifou's main difficulty is meeting his customer demand.

Issifou is requesting his third loan from WAGES in order to buy tyres, rims and nuts. He wants to reinvest in his business. In the coming years, Issifou would like to expand his business by opening a second shop. He says that he plans to use his profits to ensure a bright future for his family.

loans.use: to buy tyres, rims and nuts.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Veuve de 47ans, Akossiwa est mère de 03 enfants dont 02 scolarisés. En 2006, elle a commencé son activité de produits d'alimentation générale et de boisson locale. Avec son sixième crédit, elle espère accroitre son activité. A l'avenir, elle veut avoir plus de marchandises et assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: A 47-year-old widow, Akossiwa is the mother of 3 children, 2 of whom attend school. She started her business selling groceries and local drinks in 2006. She hopes to expand her business using her 6th loan. In the future, she would like to have more merchandise and to ensure that her children get an education.

loans.use: to buy grocery products and "sodabi" (an alcoholic drink based on oil palm).

loans.name: Arístides

texts.es:
Arístides de 35 años de edad, estudio hasta 3° grado,  vive acompañado, la pareja es ama de casa no tiene un trabajo estable, no tiene hijos ya que ella tiene problemas de salud, vivien alquilando pues no poseen casa propia.

Él trabaja en la agricultura hace ya 25 años que practica este oficio, el lugar donde el cultiva está a una distancia de 5km de su casa de habitación, camina por veredas pues los ingresos le alcanzan únicamente para los productos de canasta básica no para su transporte.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar una ternera, pues a parte de agricultor quiere también tener ganado para incrementar los ingresos en su hogar.

él anhela poder tener una familia, pues sabe que para Dios nada es imposible y puede bendecirlos con la llegada de un hijo, también tener una casa propia para vivir de una mejor manera.
texts.en:
Arístides, 35, studied up to the third grade. He is in a relationship. His partner works as a housewife so she does not have a stable job. They do not have any children because she has some health issues. They rent a house because they do not have one of their own.

He has been working in agriculture for twenty-five years. He works 5 km away from his house and has to walk to get there because he does not make enough to cover his transport expenses.

He is requesting a loan to buy a heifer calf. Besides growing vegetables, he also wants to raise cattle and increase his income. His dream is to have a family, because he knows that there is nothing impossible for God [he probably means the Christian God] and that He can bless them with a child. He would also like to have his own house and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a heifer calf.

loans.name: Rosario De Los Angeles

texts.es:
