Todos los sábados a las 6 de la mañana, está listo el cafecito caliente que toma Rosario de 47 años como dosis de energía antes de ir a recibir las últimas clases de su carrera Derecho. Desde temprana edad se dio cuenta que la abogacía era su pasión, puesto que le gusta velar por el bien de los demás y la justicia. Actualmente, cursa su quinto año en la UNIVAL. Tiene tres hijos mayores, quienes la motivaron a culminar su carrera, que por problemas financieros no logró terminar antes. 
Rosario no recibe apoyo económico de nadie, es por esto que solicita el crédito, su más grande sueño es poder pagar su curso de titulación, ya que para ella es de gran importancia culminar sus estudios profesionales. Es una mujer carismática y con visión de futuro, apoya a las personas que necesitan legalizar propiedades u otros proyectos legales, todo de manera gratuita. Una de sus metas futuras es establecer una oficina de leyes, que le permita independizarse profesionalmente y trabajar  en lo que la apasiona.
texts.en:
Every Saturday at 6 in the morning, the hot coffee that Rosario 47, drinks, is ready as a dose of energy, before she goes to take the last classes for her Law degree. Since she was very young, she realized that the law was her passion, because she likes to care for the well being of others and justice. Right now, she is in her fifth year in UNIVAL. She has three grown children who motivated her her to finish her degree, which due to financial problems she was unable to finish before. 
 
Rosario doesn't receive financial support from anybody. That is why she is asking for the loan. Her biggest dream is to be able to pay for her graduation course, since for her it is very important to finish her degree. She is a charismatic woman with a vision for the future. She supports people who need to legalize properties and other legal projects, all for free. One of her goals for the future is to set up a law office, which will allow her to become independent professionally and work at what she is passionate about.

loans.use: to pay for her graduation course.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est mariée et âgée de 44 ans. Mère de 4 enfants dont trois scolarisés. Elle est l’épouse d’un soudeur-auto et gagne sa vie quotidiennement en faisant du commerce. Elle achète et revend du riz, de l’huile, du maïs et divers. Afi est à son cinquiéme crédit de WAGES et sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des produits alimentaires dont elle a besoin. Son activité se fait à domicile et elle a démarré en 2000. Elle veut à l'avenir devenir grossiste et prendre soin de ses enfants sur le plan scolaire.
texts.en: Afi is 44 years old and married. She is the mother of 4 children, 3 of whom go to school. She is married to a welder and makes her daily living as a retailer. She buys and sells rice, oil, corn and other items. This is Afi's 5th loan from WAGES and she is requesting it in order to buy the grocery supplies that she needs. She started her business in 2000 and works at home. In the future, she would like to become a wholesaler and to take care of her children's education.

loans.use: to buy grocery products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy needles, syringes, alcohol, gauze, commonly-used medicines, among other things.

loans.name: José Lucio

texts.es:
José de 44 años de edad, solo ha estudiado 9º grado  es una persona casado tiene un hijo  que le ayuda porque gracias a Dios ya tiene empleo.


José, no tiene ningún negocio ya que él es seguridad trabaja en la ciudad y por lo tanto esa es la actividad que  realiza.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar madera, laminas para mejorar su vivienda. 

Su sueño para un futuro es que su familia tenga condiciones de una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
José is 44 years old. He only went to school through the 9th grade. He is married and has a son who helps him, because thank God, he has already a job.  

José doesn't have a business, because he works in security in the city and that is what he does. 

The loan he is asking for is to buy wood and sheeting to do some home improvement. His dream for the future is for his family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wood and sheeting to do home improvement.

loans.name: Apu Marcasunay Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “APU MARCASUNAY”; Este banco se encuentra  ubicado en el distrito de Lamay, perteneciente a la provincia Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Gabina, la socia continua con su negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia después de criar a sus animales los vende a sus clientes, la socia mediante este trabajo desea poder continuar apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes para su negocio.
Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta de artesanía, venta de hortalizas, porteadores, obreros, agricultura, crianza de animales menores, venta de carne, mototaxi.
La socia que sale en la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
La socia que tiene su hijo en la espalda  es la socia Luz Marina al momento de tomar la foto se oculto.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: The members belong to the "APU MARCASUNAY" communal bank, which is located the Lamy district of Calca province in the department of Cusco. The member in question is Gabina who still breeds small animals such as guinea pigs. She wants to be able to carry on working so she can continue to support her family.  She has worked in this field for some time now and derives both financial and personal satisfaction from it. When she has bred her animals she then sells them to her customers. She wants to be able continue with this work so she can continue to support her family. Gabina is seeking this loan to buy guinea pigs for her business. The other members of the communal bank sell handicrafts, vegetables or meat or work as porters, labourers, farmers, small animal breeders or motor taxi drivers. The lady who has her face hidden on the photo is not a member of the communal bank. The member who has her baby on her back is Luz Marina who hid at the moment the photo was taken. Gabina thanks all those who are helping her to achieve her ambition and promises to make her repayments within the deadline.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs for her business.

loans.name: Marleny Nohemy

texts.es:
Marleny de 21 años de edad,  estudio hasta 6ª grado. Esta acompañada  y ha procreado 2 hijos los cuales están al cuidado de ellos, su esposo se dedica a trabajar en una panadería en la ciudad desde hace 25 años.

Ella por su parte, se dedica  al comercio y elaboración  de pan desde hace 1 año,  actividad que aprendió de su esposo.  Ella debe caminar de la casa al pueblo 30 minutos para ir a vender el pan que elabora;  ya que no hay carretera de acceso para llegar a donde vive..  

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar harina, azúcar, levadura, Arroz, leche y todo lo necesario para la elaboración del pan,  ya que en estos momentos lo que hace no le alcanza para venderle a sus clientes. 

Su sueño es seguir trabajando fuerte y crecer su negocio de la panadería para tener mejores ingresos económicos, para seguirlos invirtiendo en la mejora del pan, además tiene el sueño de poner a estudiar a sus hijos para que se superen.
texts.en:
Marleny is 21 years old and studied until the 6th grade. She has a partner and two children, who are in their care. Her partner has worked in a bakery in the town for 25 years.

She, for her part, has worked producing and selling bread for 1 year, a trade that she learned from her partner. She has to walk 30 minutes from her house to the town to go to sell the bread which she makes, as there is no access road to where she lives.  

The loan that she is applying for is to buy flour, sugar, yeast, rice, milk and everything necessary for the production of bread, as what she makes at the moment is not enough for the clients that buy it. 

Her dream is to continue working hard and grow her bakery business in order to have better economic income and continue investing it in improving her bread. She also dreams of giving her children an education so that they can better themselves.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast, rice, milk and everything necessary for the production of bread.

loans.name: Félix

texts.es:
Félix de 40 años de edad,  no estudio, ya que sus padres no tenían los recursos económicos para enviarlo  a estudiar. Esta acompañado y es padre de 7 hijos, de los cuales cinco están en la escuela estudiando el de 14 años está en sexto grado, de 11 años a quinto grado, el de 9 años está estudiando 3ª grado, el de 7 años 1ª grado y los otros pequeños no estudian de momento;  pero tiene el deseo de ponerlos a estudiar ya que no tuvo la oportunidad, su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar y al cuidado de sus hijos especialmente los más pequeños.

Félix se dedica a la agricultura desde pequeño,  actividad que aprendió de su padre, ya tiene 25 años de trabajar en siembra de maíz y Fríjol,  él de la casa al pueblo tiene que caminar unos 50 minutos a pie por veredas ya que no hay carretera de acceso para llegar a donde vive, cuando quiere comprar productos para la agricultura le toca llevar cargando a lomo hasta su casa.  

El cliente invertirá el dinero para comprar reglas de madera para mejorar el techo de la casa,  ya que tiene varios orificios y se acerca la época lluviosa y evitar que se moje por dentro y que las condiciones cambien. 

Su deseo es mejorar su vivienda  para vivir en mejores condiciones para su familia,  ya que están pequeños y necesitan de un cuido para que no tengan problemas de salud ya que se aproximan las lluvias.
texts.en:
Félix is 40 years old and did not study as his parents did not have the economic resources to send him to school. He has a partner and is father to 7 children, of which 5 are in school studying. The 14 year old is in the sixth grade, the 11 year old in the fifth grade, the 9 year old in the third grade, the 7 year old in the first grade, and the other young ones don't study at the moment; however, he hopes to send them to study as he himself did not have the opportunity. His partner takes care of the household chores and takes care of the children, especially the youngest ones.

Félix has worked in agriculture since he was young, a trade he learned from his father. He already has 25 years experience of growing corn and beans. From his house to the town he has to walk around 50 minutes along paths as there is no access road leading to where he lives. When he wants to buy agricultural products he has to carry them on his back to his house.  

The client will invest the money in the purchase of wooden beams to improve the roof of his house, as it has several holes and the rainy season is coming, and he wants to stop it from getting wet inside and the conditions changing. 

His hope is to improve his home, so that his family can live in better conditions, as they are young and need to be cared for so that they do not have health problems now that the rainy season is coming.

loans.use: to buy wooden beams to improve the roof of his house, as it has several holes and the rainy season is coming.

loans.name: Lorliny

texts.en:
Lorliny is 48 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. Lorliny runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Lorliny has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and she also earns an income from bakery. Lorliny aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 58 years old and married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Evelyn's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business raising livestock and is committed to regain what she lost. Evelyn is taking out a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Evelyn has been with NWTF since 2012 in her effort to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Evelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan. In the picture, Gemma is carrying her child.

Gemma has restarted her general store business.  She has been with NWTF since 2013, and is now requesting a PHP 9,500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Gemma will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner. Gemma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Judelyn

texts.en:
Judelyn is 28 years old and has one child in school. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Judelyn's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Judelyn has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials to rebuild her family home. She is also using the this loan to pay for construction labor. Judelyn is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Ma. Lanie

texts.en:
Ma. Lanie is 52 years old, married, and has four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Lanie has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Ma. Lanie requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Ma. Lanie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Acham Beatrice

texts.en:
She is married and a mother of four children living in a four bed room apartment house in Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced so many challenges in life among which are sickness in her family, death of her child, sister father and mother, and inadequate finance to properly manage her business.
With the new loan requested, she will buy more thread for the knitting of caps, nets and bits. She holds a positive view of her business succeeding because she has been doing the business for a long time. She has regular customers who buy from her, her business is situated at a good site and she also knows all the problems and solutions to this business.  With this business activity the community will have a regular supply of caps and bits.  
With the profit from this loan she will take care of her children, provide for their medication and education and will also cater for other family needs. To her GHAPE loans are preferable because of their low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals, and members are also trained on business and marketing skills before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: TO BUY THREAD

loans.name: Maximo

texts.en: Maximo is a farmer who is raising his family in a rural community. He is 59 years old and has three adult-age children. He cultivates their farm land by planting various vegetables and root crops for sale. He aims to expand his vegetable farming to ensure a better yield. Having inadequate capital, he wants to avail of a loan of PHP 16,000.00 to buy certified seed, fertilizer and herbicide needed in growing vegetables. Being a patient and industrious father, he believes that he will expand his farm and have a plentiful harvest.

loans.use: to buy certified seed, fertilizer and herbicide needed in growing vegetables

loans.name: Kin

texts.en:
Kin is 50, married and has five children, three of whom are married and the remaining two are attending school. Kin farms rice and cashews for a living. She has to get up early every day to take care of her rice crop and water her small cashew trees. Her farm is not far, just a 10-minute walk from her home. Kin has been a farmer for more than 30 years and earns well for her family.

Now she is requesting a loan of KHR 2,000,000 to buy small cashew trees for planting and pay for hiring people to prepare the soil. She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family. She is very thankful to all lenders for their financial support and promises to repay her loan on the schedule regularly.

loans.use: to buy small cashew trees for planting and pay for hiring people to prepare the soil.

loans.name: Munira

texts.en:
Munira was born in 1983 and is married with three children. She has experienced a lot of difficulties since being married. Her husband’s family lived poorly and Munira began her own animal husbandry business. At first it was so difficult for her to manage her business because did not have experience and skills. Little by little, Munira has developed her business and she has been running it for five years.

Munira is requesting a 5,000 TJS loan to buy cattle to increase her working capital. She hopes that Kiva lenders don’t reject her loan and she thanks you in advance for your generosity.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna has been selling rice cake for many years. She also manages a general store in her village, earning well for her family. Lorna used the income from her previous loan to buy the raw ingredients for rice cakes. She successfully repaid her loan. 

Lorna is requesting a loan to purchase more groceries to sell. She will use her loan to improve her sales and her additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. Lorna appears here in a photo at her internet cafe business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: Janneth

texts.en:
Janneth is 41 years old and married with three children. For the past six years, she has been running a general store and she also earns an income from food vending. She has borrowed and repaid 12 previous loans from NWTF. Janneth works hard to provide for her family. 

Janneth is requesting a 27,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. She aspires to save enough money to build a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: Ralyn

texts.en:
Ralyn is 32 years old and is married with one kid who is in school. For the past four years, she has been running a general store and she also earns an income from e-loading (mobile prepaid cards). Ralyn works hard to provide for her family. She has borrowed and repaid five previous loans from NWTF.

Ralyn is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. She aspires to save enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: Maebelyn

texts.en:
Maebelyn is single and is 21 years old. For the past two years, she has run a food vending business in the Philippines. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Maebelyn is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Teresita is borrowing PHP 21000 through NWTF in order to buy new equipment for her fishing business.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new equipment for her fish vending business.

loans.name: Mwatime

texts.en:
Mwatime is married and the mother of two children, all of whom still attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past seven years she has operated a fish selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation in her place of operation. 

She is requesting for a loan of Kes 20,000 to purchase a fishing net for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net for her business.

loans.name: Zoila Del Carmen

texts.es:
Zoila de 46 años de edad,  es una mujer muy trabajadora que vive sola con su hijo , ella estudio hasta segundo grado por la razone que su familia era de muy bajo recursos económicos;  por lo que ya no pudo seguir estudiando, su hijo vive con ella, el padre de su hijo murió en la guerra que vivo el país, desde entonces ha estado sola con su hijo.
 Ella trabajaren la agricultura y en la venta de productos comestibles , casi todos los días  ya que hay días que se dedica a lavar ropa ajena  y esto le ha ayudado a ganar un poco más de ingresos.
 El financiamiento ella lo necesita para la siembra de granos básicos como lo son maíz y frijol,  específicamente comprara semillas, abono, fertilizantes, herbicidas, pesticidas y mano de obra; ya que por el momento ella y su hijo no tienen los sufrientes recursos, por lo que con el financiamiento podrá seguir trabajando.
Con lo que ella más sueña es que su hijo tenga su casita y que viva bien con su familia el día que decida formar un hogar.
texts.en:
Zoila, age 46, is a very hard-working woman who lives only with her son.  She went to school through the second grade because her family had very few financial resources.  Therefore, she was not able to continue her education.  Her son lives with her.  Her son’s father died in the war that the country experienced.  From then on, she has been alone with her son.

She works in agriculture and in selling the food products almost every day.  There are days that she washes clothes for other people, and this has helped her a little more with her income.

She needs the loan for planting basic crops like corn and beans.  Specifically, she will buy seeds, chemical and organic fertilizers, herbicides, pesticides, and pay for labor.  At this time she and her son do not have enough resources.  Therefore, with the loan she will be able to continue working.

What she dreams of the most is her son having his little house and that he lives well with his family when he decides to have his own family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase beverages at wholesale.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan is 42 years old, married and has four children. She lives with her husband and three children in a small house located in Prey Chhor district while her oldest child is married and lives independently. Chan is a farmer and grows rice and cassava to earn a living. She has been in this occupation for over 20 years and earns approximately KHR 17,000 per day to meet her daily needs.

Chan has requested a loan to hire local laborers to prepare the soil and grow cassava. Through the loan she hopes to increase her crop yield so as to generate more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to hire local laborers to prepare the soil and grow cassava.

loans.name: Pastora

texts.en:
Pastora operates her retail business in addition to farming to earn a living. For many years working in this business, she was able to provide a better living to her family. With her income, her previous loan used for farming was successfully repaid. 

She never stops trying to augment their living. Instead, Pastora always finds ways to improve her sources of income. She took a new loan recently to buy more grocery goods to add her inventory for sale. In the future, Pastora hopes to improve the general living conditions of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is 55 years old and has five children.  She is married and one child is in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Emelita has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Emelita requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosaly

texts.en:
Rosaly is 31 years old and married with three children, who are all in school. Rosaly works very hard to provide for them.   She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. In the future Rosaly would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 31 years old, married with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Joan has a business making handwoven mats in the Philippines. Joan requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her handwoven mats.

Joan has been in this business for eleven years. In the future Joan would like to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her mat-making business.

loans.name: Esha

texts.en:
Esha is married with two school going children. They live at their own house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a Khanga ( woman's wrap cloth) selling business, selling from her home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge in the lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase 2 bales of Khanga’s for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 2 bales of Khanga’s for resale.

loans.name: Balbina

texts.en:
Balbina is 53 years old, a married mother of nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Balbina has a handwoven-mat business in the Philippines. Balbina requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her business.

Balbina has been in this business for thirty years. In the future, Balbina would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her mat making business.

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en:
Mwanamkasi is a married woman and she has children, all of whom still attend school. She lives at a house that neither has electricity not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwanamkasi operates a fruit and vegetable stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of competition and seasonality in her business. 

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fruit, oranges, bananas and green vegetables to resell. She dreams of expanding and establishing a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruit, oranges, bananas and green vegetables for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement and bricks in order to renovate the house to become ready for living.

loans.name: Estelia Noemi

texts.es:
Estelia  de 23 años de edad, es una joven trabajadora, que vive con su madre ella. Estelia es madre soltera, estudio hasta noveno grado pero tiene la visión de seguir estudiando, tiene una hija de cinco años.
Ella se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa desde hace ya varios años, este negocio lo aprendió con una amiga que la invito a probar suerte con este negocio, ella solamente a esta actividad  se dedica. Realiza el negocio  ambulante,  ya que le vende a personas que es conocida o a las amigas.
 El crédito lo necesita para invertir en más ropa, comprara ropa para mujer, hombre y niños;  ya que el negocio es poco pero le va bien, entre más mercadería tiene vende más y las ganancias son más, con respecto a sus sueños son que su hija estudie para que sea una profesional en el futuro y que le quede esa buena herencia de su madre, también sus sueños son terminar de estudiar,  ya que solo noveno grado ha sacado y ella quiere seguir superándose.
texts.en:
Estelia, age 23, is a hard-working young woman.  She lives with her mother.  Estelia is a single mother.  She went to school through the ninth grade, but she did not have the vision to continue studying.  She has a five year old daughter.

She has been selling clothes for several years.  She learned this business from a friend who invited he to try her luck with this business.  This is her only business activity.  She conducts her business in an itinerant manner.  She sells to people who know her or to her friends.

She needs the loan to invest in more clothes.  She will buy clothes for women, men, and children.  She has a little business, but it is going well for her.  The more merchandise that she has, the more she sells.  Then she earns more. 

Her dream is for her daughter to go to school so that she can become a professional in the future.  Also, she dreams that she will have this good legacy from her mother.  Another dream she has is to finish her education.  She only completed the ninth grade, and she wants to continue improving herself.

loans.use: to buy clothes for women, men, and children.

loans.name: Savy

texts.en:
Savy (in photo) is 42 years old. He lives on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. He has one son and one daughter. Both his both children are still young. 

Savy is a lathe operator. Anyway, the house where he lives is breaking in some parts and he wants to repair it. Hence, he decided to request a loan! Savy will also use the rest of the loan to fill in the land around of his house.

loans.use: to repair the house where he lives and fill in the land around of his house.

loans.name: Loeng

texts.en:
Loeng lives in a small village across the Mekong River and about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She sells fruits, vegetables, grocery items and sugar cane juice in the village market. 

Loeng is a widowed mother with one daughter. Loeng’s daughter is married and sells mango. She buys mango under contract from villagers from the blooming season until the harvesting season comes. She wants to buy additional mango for resale. 

Hence, Loeng decided to apply for a loan to provide capital to her daughter.

loans.use: to provide capital to her daughter to buy mango for resale.

loans.name: Chinda

texts.en:
Chinda (in the photo) is a weaver. She lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Her husband raises cows at home and does construction work additionally. She has six children, two sons and four daughters. 

One of Chinda’s children is a security guard in Phnom Penh City. He stays at his work place. He needs a motorbike so he can visit homeland sometimes on holidays or weekends.

Hence, Chinda decided to apply for a loan help purchase a motorbike for her son.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her son for commuting.

loans.name: Majani Ya Chai Group

texts.en:
Sina, who is in her mid 40s, is married with four children, two of them are grown up and two are still at school. She has been making and selling chapati since 1997. She works from 6 am to 12 pm (noon) and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Sina's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to buy baking flour, cooking oil and charcoal for cooking. She dreams of taking her children to good schools.

Sina will share this loan with her loan group "MAJANI YA CHAI" which has ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy baking flour, cooking oil and charcoal for cooking.

loans.name: Zulfiniso

texts.en:
Zulfiniso is the careful mother of two children. Her husband is a master of repairing houses. 

She is an entrepreneur. She sells fresh fruits and vegetables at her own selling place in a local market. She buys fruits and vegetables in bulk in early morning and sells them during the day. She tries to keep her store fresh and in this way to attract customers. 

Zulfiniso is going to increase working capital and with this aim she is asking for a loan of 2,500 TJS to buy fruits and vegetables. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables for increasing working capital

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
Ry, age 50, lives in a village about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has two daughters, one is married and another one is a garment factory worker.
 
Ry and her husband are rice farmers. Ry wants to help her son-in-law buy a motorbike and trailer to transport small mango trees for sale. That’s why she decided to ask for a loan.
 
Ry’s son-in-law’s business is growing and selling small mango trees.

loans.use: to help her son-in-law to buy a motorbike and trailer to transport small mango trees for sale.

loans.name: Monny

texts.en:
Monny (in photo), age 51, lives in a village approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh city. He has one son and two daughters. One of his children is a garment factory worker, another one is a hair dresser and another one attends school. 

Monny is a motor taxi driver, while his wife is a garment factory worker. Anyway, Monny’s family does not have a proper kitchen to cook. So, he decided to apply for a loan in order to build a kitchen.

loans.use: to build a proper kitchen.

loans.name: Lai

texts.en:
Lai is a 37-year-old married woman with three children. Her husband appears in the photo with her. From Takeo province, Lai and her husband work as seasonal farmers growing rice to earn a living. They have been doing this for more than 10 years. Farming is the major source income for her family.

Thanks to Hattha Kaksekar's new water loan program with a special rate, Lai is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, safeguarding her family's health, and protecting the environment. She will use the loan she's applying for to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank to improve her household sanitation practices for the sake of her family.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank to improve her household sanitation practices for the sake of her family.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Adjo âgée de 35ans vit avec son conjoint et leur progéniture à Lomé. Pour contribuer aux besoins de la famille, elle a démarré en 2008 par vendre des produits de beauté et pagnes au marché. Elle souhaite accroitre son activité c'est pour cela, madame Adjo fait son premier crédit à WAGES pour atteindre son objectif. Elle souhaite louer une boutique et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en: Adjo, age 35, lives in Lomé with her spouse and their children. To help meet the family’s needs, she started to sell cosmetic products and pagnes at the market in 2008. She wishes to bolster her activity and, to that end, she is seeking a first loan from WAGES. Her long-term goals are to open a store and to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products for resale.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 53 years old and married with nine children. Milagros works very hard to provide for them.

Milagros runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Milagros has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Milagros would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Nenita

texts.en:
Ma. Nenita is 49 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Ma. Nenita is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to buy more livestock to raise.

Ma. Nenita has been raising livestock for six years and also earns additional income from frozen foods.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money in order to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to raise.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 60 years old, married, and has twelve children. Seven of her children are in school. Delia is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a business selling bananas in the Philippines.

Delia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more bananas to sell. She has been in this business for 34 years. In the future, Delia would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Annabelle works hard to support her family. She has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.

Annabelle is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her tricycle transportation business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. Annabelle hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 52 years old and married with one child who is in school. Lydia works very hard to provide for them.

Lydia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Lydia has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Lydia would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rodalinda

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Rodalinda works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane and a general store. Rodalinda is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of items like pants, blouses, shoes and other ready-to-wear clothing.

Rodalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past eleven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of items like pants, blouses, shoes and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia operates a retail shop business, selling household consumables to her neighbors and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 25,000, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and grains for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and grains for sale.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam operates a retail shop business. In addition, she sells khanga (women's wrap cloth), selling from home and door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She appreciates the support of the previous loan which helped her to boost her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of khanga’s for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khanga’s for resale.

loans.name: Yehowa Da Group

texts.en:
The six women of the Yehowa Da Group are from Teshie, with an average age of 35 years and three children. They know one another through neighbors and their revenue-generating activities in Teshie. 

The group members sell plastic items, frozen food, vegetables, rice, provisions, cutlery, sauce pans, and eggs. With the goal of growing their cash supply, the group members decided to work with ID Ghana. This is their seventh group loan. 

Mary (standing to the right in the photo) is very well-known for selling frozen food. She would like to use her loan to buy frozen food at wholesale prices and sell it to customers.  

With her loan, Mary would like to earn a good profit that she will reinvest in her business and spend on her children's healthcare and education.

loans.use: to buy frozen food at wholesale prices and sell it to customers.

loans.name: Dora Luz

texts.es:
Dora de 33 años de edad,  solamente estudio primer grado, el esposo está en EEUU, todos sus hijos viven con ella, ellos solamente estudian.  Ella viven en casa de los papas pero solo los hijos dependen directamente de ella.
Dora se dedica nada  más a los oficios del hogar, el crédito lo necesita para cancelar una deuda que adquirió en otra institución  y que fue utilizado en el cultivo de la milpa del papá,  pero  la cosecha no funciono y ella no ha podido cancelar debido a que tiene un hijo que está enfermo.
 Los planes para sus hijos es que estudien,  por eso ellos le ayudan para que puedan cumplir sus metas, el dinero de la ayuda que recibe de su esposo lo invierte en la comida para sus hijos y el estudio de ellos.
texts.en:
Dora, age 33, only attended school through the first grade. Her husband is in the United States, but all their children live with her. They are in school, and do not work. She lives in her parents' house, but only her children are directly dependent on her.  Dora just works at the household chores. She needs this loan to cancel out a debt she obtained from another institution. It was used to grow a parcel of potatoes, but the harvest failed, and she couldn't pay off her debt due to a sick child.

Her plan is that her children will remain in school, and they help her so that they can all reach this goal. The money she gets from her husband is spent on food and school expenses for the children.

loans.use: pay off a debt to another institution.
